Reviews.Title: “Warning - this hotel is masquerading as a 3 star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Pmcasey007
Reviews.Content: This hotel is terrible and should not even be on this site. If you read the good reviews, please note many of these guests are from third world countries. Do not stay there unless you like small outdated rooms, poor service, no amenities, and false advertising. If it was not for the location and referrals from this site, this hotel would most likely go out of business. I have traveled all over the world and this is one of worst hotels we have ever stayed in. We were booked into a room that had about 1 meter walking space around the bed, no closet, poor mechanical system, poor bedding, a steam pipe running through the middle of the bathroom, decorated in ugly 1970's decor, and a dropped ceiling with lay-in fluorescent lighting. It was dark, dingy and smelly. We complained and were eventually moved to a better room. The better room was comparable to a Red Roof Inn or Motel 6. Do yourself a favor and DO NOT book this hotel. You are better off paying a little bit more and not getting ripped off by the false advertising this hotel puts out.

Reviews.Title: “The art of presentation is lost!”
Reviews.Author: notfromnyc
Reviews.Content: We drove into Koreatown knowing the value of the location, as we registered in to the hotel we were in the hands of a clerk who missed the course on how to welcome guests. We were given the key cards and waited patiently for 10 minutes for the elevator to come down from the third floor. As we entered the small room with 1980's decor and furnishings, gray wallpaper and flourescent lighting, led us to believe we were being "punked." The closet did not have a door, the bathroom appeared updated with the exception of the steam pipe/stripper pole exposed. The television was an old boxed Zenith and while a card advertised WiFi access, the truth being, you had to go downstairs to get access. Afraid to unpack, not knowing what was lurking above the lay-in ceiling and industrial ceiling tiles, we left our bags packed and contacted the travel agency. The agency was of no help as there is a non- refundable policy. Through our objections, and attestations that the room bore no resemblance to the renderings on their website, we were move to their best room. Their best room would be comparable to a room at a Motel 6. While clean, with updated fixtures, we were told they didn't have any wash clothes or hand towels. The best that could be said is that the location is great if you want to be close to shopping areas. .

Reviews.Title: “Great location on a budget”
Reviews.Author: WeeYinster
Reviews.Content: The Grand Union Hotel is a budget hotel. Modest but very clean. Great location. Walking distance to most places. Bath was pretty low so only took showers. We noticed in the fire exit map our room 405 was one of the bigger ones so can't complain. We were also not on the street side so our room was very quiet. Though only saw the other side of the block through the window. However there is only wi fi in the foyer which sucks really.

Reviews.Title: “I don't know what all the fuss is about”
Reviews.Author: Tinuks
Reviews.Content: While I agree that it's not the best hotel in the world but at the price and for the location, it's a very good bargain. Reception staff were extremely friendly and helpful. And the room while dated and on the small side was clean. The lift is slow but then it's the only one serving the building. To be honest, I almost didn't book this hotel after reading the reviews, but I'm glad I decided to take the chance. I am sorry if others had a bad experience but it's either I got lucky or my standards were lowered because I feared the worst. Anyhow I would stay there again if I'm on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for NYC standards - top location”
Reviews.Author: Janis81
Reviews.Content: Location for the hotel is excellent, nice walk to the main attractions and subway nearby. For the price you are paying in NYC you get good value (and zero bugs, which is nice). If you are looking a hotel where you can sleep and clean up, this is a place for you, if you are looking for a honeymoon dream, pay 250 dollars more for the night. Sorry for a late review, we were there Sep2010.

Reviews.Title: “A good, budget hotel with pros and cons.”
Reviews.Author: LucyAndChristopher
Reviews.Content: Firstly, bare in mind that the Grand Union Hotel is a BUDGET hotel, do not expect anything more than this. But! Although the hotel inexpensive, it is very good for the price you will pay. My fiancee and I booked the hotel through mybooking.com as we were happy with the price and the reviews that we read. Pros: - Location is fantastic, very close to Empire State Building, Flatiron district, Times Square, Macys and Grand Central. All within walking distance. - Near by Subways. - Good Deli's - Good house service (very polite maid) - Very clean - Comfortable bed - Big HD tv with cable (good for keeping up with the weather on NY1) - Secure (swipe cards for stairwells) and luggage holding room is free. - Little fridge that worked well - Hair dryer - Iron and ironing board Cons: - Air con is LOUD at times. - Some rooms have no views whatsoever - Thin walls - Reception staff are not approachable - Shower temp tended to fluctuate **Note** There is a fixed rate fee for taxi's taking tourists from JFK to Manhattan. The fee is $50 (includes toll) - The hotel booked a 'taxi' for our return to JFK which turned out to be a private car which turned up half an hour early. We were also charged $68 in stead of $50. We were not warned by the reception staff. We had no change as we expected a taxi where you can swipe a credit, debit or travel card. This resulted in a stressful dash to find an ATM that would accept one of our cards whilst rushing to get to our flight. Overall, a good, clean hotel that is affordable and in a great location. The double room was spacious and comfortable. My partner and I both agree we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: designerwine
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our honeymoon. Money was tight and this was about the only hotel within budget. It is an excellent location for most things - about 10 minutes walk from Times Square. Unless you are willing to pay big bucks for accommodation in New York don't expect luxury in any hotel. This is comfortable and clean but far from luxurious! We wern't in NY to stay in the hotel room so it suited us fine, all we needed was a bed. I would book this hotel again simply for the location. Oh and NY is fab!

Reviews.Title: “Nice comfortable hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: VeeBee80
Reviews.Content: Being New York, finding a nice hotel on a tight budget is hard. But this is a nice little hotel. The room was not very big. Our room had a double bed and a single bed, the bathroom was small but does the job I guess! Clean rooms and a great location!! O and don't expect any great views from your room window :)

Reviews.Title: “Location!!”
Reviews.Author: Linda F
Reviews.Content: It is soo close to everything! We stayed there for 5 nights and it was just great. You walk out of the door and you are just in the middle of everything. We couldnt even hear the traffic noise.would always go back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Susan311
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Grand Union was centrally located to major shopping areas and restaurants. My room was great, cleaned everyday clean sheets and towels. The staff was great and eager to assist me with all my questions about NY. I will be back during the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Think twice before booking it”
Reviews.Author: orik13
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located in walk distance from all major NYC sites. And probably this is the only advantage I can list here. Our Cons list is much longer: 1. Very old decor in the rooms (we had 2 connected rooms) with odor of dust 2. It was very difficult to operate with water taps in the bathroom. It required a lot of power to open a hot water 3. No WiFi in rooms. WiFi is available in the lobby only, but even there it's not easy to connect to the router. All people are walking in the lobby and switching chairs truing to get better signal. It's much easier to connect to WiFi from SiloCafe from other side of the street. 4. Room are very small and you really want to get out as soon as possible. 5. Heating system is very old and noisy. and leaking sometimes. 6. In our case we had no windows facing out (they were facing to inner "well") and so we never knew whether it was a sunny day.

Reviews.Title: “extremely happy”
Reviews.Author: bernard f
Reviews.Content: we stayed 15th - 20th december and we were thrilled, friendly staff, clean room, flat screen tv, lovely clean bathroom, great location, OVER THE MOON. Room was bigger, better, cleaner than we expected, properly chuffed

Reviews.Title: “mediocre.”
Reviews.Author: eccentriq
Reviews.Content: Summary of Pro/Cons (Full review below) Pro: Good location; close to Lexington Ave line (6) & Empire State Building Bar fridge Con: Oblivious staff Useless WiFi (only in Lobby) Linen can cause itching (possibly due to laundry detergent/powder) Horrible bathroom/hot water system Outdated decor After having researched this hotel in depth through several online sources, we decided to book this hotel for our holiday trip in NYC. What appeared to be an excellent choice with reference to tripadvisor and other sources, turned out to be a holiday wrecker. Essentially, don't trust every review on this website. Upon checking in, the hotel staff did not properly greet us nor did they offer us any assistance with the neighborhood. When actually getting to the room (located on upper floors) we were presented with a 60's decor room which was not renovated to appear 'modern' as advertised. The worst part about our stay was that the shower was approx 80x80cm in company with a hot water system that took 5mins+ for the first person to get a steady stream of hot water. Most of the time the temperature of the water was random, and was intermittent changing from extremely hot, to freezing cold. In addition to this, the complimentary WiFi was almost close to useless as it was only available in the lobby which never worked. The server had continuously rejected the guests attempt to connect. When querying the staff about why it did not work, they would just provide a generic excuse and blow it off. It was evident from many of the guests attempting to use the WiFi that they were also at the point of snapping. When it did work, it was acceptable. Although I would not recommend this hotel to anyone, some of the upsides were that it is close to the Lexington Ave line (6) and the Empire State Building (although you'll only visit this once).

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: JordanWR
Reviews.Content: I was staying with two friends here, having just come from another hotel/hostel that I loved - when I checked in and made it to the room I was a little surprised. From the hotel website, I noticed that they have NOT opted to go for a modern look, which is something that if updated, I think would attract more guests. HOWEVER, the service and the room itself was none to fault (mostly). We stayed in a 5 person bedroom - 1 queen bed, 1 double bed and one single, 2 televisions, 1 bathroom, no kitchen, small fridge, 2 luggage holder (could definitely put a few extras in there!) and a desk. - LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION was bloody fantastic... I had previously stayed on the upper East and West side of Midtown and was convinced that was the best place to stay... WRONG! Although we were on the brink of China town, location was phenomenal... Close to Empire State, Herald Square, Madison Square Gardens, Bryant Park (amazing) and Times Square. Found many places that I did not know existed! - The receptionists/concierge were very friendly and happily gave us advice on good restaurants in the area or directions - The bathroom, although small, was adequate with a nice, powerful shower - The heaters worked nicely - The maids were friendly and greeted us in the hallway which is always, always a lovely touch - Wifi was only accessible in the lobby HOWEVER we were luckily able to pick it up on our laptops as we were on the second floor - We had a small fridge that didn't work, it melted our ice-cream and froze our pasta FAULTS (always places to improve on) ... - Update bedding and furniture to something more modern - Improve security on windows - Enable wifi for each room (younger audience especially will appreciate this... Facebook!) - Fridge - Perhaps creating a small kitchenette?? Overall, 3.5/5 - we had no problems and were very happy! Don't be fooled by it's 1920's appearance!

Reviews.Title: “Dont believe bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: bellasnan
Reviews.Content: stayed in this hotel 1st to 6th December 2011 Hotel was spotlessly clean staff were freindly and helpful room was adequate we were on the 3rd floor bed was so comfortable and bathroom was fine their was no noise pollution at all we slept like babies location is excellent 5 mins from Empire State Building I could not find any faults at all with this hotel and would happily recommend it to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in the city!”
Reviews.Author: NancyJ422
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent two nights here. I am very familiar with the city so I really liked the location away from the noise and commotion of the Times Square area. It's 2 blocks from the Empire State Building and a couple more from Macy's AND the #6 is right at the end of the street on the corner of E. 32nd and Park Avenue. We were on the 7th floor, yes the elevator was a little slow but I've incurred slower with ALOT more people waiting. We kept the Do Not Disturb on the door during the day because we usually have stuff all over and didn't want the maid to have to work around it. We just hung the towels over the shower bar and they were dry the next day. Hair dryer is in bathroom. Only had a small bar of facial soap in the basket so if you want something more, bring your travel soap. Shower was great though. The rooms are dark but boy are they quiet! Since it was warm while we were there I put the AC on at night (a window unit which was great!). We slept great. Front desk was friendly, maids were friendly, it was busy in the internet room but never really saw or heard anyone in the halls. The Captain's Cafe is connected to the hotel and they serve breakfast which was very good. I will definitely use the Hotel Grand Union as my place to stay for future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Survived a hurricane.”
Reviews.Author: HemmoBosscher
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights with 2 friends of mine for our New York trip. Naturally, a hurricane hid and we were forced to stay inside for a whole day as the city shut down. The hotel was great though, the staff was friendly and the rooms were cleaned every day. The only downside is that I could not stand up straight in the shower, even though I'm not freakishly tall (6'3"), I have encountered this before however. Also, wifi only works on the lower floors and in the lobby, which is simply below par in 2011. All hotels should have accesible wifi for the convenience it offers at a low cost. All-in-all, we enjoyed our stay and recommend the hotel for its value and location.

Reviews.Title: “Lovey 4 night stay in October 2011”
Reviews.Author: Laneyloo
Reviews.Content: Have just had a lovely 4 night stay in a clean, comfortable double room at Grand Union. We were on the 6th floor, lift was fine (some previous reviews commented it was slow). Rooms were cleaned and towels replaced every day, bathroom was supplied with hairdryer and complementary toiletries - shower was amazing! There was plenty of storage, a mini fridge and a telly. The windows are a bit old and could probably do with replacing but it didn't bother us too much. We could see Empire State from our window. The location was brilliant, it took about 20 mins to walk to Times Square and 2 streets east of Macy's. We walked back to the hotel most nights and felt very safe. The staff on reception were very friendly and helpful. The Captain's Cafe next door served lovely breakfasts, we never managed lunch or evening meal there but the staff/owners were really pleasant and asked what we had planned for the day. For being a budget hotel we weren't sure what to expect, this hotel was lovely and if ever back in New York I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: WAIPUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 6 nights in October 2011 and found it to be excellent for our requirements. The bed was comfortable and the room was clean, the position to the subway was excellent and the front desk staff always friendly and obliging. The only thing that would be nice at the end of a tiring day walking and sightseeing would be to be able to make a cup of tea or coffee in the room. Other than that it was great value for money in a very expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in town! Ideal hotel for a few days in NYC!!”
Reviews.Author: 82Lottie
Reviews.Content: Read lots of reviews before leaving so was under no illusions when we arrived! Trip to NY was a present for my partners 40th and was keen to have a longer stay and compromise on the luxury! Tip- stated it was a special occasion to ensure a street view room and double bed! The room was perfect size and was very clean! There is only one lift which can be a pain of they decide to service it when you're trying to check out! Staff were friendly enough but helpful when we had problems! Location, location, location!! Couldn't have been better! Very much enjoyed our stay and would definitely recommend this if you're on a budget and are staying for a few days!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent in every way”
Reviews.Author: perth45
Reviews.Content: great location....stayed there twice so occupied different rooms...no problems in any way, clean, big enough rooms and bathrooms...I'd recommend this hotel to anyone with high standards....

Reviews.Title: “basic but in an ideal location”
Reviews.Author: roeboy
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights in september 2011 as a stop over before going to Hawaii. As a return visitor to New York we knew that we would spend very little time in the hotel itself and so the main focus was proximity to Penn St Station. The reason being that if you fly into Newark Liberty Airport then you can catch the air train and then the NJ Transat train to Penn St Station for a fraction of the cost that a taxi or transfer would cost. It is so simple to do and by the time you consider traffic, takes the same amount of time. The second factor was location and for what we wanted, the hotel was ideal. It is located 2 blocks from 5th avenue and all the shopping, a stones throw from the empire state and easy walking distance to the theatre district of broadway, times square and even central park. If walking aint your thing then when exiting the hotel you turn right and 1 block over there is a subway station that on the green line will take you all the way uptown or indeed all the way downtown as far a brooklyn bridge. The hotel itself was basic and slightly dated. Staff at reception were all foreign but very pleasant. There is only one lift and its slow. The room was a little on the grey and depressing side but spotlessly clean, with decent floor space for a NY hotel room and a more than adequate bathroom (good shower) We are a couple in our early 30s and are pretty easy going on accomodation standards so long as its clean and safe. This hotel certainly was. Unless budget is not a concern then my thinking is why waste money at an expensive hotel in a city where it would be a crime to not be out all day every day experiencing all it has to offer. One small tip for pizza lovers. Walk the brooklyn bridge to the brooklyn side, look at the view back to Manhattan and then head 5 min walk to Grimaldis Pizza Joint for what will be the best pizza you have ever tasted.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great city”
Reviews.Author: keri m
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Grand Union for 7 nights at the end of September 2011. We had a great time in New York, we got a cab to the hotel which cost about 70 dollars from Newark Airport and took about 40 minutes. This is a great hotel, very welcoming, comfortable and clean. Very central, 2 blocks from Empire State Building and 15 mintue walk from Times Square. We were very impressed considering the price of our room. Room was great, clean and spacious enough (for New York) The cafe downstairs has very friendly staff and great offers on beer =) Also they do a lovely omlette for breakfast. We would def stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Susan M
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor. This is an excellent budget hotel in a fantastic central location. The rooms were spotless and the bathroom & shower facilites were good. The rooms were cleaned every day and fresh towels and toiletries left each day. There are no real facilities at hotel, but this didn't matter too much as there were so many places to go and eat that it was not a problem. Only negatives were that the bathroom smelled of cigarette smoke and that some of the reception staff could have been a bit more helpful - but overall they were ok. The rooms are quite small but this is expected in a city and not really a big problem. I would definitely stay here again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Grace583
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here in Dec 2010.The hotel was good value when you take in consideration the fact it's NYC and it has a good location.The staff at reception are not the nicest; and they gave us "one of their largest rooms" as we paid by cash which I found quite weird.Thank god we got 1 of the largest rooms though;we got sneak peeks of the other rooms in the mornings when we were leaving and they were absolutely tiny! We were on floor 10 and at the back of the hotel so there was no noise at all at night.The rooms were spotless and upon investigating the mattress when we arrived,it was clear to see it was new-ish). There is only 1 elevator in the hotel; it is extremely slow and small. If you choose to take the stairs, you are in for a tight squeeze...they are so narrow.On our check out day, the elevator was out of service and my boyfriend had a rough time trying to get all the luggage down the stairs! There is a fab cafe next door to the hotel which is great for breakfast. Given the price for rooms and location, we would return again :)

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good, pretty expensive”
Reviews.Author: migo23
Reviews.Content: My trip was in march 2007. My first time in NY. It was a little expensive for the rooms that they offered but it was ok if you are just going to be there at night. ItÂ´s nearby a metro station and a little walk from Empire State and Midtown. It wasnÂ´t as clean as it could be, but enough! Great views from my window to the Empire State!!!

Reviews.Title: “budgey NYC near empire state building”
Reviews.Author: shaz_spikeuk
Reviews.Content: Stopped in Nyc for a trip in May 2011. Dated decor, but clean, comfotable and friendly, helpful staff. Great position near Empire State Building - a couple of blocks from Grand Central station and Macy's. Rooms not massive but in NYC you are only looking for a place to sleep and shower. Was not impressed by Captains Table cafe adjoining hotel but lots of places to eat near by. Try the seafood place in Grand Central too, great city and people.

Reviews.Title: “Good for its price”
Reviews.Author: Nienna82
Reviews.Content: It's very hard to find a hotel with reasonable prices in New York, but this was ok. The room isn't big, but it's not too small either. It was clean and there was a fridge. The location is excellent and Empire State Building is very near. The air-conditioning is very loud - if you are a light sleeper, it may be a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the price; excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Writerguysd
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here several times over the years. The quality of the place is always very good. Mind you the rooms are small and the bathroom is small as well, But, I'm not staying there other than to sleep; it's New York City, you're out and about. One reviewer said the hotel was dark. The photos of the lobby show it to be bright and that what it is. A person is not unpacking their bags in the lobby. Next door is a breakfast dinner with comfort food under $5. The location, you can't beat. On 32nd between Fifth Avenue and Madison. Two block to the subway, You are in the shadow of the Empire State Building. Walking distance to Koreatown. There's a small French restaurant two blocks away and one of my favorite places for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: travel10160766
Reviews.Content: Aside from the location - a block from the subway and withing walking distance of major tourist sights - there's no reason to stay here. The management is rude, the lobby is dark and dingy, the rooms are small with uncomfortable pillows and beds. In my opinion it's a dive masquerading as a 3-start hotel. It seems that the other guests are mostly non-US visitors who thought it would be a good deal. It's not a deal if it's a miserable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not a comfortable sleep”
Reviews.Author: AJM2011
Reviews.Content: If you looking for a good nights sleep may want to consider your comfort.... foam like mattress too soft and window air condition is less than 2 feet from bed...not an ideal place for a good night sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: trecev
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Grand Union from June 6-10,2011. We picked this hotel as per reviews from Tripadvisor and so far all the reviews were right. The hotel is right smack in the middle of everything. We had an easy time walking from the hotel to the subway stations. We also walked from the Times Square area after midnight and we did not encounter any problems. There are pharmacies nearby to buy basic needs like water, toiletries and stuff. A lot of restaurants nearby, we especially liked the Bonchon chicken that was just around the corner. We lucked out on the Korean restaurants though, the one we tried near the hotel wasn't really that great. The only problem we had with the hotel is that they only had 1 elevator, so sometimes it could get full. Also we had problems with the housekeeping, it happened not only once but twice that they would just go inside the room without even knocking! After that we always hanged a do not disturb sign at the door and we would place a chair to block the door just in case. Talk about rude! Carpets are also a little musty and on a first night I was afraid to sleep on the bed due to the old and scratchy comforter. They should replace it ASAP!

Reviews.Title: “I don't recommend!”
Reviews.Author: businesslady01
Reviews.Content: I stayed here, when I tried Priceline.com for a hotel. i couldn't get in to any hotel in NY for that time at a reasonable rate for me. I look for 3 star at least. I tried Expedia and was told it was a 3 star and great. It was not even close to a 3 star. It was maybe a 1 star! It was awful! I was embarrassed to stay there! The only good comment I have is that it was a clean room! To get into the hotel, the doors are not automatic and you must lug your suitcase up a few stairs. Someone from across the street, helped me, because I was struggling. You get in and the lobby is dingy at best. The one elevator is small and slow. The stairs are so steep and narrow, you don't want to go up and down and you would be unsafe during an emergency; in my opinion. When you get off the elevator, you barely have enough room for your luggage to go fit going down the hall, the halls are so narrow. You must go through sets of fire doors for rooms. They have the rooms in about 3 per fire door. I had to go through 2 fire doors. The walls are paper thin and I heard my neighbors every word; and they were not loud. The beds were outdated with the bed frames and bedding. It looked like they came from the late 1960's to early 1970's. There were bedspreads; not comforters and hiddious! The blanket was lime green and really ugly. There was no writing pad next to the bed with a pen. Every hotel has that. There was no kleenex in the bathroom. The towels were nice quality; I will give them that. The lighting in the room was from the ceiling as if it were a former office building now converted to a hotel. It was awful. What lamps they had were not great. There was a small travel ironing board that you had to pull out from the wall, like a hide-a-bed. That was laughable! There was no gym at the hotel and no room service. You had to go and get it yourself; downstairs in a dingy cafe joining the hotel. I paid a lot of money for this and I usually pay less for a 3.5-4 star hotel. It was awful! I would never stay there again and it was embarrassing having to be there!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value for the money!”
Reviews.Author: jzgreens
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located just 2 blocks from the Empire State Building and Macy's! Great value for the money. Rooms are old, but big enough. The shower head in our bathroom was not properly attached and came off when attempting to move it. Bathroom was small but workable. Would recommend if you're looking for a no frills stay in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Emmytots
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, 2 blocks from the empire state, you can see it as soon as you step out of the hotel. ten minute walk to times square. the rooms are big by NY standards but ours was dark due to our window facing an adjacent wall. Decor was outdated but very clean and comfortable. Cab fare is about $80 each way hotel to airport (we flew into Newark & out of JFK but cab fare was still $80 for both airports) i would recommend a cab rather than shuttle buses, with NY traffic shuttle buses can take hours!! the hotel staff were great upon departure, they held our cases and arranged our cab ride to the airport. The Staff were great generally. i would recopmmend this hotel for a cheaper option in NY.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely recommended”
Reviews.Author: memo33
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife traveled to NYC for the first time and stayed at Hotel Grand Union in May 2011 for 6 nights. Here is my review : Room rate : we had reserved our room about 1,5 months prior our stay and I can say that the room rate was quite reasonable compared to other similar hotels in the area... Location : on 32nd street between Madison and Park Avenues... Location is great , especially at this price range. Only 1,5 blocks from Empire State - 2 blocks from Macy's and about 15-17 minutes walking to Times Square (of course without any stops on the way) and many other attractions (including 5 mins walk to double-decker sightseeing bus stop)...there are 3 Subway stops very close to the hotel at about 2 mins walking distance ... Hotel Staff & Room Service : they were very helpful and friendly all the time... we were able to leave our luggages (2 mid, 2 large-sized pieces ! ) for almost whole day last day (our flight was at midnight) in a separate/locked/dedicated 'luggage room'... they arranged a shuttle (actually a limo for only two of us) to JFK (almost at the same price as a regular yellow-cab ;) ... We only needed Room Service once when we asked for additional towels and we were delivered quickly... Room : ours had one small window without any view... it was at the back of the hotel... could be a little depressing for some but the plus side was having NO street noise at all... Bed size&comfort was also great .. So we had very comfortable sleep... Room size was just enough for two of us... we arrived with two mid-size luggages and after having made some shopping after 3 days, there was just about 1,5 m2 left in the room to move... size&view of the room did not bother us because we were leaving the room around 9 a.m and returning back at around 11 pm everyday... but if you are planning to spend time in the room, then room size might bother you ... (see the photos) Cleanliness: NO bedbugs, NO strange odour (like some reviews mentioned) whatsoever ... Our room was cleaned every day... the sheets were changed two-three times during our 6-nights-stay, which I think is reasonable... And bathroom/toilet was cleaned everyday ... Restaurant: we had breakfast once at Captain Cafe which is next-door and like a part of the hotel... breakfast was good but we wanted to try out different places everyday as there are many other deli's - cafe's in the neighborhood... you should eat at Captain Cafe at least once... Suggestion: if you are at or close to the hotel at lunch time, there is Silo Cafe right across the street... it is packed with people (a good sign for having fresh food) and has various alternatives to eat ... not recommended for breakfast though as food is not as fresh as what is served in Captain Cafe (which is also cheaper)... If you like sushi, you should try 'Umi Sushi' on 31st street on Park Ave ... great sushi at reasonable prices... only 3-4 mins walking from the hotel. 'lobster cha-cha roll' is a must-eat there :) Final word : this is a basic but clean hotel with a great location. What we liked best was the location & hotel staff -- what we liked least was having NO free internet (wi-fi) in the room... but anyway, definitely recommended !

Reviews.Title: “Buyer beware”
Reviews.Author: NicWoosh
Reviews.Content: How disappointing! I use Trip Advisor for all my travel decisions now and this is the first time the reviews let me down. When I booked the hotel was 3 stars with glowing reports about how fab it was and lots of repeat users. This is the main reason why I've given it a 2 - its not poor just didn't meet the expectations set by other reviewers. What it is is very clean and in a great location, round the corner from Empire Tower and roughly in the middle of Manhattan. It was also quiet - although I sleep with ear plugs to be safe - except for the odd noisey neighbour (residential I think) it lived up to that possibly because there were no windows to mention - just a tiny slither in both bed & bathroom. On arrival externally looks OK on entry looks like a youth hostel to me - check out their website as it is representative and clearly states budget hotel. There is a cafe annexed which we didn't visit - not for me. However there is an amazing cafe/diner around the corner on Madison right next to the Deli (left out the front & right at first corner in the middle on opposite side). The Diner is not stylish or anything and looks like a typical diner, however staff were great, food is excellent (best breakfasts in the US and we travelled) so use it if staying here. So there were 3 of us in one room and unfortunately you could not swing a cat in the remaining space or bathroom for that matter. There was no room safe either although expect you can leave stuff in reception. Its not that cheap, then again it is NY, so decide what is important when you book - location, style or amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for Price”
Reviews.Author: Dunku
Reviews.Content: We stayed there on St. Patrick's Day when Hotels were selling at a premium and were able to find an affordable rate here for NYC. Our room was not much to look at, but it was clean, the bed was really comfortable and bathroom was clean. And best of all...no bed bugs. Staff was friendly and helpful when we needed them to be. Diner next door - Captain's Cafe was good for breakfast and the owner, Tony, was very nice and friendly. We had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Awful, horrible kip”
Reviews.Author: Goodmouse
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in august 2010, after a long flight the receptionist was the first American we spoke to. We stood in the lobby for a number of moments, being ignored only to get beckoned by the receptionist by his finger. The man hardly said two words to us. Never welcomed us to the hotel, NYC or anything. We got up to the room, and dropped off or stuff, we had no intentions of staying in the hotel any longer than we had to. The entire room, floors Walls and ceiling is a horrid grey colour. The bed clothes are old and taty. We had a giant tv in the room which is as old as me. The window looked out onto a dirty brick wall. I would never stay here again, I wouldn't let my dog sleep here.

Reviews.Title: “nice place, definitely would go there again”
Reviews.Author: Dgotteron
Reviews.Content: It is in the area of Koreatown which is a very nice and lovely neighborhood. It's a wonderful place and close to the times square. It's calm and safe. Nothing special but that's enough in NY because you are out anyway the whole day. Clean, gentle, helpful, anytime again. I stayed already 3 times in this hotel and would definitely come back again. Keep on doing like that!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, ok hotel - what i expected”
Reviews.Author: unz_10
Reviews.Content: Staying here for 4 nights in november, check in went smooth, i did request a non-smoking room but there was a bit of a smoke smell. Room was lovely, nice big bed, tv with plenty of channels, bathroom was very small but not an issue, temperature of water in shower was hard to get right sometimes, we were up early every morning so didnt seem to be a problem. Lift was only thing that was annoying. Our room was on the 9th floor and it was quicker to actually use the stairs than the lift, no big deal really! We got what we paid for really. Although no hotel is cheap in NYC it was alot cheaper than many other hotels for the location - which was brilliant. I would definitely stay here again. The cafe in the lobby - Captain Cafe serve great breakfasts, we went there every morning and really looked forward to it! yum :)

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely great location”
Reviews.Author: 186356Helen
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 5 nights in New York. The location was great for just about everything. The hotel was clean and friendly. It was a small room with its own bathroom which is a luxury for the price we paid. Round the corner was the empire state building and walking distance from broadway, times square and quite a few other places. It had a iron and hairdryer which I was surprised by.The only down side is it had no tea making facility and was quite noisey at night - but for a city that doesn't sleep we didnt mind. It was great for the money it cost and would go back again should i ever get the chance.

Reviews.Title: “basic”
Reviews.Author: shep196156
Reviews.Content: room pretty basic, take ear plugs just in case your at the front of the hotel lots of traffic noise. fantastic location, really good cafe next door. if your landing at newark airport and stopping at this hotel don't waste your money on taxi's get the train to penn station only takes 25 mins then 10 min walk to the hotel it costs $12.50 one way. all in all we had a really good time and would probably use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: mzgjc
Reviews.Content: i didn't know what to expect after hearing all those stories about bed bugs, but i sure must say on a scale of 1-5 for cleanliness, i would give it a 5. the housekeeping for excellent. my room was on the 10th floor at the back of the hotel which is good cause it was pretty quiet. comfortable bed, clean toilets. the lift is slow as hell so there were times i ended up takin the stairs. reception is friendly. the location for good. its so close to the subway, empire state building, 10 mins walk to times square, madison square garden etc. captain's cafe which is on the 1st level of grand union serves nice coffee with great service. my overall stay was a pleasant one. i simply loved it and i would definitely go back there when im back in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Dyhre
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is cosy and clean and is located in a quiet area. We lived at the ninth floor and thank god for the elevator, even though is was very slow and we sometimes gave up waiting and went down the stairs. The room was small and a bit dark - but it was clean and the housekeeping were very friendly. The hotel manager wasn't too friendly and outgoing - he could do a better job, for sure. Overall is was an awerage stay. The location (near 5th ave and empire state building) was great and subway stations were very near. If you can afford something better, then go somewhere else. If not, then this hotel is fine it you're planning a sightseeing trip to NYC and if you just need a place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, exactly what we expected”
Reviews.Author: smoodle
Reviews.Content: We stayed with 2 teenage boys, our room had a double & 2 singles, there was enough room for us all by New York standards. The room was pretty much what we expected after reading other reviews, nothing fancy, clean room, desk service okay, the best thing was the location. So close to everything, 10 minute walk to Times Square, Macys. 2 blocks from Empire State Bldg. Only downside was no coffee/tea making facility. Beds were comfortable for the price we paid. We would stay again. The room we had was at the back of the hotel and very quiet, there was no street noise at all.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location! safe and clean. Strongly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Bockie_Buu
Reviews.Content: Lovely situated near Times square with excellent breakfast-deliÂ´s around the corner. Nice helpful staff and clean rooms with working ACÂ´s. Very good prices for doublerooms with private bathrooms!!!! perfect. Noisy as any N.Y-hotel, but no problems as long as you use earplugs:)

Reviews.Title: “Good location - not a good sleep!”
Reviews.Author: dgbham
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is ideal, close to empire state building and a nearby subway and shops. The air conditioning in the rooms though is extremely loud so couldn't really sleep if you left it on, so tended to switch it off and put up with the heat. However, you cant switch off the street noise which doesn't seem to be dulled at all by the windows! The rooms themselves are functional if a bit dated and relatively clean, and for around Â£140 a night its not the best value around. The cafe/diner attached offered reasonable good food and great service.

Reviews.Title: “One year later.......still perfect!!!”
Reviews.Author: webbyj06
Reviews.Content: One year on from my last visit to this hotel and it is still the great place that I reviewed last year. The location is perfect (just a block and a half from Empire State and a 30 second walk to the 33rd St Subway station. A 10-15 minute walk to Times Square). The room we got was actually directly opposite the room we had last year....the difference being that this time it faced onto the street which gave me concerns about possible noise in the early hours that I had heard about........turned out to be not a problem! The rooms are small, but as I have said before....you don't go to NYC to stay in your room! The bed was large and comfortable, the TV had plenty of channels for when you were in the room, the hanging space for clothes, whilst not immense, was fine....with enough draw space. The bathroom was clean with toilet, wash basin, and shower over the bathtub. The shower was again powerful and easily adjusted to whatever temp you required. The Air-Con was a real boon given the temps on the first 3 days were 93, 98 and 96 degrees! On the one occasion when a problem did occur with the water (it turned out that there was a pressure problem which effected the whole hotel) the staff leaped into action and were immediately on the phone to get it fixed (on a Sunday!). By the time we returned, all was fine again. I cannot give high enough praise to the staff. From the front desk to the cleaning staff, they were top notch and friendly (in particular the cleaners, who without fail would greet you with a cheery "good morning" if you passed them in the corridors). The free safety deposit boxes behind the front desk was great for peace of mind and they were very secure. They could only be opened with the key given to yourself and one from the front desk staff on duty. One SMALL downside is the elevator, which is slow. I would always walk DOWN the 3 flights of stairs rather than take the chance of standing around on the off chance that the elevator would be in the vicinity of my floor....but if waiting a for a minute or two for the elevator to take you UP to your room is going spoil your holiday, then perhaps the Hilton or The Waldorf would be better for you. The adjoining Captain Cafe serve great breakfasts (although I did tend to go to Miss K's deli around the corner on Madison for a more 'local' feel whilst having my Egg on a Roll, large cup of coffee and read of the New York Post.....it just felt more Noo Yawk!) The internet at the hotel is a little pricey, but it works fine if you need to use it. I also do believe that they have free wi-fi connection on offer, but seeing as I didn't take any wi-fi enabled devices with me, then I can't comment on how well this worked. The subway along the street runs both uptown and downtown, although it should be noted that it is a 'local stop' and only the 6 train stops there. No problem....they were frequent and transferring to other lines is easy. The subway system is superb (be aware that whilst standing on the platforms waiting for a train, it is very hot....but the carriages are A/C'd). I travelled on the system to various parts of the city from early morning to very late at night and never once felt threatened. Just absorb the New York vibe and run with it....it's GREAT! The people, whilst in a hurry, were always courteous and friendly.....with basic manners such as "please", "thank you", "excuse me" and "sorry" (if they bumped into you....with an additional "sir" if they were remotely younger than you!) came readily from their lips. I'm now back home completely shattered from the experience.......this is my 3rd visit to NYC and I wouldn't have it ANY other way. If you come home from a visit to this city relaxed......then you ain't doing it properly!!! I love this city....and I love this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location for a good price”
Reviews.Author: Sophie105
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at grand union in a room for 4; The bathroom was very small for 4 people but we managed to get ready in time every morning. The rooms are small but just big enough. If you just need an hotel to sleep the rooms are big enough. if you want to spend some time in your hotel you might find it to small. The airco makes some noise but after one night I got used to it. We got a room at the back of the hotel and we had no view but also no noise from the street. You could easily switch off your airco without your room getting to hot during the night. This way you could avoid the noise completely. Our toilet got blocked once due to our own fault. The staff came to help us immediately. They were very friendly and were always helpful. We asked to each pay our part of the bill and that was nog problem at all. They were always there to give us good adresses to eat or drink something. The rooms are cleaned every day and the service is very good. Internet is expensive but we could easily connect to free unprotected wifi in the room. So you could try this if you don't want to spend money on internet. If you don't need much this hotel is perfect. The location is amazing. You are within walking distance of the empire state building, times square, penn station,... and there is a subway station on the corner. We payed $1000 for 5 nights for 4 people. I would definitely recommend this hotel. If you decide to go you have to visit Captain cafe next to the hotel. The people there are so nice and the food is amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Disfuncional and Poor Standard”
Reviews.Author: KennyDeed64
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 2 nights and we didn't have to wait long before problems started. Our room - which was a non-smoking room, stank of stale cigarette smoke. The Remote Control refused to work. AC was very loud and disrupted sleep frequently. Toilet was blocked upon our arrival, as after 1st flush the bathroom floor flooded under an inch of dirty water. Our shower didn't work as the water merely trickled out. We reported these problems to staff who couldn't have cared less - Remote was never fixed; toilet wasn't even looked at. We bought a calling card to make phone calls. We had to pay a $50 deposit before the line was opened up. They very reluctantly returned this deposit, although refused to return it all. They now claimed we owed $1.50 just for having the phone in our room. Isn't that what we pay our room charge for? The Hotel charged $5 for 3 hours Internet usage in their lounge. This has to be 3 hours consecutively. Who pays to travel to New York for a weekend to sit for 3 hours on the Internet? In summary our stay was not a pleasant stay, there were so many things wrong with the room and Hotel. Unfortunately the staff failed to address any of these issues.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Stevelin67
Reviews.Content: Spent a week in the Grand Union and had a great time. If you're looking for a reasonably priced central hotel, then this is the one for you. When we arrived we were allocated a back room, which had no view but was very quite. We asked if we could be moved to a front facing room and although we couldn't move that day the staff at reception said they would try to move us the next day. They were very helpful and true to their word next day we were given room 504 which was brill, looked out on to the street with views of the ESB and Madison Ave. The room was cleaned every day with fresh towels and the cleaners were very friendly. All staff in hotel were very nice and we really enjoyed our stay in the Grand Union, and if we every return would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Erik12321
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we stayed at the Grand Union hotel but the first with our kids! After exploring around on Tripadvisor for another hotel we choosed to stay at GraqndUnion once more. Last stay was in march 2008 and nothing has changed. Still a very clean hotel in a great neighbourhood. The service isnÂ´t why you should choose the hotel, they have a lot to improve on that subject. But for us we had no need for any special service from the hotel, just a clean with a reasonable price. I higly recommend this hotel for your new york visit!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: NineFrames
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location just a couple blocks away east of Korea town. It is also right next to one of the train locations so it makes getting around the city easy. The rooms were well priced, the room clean and had more space that I expected considering it is new york. If you are looking for a solid stay without all the extras, this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location Perfect Perfect Perfect”
Reviews.Author: NikNikScotland
Reviews.Content: Just back yesterday from NY and stayed in the Grand Union Hotel for 4 nights. We arrived at Newark International airport Thurday afternoon and grabbed a cab outside straight away. Taxi ride was an adventure in itself lol. Arrived at the hotel no probs and it looks really nice from the outside and we were allocated room 302 which is at the front of the hotel. The room was basic but clean and that's exactly what I was looking for. Bathroom was lovely and the shower was amazing. When you stand outside the hotel and look up your met with a spectacular view of the Empire State Building. I was always under the impression that the blocks in NY were long but I was wrong because really everything you need to see is within walking distance and being next to the Empire State Building was amazing. We pretty much walked everywhere including all the way up to Central Park. I would definitely recommend this hotel if you are looking for a basic, clean and centrally located hotel and if it cost an extra $400 i'd probably pay it no probs just because where it is. The only issue I had was the fact that you can hear outside traffic and a couple of nights it went on until 4am in the morning and then all of a sudden it was quiet. We ate in the captain cafe attached to the hotel and the pancakes were exactly what you get in the movies with a big dod of butter at the size of the plate (yum yum). I was also recommend that you take a bus tour (hop on/off). There's tonnes of guys at the side of the streets who will try and get you to buy a bus tour ticket and I have to admit that at first I was really apprehensive about booking but decided to give it a bash so we opted for Gray Lines Tour Operator who charge $88 dollars for a 2 day pass and included in this price is entry to the 86th Observation Floor of the Empire State Building, ferry to Ellis Island and Liberty Island. You also get to hop on and off the bus at all your favourite spots i.e Time Square, Central Park, Macy's etc... and they also run a 2 hour tour of NY at night in which you cross the Manhattan Bridge to Brooklyn which was def the best bit. The tour guides are extremely knowledgeable and very funny. This was excellent valve for money... All in all everything was perfect about this trip and if you want to save a bit of cash getting back to Newark airport go to penn station at Madison Square Gardens and there's a train every 15 mins that takes you direct to the airport at a fraction of the cost. Honestly can't wait to go back..

Reviews.Title: “I have stayed on this hotel twice now, in...”
Reviews.Author: Karenlovesnewyork
Reviews.Content: I have stayed on this hotel twice now, in 2008 and 2009. It is fantastic value for money, very conveniently located and immaculate. The rooms are quite small, but that's what you expect in New York. The shower was very powerful, and the fridge in the room was very handy. Going back again to this hotel later this year, and have recommended it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, but clean, and centrally located.”
Reviews.Author: RCG20
Reviews.Content: Just spent five nights at the Grand Union with two friends. We each had individual rooms, which gave us an opportunity to view a variety of rooms. We occupied rooms 401, 601, and 602, of which 401, and 601 were towards the back, which meant we had a fantastic view of an enclosed courtyard, and air-conditioning units, the up-side was these two rooms had a bath. Room 602 afforded a view of 32nd Street, but lacked a bath. Of the three rooms, 401, and 601 were very quiet, unless the air-conditioner is turned on, in which case it can be pretty noisy, the same can be said about 602. As 602 is on the street side, you will also be treated to all of the noises of the city. The rooms were clean when we got there, and were cleaned every day. As mentioned by some other reviewers, the rooms were not massive, and lacked wardrobes, tea/coffee making facilities, and ironing facilities. The did however have a small fridge. The staff were friendly and very helpful, and extremely prompt when we needed anything. They were happy to answer our questions, and offered to sort out our transport to the airport, at the end of our stay. The Hotel is in a great location, being a short walk from the Empire State Building, Time Square, a few bar/restaurants, and a Subway station at the end of the block. As we only wanted a basic, clean place to throw our bags, and sleep, this hotel suited us, and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: BaronTR
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Grand Union with a couple of friends, and found it a good deal for the money. Pros: The location is good. There's a subway stop at the end of the block, and the Empire State building and Macy's/Herald Square aren't far away. I also felt safe walking back to the hotel at night. We had a quad room with a full bed and 2 twin beds for 3 adults, and there was a decent amount of space to work with. I would also note that this was the best deal we found in NYC for 3 beds of any size. The cafe attached to the hotel was nothing special, but the food was decent and not badly priced. There are also multiple places to eat close by. Cons: We could never fully get the radiator turned off, and had to run the AC to keep the temperature down. There was one occasion when one of us wanted to take an afternoon shower and the hot water never came on. They also needed a larger trash can. There isn't much right by the hotel, especially after dark, so you do have go elsewhere for nightlife. Bottom line: It's not a memorable hotel, but it was reasonably priced and located, and I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: webbyj06
Reviews.Content: I've been meaning to write a review of this hotel ever since we went....I don't know why I have taken so long seeing as we stayed for 6 nights way back in September of '09. As everybody mentions, it is in a brilliant location, within walking distance of many of the sights of Manhattan. If you need to go further afield, then there is a Subway no more than 30 seconds along E32nd Street (it's actually 33rd St station) and the line takes you uptown or downtown....perfect. The staff were extremely helpful and courteous....the lobby area was spotless and bright.....use of a personal lobby safe was a real boon.....the fridge in the room very handy.....superb shower which had the hardest hitting jets that I've ever come across. The room is on the small side, but it's only for laying down your head when you aren't hitting the bright lights! We had a back room (which seems the best place), so we had no view to speak of...only the air shaft/courtyard and a view of other windows.....No Matter! It was cleaned every day and we had absolutely no complaints about it. The Captains Cabin next door is a great place to breakfast, but there are also a number of diners on Madison and Park. Would I stay there again?........YES! September of this year!.....I can't wait.

Reviews.Title: “Value for location”
Reviews.Author: aye123
Reviews.Content: Basic room but clean, good shower 2 minute walk to the empire state building, great cafe next door for irish breaksfast and very cheap. Perfect if you will be spending your holiday out of the hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: batiast1
Reviews.Content: the location of the hotel is excellent, it's close to everything intresting in the city. all the staff is very friendly and caring, helped us in finding places and transportation. the room is very basic for someone who's only there to sleep and is traveling all day long. the price is amazing for that time of the year... so for calculation i recommend this hotel for anybody that plans on traveling all day in the city and come back at the evening to sleep and relax in a comfy and clean room and bed.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location, would use this hotel again and again :-)”
Reviews.Author: nicv08
Reviews.Content: Have finally gotten round to writing my review. We stayed at this hotel in February for 1 week, the same week as the blizzards which hit the East Coast. I have to say that it was a fantatsic choice (by myself I might add, lol). I was worried as the previous reviews were slightly mixed, but honestly this Hotel is great. It is in a fab location, situated between Madison and Park Avenue. You can literally walk to loads of attractions, and the ESB can be seen from the front windows. There's a subway to the right of the Hotel (as you leave) which runs up and down town. The rooms are a great size and the bed was very comfy. We were on the second floor, above the main entrance. It did get quite hot in the room, as there seemed to be a water pipe which ran through the room and it kicked in early in the morning, heating the room to the point where I had to open a window. There was also a lack of hangers, this may not be an issue to some people though. The shower is great and the water was always hot. There is a cafe, Captains Cafe, attached to the hotel. This is ACE, great food and service. We had breakfast here every morning, and it set us up for the day!! There is also a fab 24 hour deli on Madison, 2 minute walk from the Hotel. This was great for coffee and snacks. I went there most mornings at about 6am, as I could not get my sleep pattern in sync at all, lol. All in all, the hotel was great and would, without a doubt, stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - but would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: vicki_d2009
Reviews.Content: We went to NYC for s short stay this February. We have been several times before, and know that the hotel doesn't have to perfect as we spend most of the day out and about and the hotel is basically a base for sleeping. To this end, we booked at hotel Grand Union - the location was brilliant, very close to Midtown, and easily within walking distance of all the tings we wanted to do. However - the room was really hot all the time, as two uncovered heating pipes went though our room, and so blasted out heat all day and all night, the one window in the room opened into an air shaft, which was very noisy and very dark, and with the curtains closed we could not tell if it was light or dark outside which was quite disorientating when we woke up in the morning - also, the view directly opposite our window was a dead pigeon on a window ledge! The bed was extremely uncomfortable, it was so soft and unsupported that with myself and my husband in it, the mattress went into a 'V' shape and left us both in the middle of the bed, unable to sleep properly. It did have an en-suite bathroom, but the shower had no water pressure what so ever. The staff however, were very friendly and helpful, and there are computers in the lobby so we had access to the internet when needed, which was very useful. Regardless of the excellent location, I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: broddles2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Grand Union in October for a short stay, the location is great, walking distance to the Empire State Building, Penn Station , Madison Square Gardens and Masseys. The room was very small as was the shower, very hard ro move in it. The noise at night in the street below was deafening and seemed to go on for hours. Great breakfast place opposite, but not open in the evenings. There are no porters to help with luggage, and steps into the hotel. makes it a bit of a struggle when you are on your own, I think there are better places than this one.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: fifimcgee
Reviews.Content: stayed here last easter for 5 days and was quite wary of the hotel due to its low rating, and wondered if the location would be safe etc. when we arrived i was still apprehensive but it was just off a busy main street andthere was plenty going on in the vicinity. reception was basic but fine, staff helpful, lift was a bit dodgy but fine. our room i think was on the third floor and at the front and as others said it was very noisy. we wore ear plugs and didnt find it toooo much of a problem. we could see the empire state building from the room which ithought was pretty amazing! it really felt like i was in new york. we walked alot and used the subway which was easy. the room was either too hot or too cold but we didnt mind, bathroom was great and it wasnt as small as i had thought. i would definetly stay here again and recommend to anyone who knows what to expect when travelling on a budget. (too me it was similar to travel lodge!)

Reviews.Title: “basic no frills clean accommodation”
Reviews.Author: libby1471
Reviews.Content: have just returned from NYC where my daughter and myself stayed at Hotel Grand Union. We normally book into one of the bigger hotels but as we were a bit skint after the cost of Christmas we booked into a cheaper option. Great location, friendly staff both in hotel and in the Captain'scafe,daily maid service, very clean and a brilliant high powered shower. Down side was noisy radiators , drab rooms and a musty smell off top bed cover. If you are looking for a cheap, basic no frills accommodation in a great location this is the place to book into.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and free of problems - perfect for tourism visit”
Reviews.Author: Dsgnr
Reviews.Content: My main goal in selecting a NYC hotel was avoiding b-d b-ugs. My internet research had suggested that almost all NYC hotels have been afflicted with no distinctions as to price of room. I sure wanted to avoid both bites while visiting - - and transportation of anything back to my home. Internet reviews and comment boards indicated no problems reported at this hotel and, indeed, this was my experience. Following advice I got on the 'net I carefully examined the room when we arrived. It appeared to be perfectly clean and, thankfully, we had no issues during our 3 night visit. And, nothing brought home in our luggage. With this concern gone I was free to enjoy the great location. I will return to this hotel on my next visit. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Not so grand”
Reviews.Author: rugbyleaguefan
Reviews.Content: room on the 3rd floor very small, badly fitting windows, no wardrobe or hanging space at all for clothes. Situated on East 32nd st, very close to Empire State Building with good subway nearby. Very noisy outside with Fedex and UPS almost next door to hotel, large vehicles delivering all night. New Yorkers are very vocal. Very basic washing facilities. Will not use again. On the plus side rooms clean and room service every day.

Reviews.Title: “Not for luxury or romance but perfect for a girlie shopping trip!”
Reviews.Author: EW2810
Reviews.Content: I travelled to NYC with 3 girlfriends for a shopping trip and as such we weren't looking for a luxury hotel, just somewhere clean and comfortable to stay. We were all sharing one room to keep the costs down. I was worried the hotel was only 2*, but this one had good reviews, so we took a chance and were not disappointed. The room we had was very spacious and had 2 singles and one double bed - i was worried that 4 girls in one room would mean we were tripping over each other, but this was not an issue. The beds were very comfortable and clean. The bathroom was fine and the towels were changed everyday. The common parts of the hotel are not pretty or plush but as I say we only wanted somewhere to sleep. Excellent location, 2 blocks from Macys and the Empire state building and within walking distance of the other shops on 5th avenue. The one bad thing I have to say is that the radiator in our room was very load on the first night, very clunky and a lot of running water noise and it did keep me awake. In the morning I had a look at it and turned it off and it was fine after that and the room was not too cold either, so only a small issue. I also overheard another guset complaining about this in reception - but as i say with the radistor off it was not an issue. I don't give many hotels 5*, but for what I was looking for on this trip it ticked all the boxes, so I can't fault it.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and great location.”
Reviews.Author: Falool23
Reviews.Content: Hotel was ideal for budget city break. No frills, just basic room, tv, air con and en-suite. Room was clean with daily maid service. The room we stayed in was a reasonable size (10th floor), no view as we were at the back of the building, but was quiet. Like others have said, it's ideal if all you're going to do is sleep and somewhere for a quick change before dinner. The cafe next door was ideal for breakfast - we ate there every morning. Lovely, friendly staff. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing, dirty rooms”
Reviews.Author: travel876543
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly encouraged by various trip advisor reviews that this hotel was clean, pleasant, and offered value for money. Whilst it's location, in particular to the Empire State building which is a 5 minute walk cannot be denied, the rooms and service were lacking. Our room was not clean, we had dirty sheets and hair on our pillows. We requested new bedding and were given 3 pillow cases from a cupboard. No apology from staff, and no one seemed particularly bothered. The reception staff appeared mostly bored, and while they would answer queries, it wasn't exactly with any enthusiasm. Would not stay here again or recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Not great hotel, but worth it for the price and location”
Reviews.Author: Claire166
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 days in September. It was cheap and pretty much what you would expect- small rooms with basic amenities, small lift, no real view..................but hey, this is New York. If you only plan to spend time in the room to get changed and sleep, and want to do lots of sightseeing, it is perfect. Several subway stops nearby so you are close to every line. It is literally around the corner from the Empire State Building and a very short walk away from Macy's, Grand Central Station and the Crysler and flat iron buildings. Despite the hotel being very basic, the staff are lovely and do everything to make your stay as pleasurable as possible (within the limitations of a cheap hotel) I would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Got what I paid for..”
Reviews.Author: kbuddy86
Reviews.Content: Pros: great location; cheap Cons: dingy lifts; small and poorly ventilated bathrooms; our room's heater could not be turned off (even with the help of hotel staff) so we had the A/C on as well in order to sleep "comfortably"

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Friendly Helpful Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MrsA094
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, friendly staff. Excellent location, just off Broadway. Rooms were clean and newly decorated. Would definitely stay again. Great Diners and Coffee Shops within a couple of minutes walk.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money!”
Reviews.Author: richardslater
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back from my second visit to New York. Last year I treated my wife to a stay at an up town "posh"(expensive) hotel for her 60th. This year,we took our two daughters (both in their 20's) and we had an equally great time. This hotel was completely different but it did the trick. Our room was a quadruple. It was at the rear and therefore didn't have a view, but who cares? When you come in after a hard day sight-seeing, all you want to do is sleep....The room was clean, had a great shower, towels were changed every day and the beds made. The hotel is only a few yards from the nearest metro subway, but you can walk up to Times square in about 15 mins. Breakfast places were very close and very reasonable! The staff were consistently friendly and helpful. I would certainly use this hotel again on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap And Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: Stevie066
Reviews.Content: This Midtown hotel is fine if your a solo traveller or on a buget. The staff are very quiet but helpful. The room is big enough for 1 or 2 adults and is clean and tidy but this is not a hotel to relax in and enjoy the amenities its somewhere to rest your head and thats about it. The location is very good its very close to the Empire state building, Macys and a short trip to Times Square(AMAZING). If you want to visit other areas in the city then there are always cabs and the subway. I enjoyed my short stay at this hotel but next time I visit NYC I intend to splash out and stay at one of the hotels in Times Square or up by Central park which are alot more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: sarahb73
Reviews.Content: The room was clean, but the bedding was worn and should be replaced. I did not check whether my room was facing the street and I wish I had. It was very noisy and I hardly slept, so take ear plugs just in case. The staff were friendly and very helpful. It's location wasn't bad. It takes approximately 30 mins to walk from the hotel to Radio City Music Hall. I would recommend this hotel to those who are not fussed and just want a place to sleep, or for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel! Great Location and Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Amy_ward
Reviews.Content: After reading some reviews on the site, we were rather nevous of what to expect However we found the hotel perfect and have recomended it to friends! Check in was fast, and we was given a large family room (1 double and 2 twin beds) the amount of space in the room was great, the bathroom was clean. The rooms were cleaned everyday, new towels and toilettes were left everyday. Luckly we had a back room, so it was quiet. The hotel is in great walking distance to many sights! Such as the Empire State building, it is around a 15 minute walk to Times Square, and is near the subways. Many people on here have commented on the lack of customer service from reception, however we found them no problem, if acknowledge them, then they will acknowledge you. The only downside to the rooms, was although there was a fridge in the room, there was no tea/coffee making facilities. Captins Cafe which is adjoined to the hotel serves brilliant breakfasts, we ate here everyday. The people working here are so friendly, and once again, if you acknowledge them, and make conversation with them, they will only be too happy to talk back, and give you infomation which you need. (You can also buy takeaway coffee and teas for $2 to drink in your room) The hotel has free wi-fi, with two computers and a printer downstairs. Obviously if you are used to 5* luxary, this hotel won't be for you, but if you just want a nice cheap (by new york standers anyway) then this hotel is a must!

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Geoff B
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean and the room was large. Free Wifi and air conditioning. Quite as well and close to Empire State and subway.

Reviews.Title: “Clean room in an amazing location, great price”
Reviews.Author: LotusLauren
Reviews.Content: Location is everything on an island like Manhattan. This hotel is steps from Madison Avenue, Park Avenue... just blocks away from the Empire State Building, and a decent stroll from the theater district (Broadway) and Times Square. Only once did I bother to get a cab. Service was good and the room, while small, was definitely clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: Shamrock01
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in this hotel for 7 nights with my husband on our honeymoon to New York and I could not recommend it highly enough. The rooms were comfortable, quiet and cleaned daily by the excellent cleaning staff. Staff at reception were extremely helpful. The hotel is so centrally located and only one block away from Empire State Building. There are alot of nice Irish bars/restaurants in the streets surrounding the hotel. I hope to return to New York again as I loved it so much and will definitely stay at Hotel Grand Union when I return.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Quiet!”
Reviews.Author: theresa86
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were on a budget and didn't want to spend a lot of money on hotels as we were going to NYC to view the city and not stay in our hotel room. Our trip was for 4 nights and 5 days. We found this hotel on Expedia for about $100/night CAD which was a great deal compared to some of the other hotels. Before we left, I read some reviews about this hotel so a week before we left, I emailed the hotel and requested a room in a quiet section of the hotel. Check-in was really quick and easy. They were also flexible with us checking in before 4pm (their check-in time). The room was clean and small with a double bed, but that was okay as we were expecting this. The bed was really soft and comfortable, however, my boyfriend didn't think it was firm enough; nonetheless we both slept very well each night and the room was a great location as it was really quiet (no outside noise). There was also a mini-fridge which was very handy as the week we were there, it was really hot so we could buy bottles of water and store it in the fridge. The people at the hotel were really nice and accomodating. The manager even gave us a free pass at the internet since it was our first usage. The hotel also had a secured luggage storage area which was useful as on the day of check-out, our transportation wasn't going to be until later that evening so we were able to put our luggages into storage at no cost and do a one last tour of the city and then retrieve the luggages later that evening. The location of the hotel is excellent! It is literally about a block away from the Empire State Building. You could even walk to Times Square! It's only about a 30 minute walk from the hotel to Times Square one way. This hotel is also close to food areas. The only thing we didn't know about the hotel was that it is in Korea Town, which is fine, but since there are a lot of Korean/Japanese restaurants on the same street as the hotel, if you walk that street, it reeks of garbage. We arrived Saturday afternoon and all weekend, as soon as you stepped outside, it stank! However, the smell toned down a bit during the week (probably because garbage trucks were working again). I thought that was the only downfall, but since the hotel is in a great location, we bear it! The hotel also has a cafe beside it so it was really convenient to just grab a bagel/muffin or something and go on your way instead of having to search for a breakfast place. Overall, we enjoyed our stay at this hotel and would come stay there again when we come back to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location !”
Reviews.Author: Thorne12
Reviews.Content: The Grand Union Hotel was great! The people were very welcoming. The price was right & the location was perfect. I would defintely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: KepinItReal
Reviews.Content: For NYC standards good value for money. I liked the location. For NYC standards its a 'budget' hotel for something just under 200 bucks a night. Room was adequate, boring but clean and tidy. Since wasnt in NYC to sleep it was just fine. Would recommend again but I'm sure one could hunt down better deals if enough time to do so. One annoyance: the 'fixed' rates for an airport transfer listed in the foyer were incorrect. I was expecting a yellow cab, instead got some dude in a beaten up piece of americana (1980s cadillac?) with a dirty boot, who drove like a demon. He overcharged the price listed in the hotel by 10 bucks so I gave him what he asked for and didnt tip- so check with the front desk if you dont want some cowboy in a beaten up monster.

Reviews.Title: “Gloomy and depressing!”
Reviews.Author: DIXYLUFC
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights and left feeling like trolls escaping into the daylight. We were given a room on the 4th floor which was small and closed in. There was no daylight through the windows at all and it was impossible to do anything without all the lights on. The bathroom was much the same. The room was just the right side of clean. The air conditioning unit was set into the window and was right on top of the bed close enough to touch! This made life difficult at night when you went to bed.
