The only positive about this hotel is it's location as it is very central to all the things you will want to see and do. If you want location at the top of your list and will only be staying for a couple of nights then go for it, but if want some standard of comfort (and daylight!!) then avoid it like the plague!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, reasonably priced and perfecet location. 2nd visit here”
Reviews.Author: Iandevon
Reviews.Content: I wish I could remember the manager's name on reception but I travelled in May and can't recall. He was brilliant. Really looked after us trip wise and very friendly. The Grand Union is NOT the posh Marriott Marquis but it is not Marriott Marquis prices either. We opted for a room without a view (you don't need on in NYC as you see that when out and about) and it was very quiet. The hotel is very clean and it has the Captains Cafe joining it which is just great for breakfeast. Try their omelettes! You couldn't really be any closer to the Empire State. A word of advice on that. If you can only afford one trip up a tall building, opt for the Rockefeller centre over the Empire. You get a much better view of the park and the experience is better too at the same price. I cannot recommend the Grand Union highly enough and will always stay there when in NY. The weather that week was amazingly good, really warm and sunny, we were lucky. If you have never been to NY, you will just love it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location! Clean Hotel! Fab!”
Reviews.Author: mike-charl
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed at the Grand Union hotel last November for 5 nights! If you want NY on a budget, with good location...then this is the hotel for you! The hotel is nothing spectacular, but it has everything you need and is clean! Also, there is a diner right outside the hotel, which we ate at most mornings!....Cheap, traditional American breakfast to set you up for a day in New York City!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly adequate central budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: carolcarter
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed for 4 nights at the Grand Union Hotel. It is a budget hotel and the room was not large but as we are out as much as possible this was not a problem. The lobby area and internet lounge are quite smart. Once you go up in the lift, it is not quite so plush but you get what you pay for. We stayed in four hotels on the East coast during this holiday and the Grand Union was the only hotel to offer me the going rate on the day we booked in, rather than the higher rate that we had made the reservation at) and consequently saved us Â£200. There was an adjoining cafe which did breakfasts but we popped round the corner to Starbucks and had bagels. The hotel is only one block from the Empire State Building, a 10 minute walk to Grand Central Station and 20 minutes from Times Square. The air conditioning did not seem to work very well but we could not leave the window open as it was quite noisy outside (we were at the front of the hotel on the 1st floor) early in the morning. It was not a main road so I am not sure why it was noisy. But if you want a budget hotel within easy walking distance of most things, I would recommend the Grand Union.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable bed and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: sallyinaus
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights. Our room was fairly small, but met our needs. Bathroom a little dated, but everything here works well. The rooms are clean, bed very comfortable and great service from the desk. The location is amazing. We were able to get anywhere we wanted in a short time, and only a 5-10 min walk to Penn Station. Great eateries close by and just 2 blocks from the Empire State building (we had a view of it from the bathroom window). I would highly recommend this to couples or friends travelling together.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, clean and in an excellent location!!!”
Reviews.Author: orange_seller
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have just come back from a 6 night stay at the Grand Union Hotel. The hotel is in an excellent location to see most of the main attractions and there is a metro stop a few minutes away although we mostly walked everywhere. The hotel is basic but clean and our room was at the back of the hotel (room 208) which was really quiet. Captains cafe next door is nice and cheap but there are tons of cafes and deli's nearby with plenty more choice on the menu. We just wanted a clean and safe hotel with basic amenities in a good location and this hotel certainly ticks all of the boxes. I would definitely stay here again and recommend this hotel to others!!!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: kdh17
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 days before going on a cruise. It was a great location at a good price. We asked for a room at the rear of the hotel and you wouldn't have known you were in New York as it was so quiet. The rooms are quite small but as we didn't spend any time apart from sleeping it was fine for what we needed. The room was clean and the maid came every day and changed the towels every day too. We also found the room to get quite warm so had to have the air con on most of the time. the fridge came in very handy. We found the reception staff to be ok. The Captains Cafe served good breakfasts at reasonable prices. We asked reception to book us a cab to Cape Liberty and a big black limo arrived, however this was a nice end to our New York stay and we enjoyed travelling in style. If we return to New York, we would stay here again as we would rather spend our money on sightseeing and other things than on a hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “nice, but nothing fancy”
Reviews.Author: samzz
Reviews.Content: my visit to the Grand Union wasn't a surprise at all. When I arrived ,the staff accomidated me by giving me my room earlier than my check in time. The staff was nice but not too friendly if that makes any sense. The room I stayed in was clean but very small and basic, but what does one expect for the price. The Captains cafe connected to the hotel had ok food , but it was cheaply priced. overall, I would stay there again only if my budget was low .it's a nice place to stay if you are looking for a good nights sleep and that's all.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, basic noisy hotel, but good for NYC on a budget”
Reviews.Author: AAA84
Reviews.Content: Hotel Grand Union is ideally located to see all the sights of this great city. You can walk to most places, but the metro station is extremely close as well - 33rd st stop actually comes up at 32nd st, and you are about 100feet from the hotel. Something to remember if you stay here - do not rely on a wake up call from the hotel. Lucky for us we set a back up alarm on our mobile as the wake up call came late. Also, if the hotel offers to call you a cab, make sure it is a yellow cab. We clearly said that we wanted a regular cab, but they called the private car company they seem to have an affiliation with. This cost more than a regular cab. At first we thought that the street noise wouldn't be an issue. During the day it is a reasonably quite street noise wise, but at night it is a completely different story. We had a room on the street. I thought about changing as soon as I found this out, but sat in the room for a while and thought it wasn't too bad. But in the middle of the night there was garbage truck after grabage truck (I'm talking more than 3-4+ between the hours of 11pm and 3am) and they are really loud, and the guys yell out to eachother as well. Peaceful! One morning we woke up to a jackhammer going really early as well. It might not sound like much- but it was honestly really bad. So get a room at the back! Our room was always warm, in fact a bit too warm at night. It is very small, but it is manhattan after all. The bathroom was nice but the shower is the smallest I have ever seen, you can't even bend over to wash your feet. The bed was reasonably comfortable, but it was a double and we're used to a Queen so it was a bit small. Other than that, all was good. The staff were helpful enough when we needed them (apart from our departure arrangments as discussed above). The cafe next door is great for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: RockinAllOvaTheWorld
Reviews.Content: This place is fantastic,Our trip to NYC was overshadowed by hotel selection, didn't want to spend hundreds of pounds on a hotel. This place is great one of the few reasonably priced hotels in Manhatten where you have a private bathroom, and at Â£80 per night (2008) its a steal! walking distance to Times Square, Central Park, 1 Block from Empire State Building viewing distance of the Chrysler Building its great. Also the Metro station 5 minutes east of the front door takes you straight to the Financial district for Brooklyn Bridge, Staten Island Ferry for the Statue of Liberty views and WTC memorial. Excellent.

Reviews.Title: “good location and room”
Reviews.Author: ham_green
Reviews.Content: Location: About 8 minutes' walk from Penn station, along busy West 32nd Street and onto East 32nd - most of the traffic disappears up 5th or Madison Avenues so by the time you reach the hotel it's reasonably quiet. The adjoining Captain's Cafe serves cheap comfort food like burgers and breakfasts, and there are some decent oriental food spots in the area, but really top-notch cuisine is a subway ride away. Macy's and Empire State Building are a few blocks away, and whilst there is a subway stop on the same block as the hotel, the nearby 34th / Herald Square stop goes to far more destinations. Room: Stayed in room 208. Decent-sized bed and comfortable, although I did notice a small collection of hairs on my pillow. Shower and toilet facilities spotlessly clean. The room faces an inner courtyard - excellent if you are the sort of person who might be bothered by the small amount of traffic noise, but there is no natural daylight whatsoever. Hopefully you haven't come to NY to spend lots of time in your room but if you have, keep the lights on. One complaint - the room temperature fluctuated between toasty and sweaty. The radiators need repairing or replacing. Service: Adequate. Don't expect the painted-on smiles or "have a nice day" attitude you'd get in other NY establishments, but check-in and check-out were seamless. Facilities: Not many. Internet access is available for a price. This hotel has an excellent location and room quality considering the price paid. I would recommend this hotel to just about anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Great Good Value & Location”
Reviews.Author: RussT6
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the 4 bedded room for 4 night with the tax it was about Â£40 a night each.The captains table next door was great for breakfast.The Hotel was clean warm and all the staff were friendly and helpful.It is really close to the Empire state building and 5 minutes from Braodway.If i went back to New York we would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location - good sleep”
Reviews.Author: chenga28
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Room 504 - faces the street, a little noisy during the night but not too bad, had a view of the Empire State. Rooms were clean and very comfortable, great showers very powerful. Location is 5-10 min walk from Grand Central, 33rd St station is less than a minute away, Times Sq is about 15/20 min walk. Lots of good places to eat breakfast nearby, the Captains cafe was good and theres a cafe/deli opposite the hotel which has alot of choices for breakfast. Staff were helpful, there is internet available to use, free for 10 mins p/d. Also there are 2 unsecured wifi access to select, from this room ;-) - All in all for the price i paid this is a excellent choice if you want good location and a good night sleep after walking about in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: gaval66
Reviews.Content: Execellent location, room was big enough, comfortable and warm. The hotel booked us onto a shuttle bus for the return journey to the airport and we generally very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “clean & comfortable”
Reviews.Author: sojouner1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the grand union hotel. We were originally put in room 308 which was very draughty and cold especially as January is freezing in New York. But once we spoke to the helpful staff we were put in room 708. This room was clean comfortable and very warm. The hotel is very conviently located. It is near to MACYS & The Empire State building. There is a diner attached to the hotel that do nice breakfast/lunch, with lovely and friendly staff. This is basically a 2 star hotel which as I said was comfortably clean and quiet, We enjoyed staying there and would stay again. There is internet access and access to a free safety deposit box.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Superduper7
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights with two parents and two teenagers. We stayed in a nice, spacious three bedded room. Very nice hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great option for budget travelers”
Reviews.Author: SalVirNan
Reviews.Content: I was looking for an affordable option in a convenient Manhattan location, and this fit the bill. The room was small and dark, with only one window facing a brick wall, but on the plus side it was very quiet. The room was clean, and the newly renovated bathroom was nice. The staff were helpful. My only complaint is that there was no hot water during the days and evenings - just mornings. The staff said they had maintenance people working on it, but given that it was a pattern every day we were there, I have my doubts about that explanation. Finally, the radiator is loud, so if you are a light sleeper, earplugs are not a bad idea. Aside from the hot water situation, we were very happy there, and it's somewhere I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good price for midtown, clean basic rooms”
Reviews.Author: Graecie
Reviews.Content: Decided on this hotel after other choice sold out.Kind of glad since it was very convenient location,not even a block to subway 6 line,had little cafe connected to hotel which was great.Very short walk to ESB,Macy's,Herald Square,shopping,food,etc.The room itself was a little small but absolutely no issue fitting myself & my teenage son & 2 large suitcases.Had room w/ full bed & twin. #211.Bathroom tiny but I liked having just shower stall w/no tub.No place to leave out toiletries.Just left everything in my toiletry bag & put that on handy shelf under bathroom window.Left out essential soap/face wash for everyday use.Towels were changed every single day & good job on cleaning of actual room.No complaints there.There was luggage rack & rod w/hangers which was great.There was this large water tank type thing outside of bathroom which I found odd.Really not too noisy but just strange.However,after I stepped in this huge puddle was happy to have this thing as it generated some heat so was able to dry my socks, boots & pants on it.Never had to use heater in room,actually had to crack window.Nice little fridge in room which was great for drinks.A microwave would make this hotel almost perfect for me.No view from window but I'm not going to NY to look out my window so didn't matter.I was here right before Xmas holidays & there was a nice tree in lobby.The front desk never really acknowledged us when leaving or returning which I think is bad customer service.You can at least say hello.It seemed the front desk did talk/were friendlier to foreigners which I find strange. They themselves spoke English but w/accent so maybe that's why.I say treat everyone the same. The only time we took the elevator was when we checked in & out otherwise we always took the stairs the one flight to our room.The very few times we saw the maids they were very friendly. This is a nice small hotel close to everything. I would not hesitate to stay here again on my next trip to NYC.Hopefully front desk people warm up to us non foreigners & they'll work on free internet.Voucher for 10 minute use very cheap of them. Ladies,go to Century 21 for shopping.Had to buy boots 'cause it snowed.Got great pair of Bearpaws for $38!Can't find that price back home/online! And great $5 supposedly pashmina scarves.I loaded up for souvenirs.Use Captains Cafe. Tony very nice. Breakfast for two was never more than $12 w/tip if that & can get your coffee/cocoa to go.City pass is the way to go.Good price & lines shorter than general public lines.Get metro card & don't be afraid of riding the subway.I always buy 7 day option.Great value & very safe. Never an issue & this is 2nd week long visit to NYC in 2008. I can't believe how much of a police force is always present almost everywhere. Always felt safe in NYC. Go to Astro Gallery of Gems on 34th if you want to see awesome mineral specimens. My son is a rockhound so if anyone else has an interest in this,best store in the country for specimens. John there is very friendly/super nice. You can get good stuff for good price but they also carry the thousands of $$ stuff too. Most of all,HAVE FUN!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cpalewine
Reviews.Content: We checked in on December 27th and checked out at 12:00 on December 30th and loved every minute of it. The hotel staff was very helpful with telling us how to get to places and the little resturant next door The Captains Quarters has a GREAT breakfast for a really good price!!!. If I ever go back I WILL stay at the Hotel Grand Union again.

Reviews.Title: “Good, Solid Choice”
Reviews.Author: ATallOne
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a four night stay at the Hotel Grand Union and enjoyed my stay there very much. This is not a luxury five star hotel by any means, but for the price and location, you can't beat it. It is a short, half block walk to the green line subway station. I asked for a quiet room, and was given one on the back of the building. We had to go through two fire doors to get to our room, but that was not a problem. It cut down on hall noise. While the hotel does not have any sort of resturant, there is an excellent diner right next door called the Captain's Cafe--a very good choice for breakfast, or you could also get a cup of coffee and bagel and take back to your room. We enjoyed the small refrigerator in the room. It would have been nice to have a small coffee maker in there as well, but this is only a small inconvenience. I found the front desk staff helpful and friendly. I was able to check in the room very quickly. I would definitely stay here again, and would not hesitate to recommend it to a friend. If you're looking for luxury accommodations, this is not the place for you. But if you want a clean, very reasonably priced, well located hotel, give this place a try.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: SeattleRosie
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed there for a night, then returned for two more nights a couple of days later. The first night we had a pretty small room, but when we returned for the second part of the stay we had a much larger room. There is a small frig in the room and the bathrooms and room were very clean. It's great for the value. The desk staff could have been a little friendlier, but that's ok because I wasn't there to make new friends anyway. The "free" internet is actually only 10 min. on the PCs they have in the lobby. I was able to find free wifi. The bottom floors have a lot of street noise. The subway is right outside the hotel! the day we left, we stored our luggage in a locked room off the lobby. I really liked it. For Manhattan, the rates are cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Great overall location”
Reviews.Author: laurafitz
Reviews.Content: My friend and I traveled to NYC in August for a long weekend. We found this hotel to be very comfortable and clean. It was located in a great part of the city, mere blocks away from Penn Station and in close proximity to many famous sights. The subway was located less than a block away so it may traveling around the city very easy. We also felt that the concierge service that the hotel offered was very helpful. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone I know.

Reviews.Title: “Please give this place a chance”
Reviews.Author: soy1969
Reviews.Content: After a few bad reviews I was a bit worried about Hotel Grand Union but these fears were unfounded. Yes the rooms are basic and the decor dated but hey you're 2 streets away from 5th avenue and the jewel in the crown "The Captains Cafe" is right next door!! Fab breakfasts and sadly we only, the day that we left, realised they do the best burgers in the area!! Brilliant value!! You are so central and everything e.g Empire State Building, Macys etc are on your doorstep. All in all excellent location, tasty breakfasts and friendly reception staff. Would definitely recommmend it to friends and family. If you are used to 5 star and luxury this may not be for you but if you want somewhere central, comfortable, clean, friendly and helpful the the Hotel Grand Union is for you. Don't hesitate to ask me any questions!! Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: RogerM9
Reviews.Content: My wife and I picked this hotel for a 3 day break before heading off into New England, based on Tripadvisor reviews. Booked through Hotel Discount, and I phoned the Hotel about 4 days before we were due to arrive, and it was as well we did because they had never heard of us! Staff were very helpful and after contacting the agents themselves they were able to resolve the problem and fit us in as planned. Room at the front was a bit noisy as there is a FedEx depot just down the street, but everywhere in NYC has its share of noise - it wasn't excessive and didn't spoil our stay. Room was as described by other reviewers - clean, adequate size, reasonable ensuite facilities (rare in this price bracket in Manhattan), and very helpful staff. Ideally located near the Empire State. We recommend you go up as soon as you arrive to get your bearings, and forget the map but DO use the audio guide. If you buy a city pass, the Empire state includes the audio guide as part of the deal. Go and see the Museum of Natural history, Metropolitan art gallery, but we felt that there was a touch of "the kings new clothes" about the Guggenheim and the Museum of Modern Art. But the Frick Collection on 5th Avenue is an absolute gem and not to be missed. We would happily stay in the Grand Union again, and would recommend it to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Mid-Town Hotel”
Reviews.Author: g0akc
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel clean and comfortable for a 3 night stay in NYC. It's nicely situated for mid-town with the Empire State just a couple of blocks away, Times Square 10 minutes on foot and the number 6 subway train for down town at the end of the street. There are several cafes/places to eat within a block or two and the hotel has it's own coffee shop. There was a small fridge in the room but no coffee maker - it's worth taking your own travel kettle like we did. The bathroom was nice and clean, OK shower and hairdryer. The hotel provided some soap and shampoo though a couple of extra towels would have been nice. The front desk was matter of fact - wanted payment on arrival and didn't fix the problem with the TV (remote not working) as requested. I would recommend this hotel, particularly to those on a budget. Usually to get hotels in this price range in NYC you have to have a shared bathroom or stay out of Manhattan which means a long commute. In our case we just wanted somewhere clean and comfortable. Didn't go to NYC to hang around in a hotel! The Grand Union fitted the bill exactly.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: FlipFlop27
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from staying in this hotel and to be honest after reading some of the reviews on here i was a bit worried if it was going to be OK - but - our room was clean, had hot water all the time and clean towels everyday, the reception staff were friendly and helpful and the location couldn't have been much better. The only negatives i could say were that we needed a new mattress in our room, the lift was slow and the walls were thin. The reception staff will sort out a taxi for you to the airport, they have free safety deposit boxes in the office and a safe room to put your bags if you aren't flying til late that day. The Captains Cafe next door was great for breakfast and was cheap too. The Empire State Building is only 2 blocks away, we really enjoyed the downtown bus tour, the tkts boxes have theatre tickets on sale everyday, to see the Statue of Liberty - the Staten Island Ferry - is a good idea as its free and you go right past the Statue.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: topgolfer
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 3 nights paid Â£550 per person with flights from manchester. Firstly the good points, the location is brilliant, well within walkin distance of many of the attractions, check in was fast and efficient, we were given two rooms on the ninth floor hich didn't bother us, the rooms were clean ( though see bad points ) a good bathroom and a t.v. no tea/coffee making facilities, towels are changed everyday. There is no breakfast but adjacent to the hotel is the brilliant captains cafe diner, a full house breakfast special $7.95 (see menu pages.com) sets you up for the day. the hotel has internet access if you need it. The hotel is on a quiet street, there are some nice bars on west 33rd st a five minute walk including jack demsey's bar which serves nice food. Now there are two bad points, whilst in room 901 i was bitten several times by a mosquito and the room was very humid as the air conditioning was so noisy, secondly they advertise a car service to take you back to the airpoprt, be aware the price quoted is not the price you pay, it was offered as $60 + $8 tolls, we figured with a tip the price would be $78- $80 when we got to newark the price was $85 and he wanted his tip as well, needless to say he didn't get one, but to be honest the good points far outweigh the two minor bad points. All in all a great little hotel which i would not put people off staying there.

Reviews.Title: “A rare diamond in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: CRobDerbyshire
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel as one of the very few reasonably priced (by New York standards) hotels with ensuite bathrooms and good reviews in midtown Manhanttan. Its location is excellent, only two blocks from the Empire State Building and one block from the subway. The hotel is located in a relatively quiet street, providing a calm environment away from the hustle and bustle of the city. I arrived very late for my 3-night stay, at nearly midnight, and received a polite welcome at the hotel reception. The reception area is impressive for a small hotel, with a bright and clean feel. I was allocated a room with a double bed at the rear of the building. The room was of reasonable size and well-furnished in typical American style with heavy dark-wood furniture. The bathroom was spacious with a large bath, and nicely decorated in a marble effect. The bedroom and bathroom each had a window onto a shaft at the back of the building. As a consequence, there wasn't much natural light in the room, but this should not be a problem when not spending much time in the room during daylight hours. My only real criticism is that, as usual, there was a humming noise from this shaft, night and day, so I had to close the windows and use ear-plugs to get to sleep. Nevertheless, the comfortable bed allowed me a good night's sleep and, overall, the room provided a perfectly adequate base for a short visit to New York. Breakfast was not included in the room rate (which was $175 per night plus taxes), but the hotel has a small adjoining coffee shop where an excellent breakfast can be had at a reasonable price. Another positive feature of this hotel is cleanliness. The room and communal areas were very clean, and every morning the biggest band of cleaning staff that I have even seen in a hotel was clearly visible at work. In summary, this hotel would seem to be a rarity in central Manhattan - clean, relatively quiet and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value if cigarette smoke doesn't bother you”
Reviews.Author: J_and_B_from_Ottawa
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights. The staff are very friendly. The location is very central. The hotel is very clean. Although the decor is dated, that is easily overlooked given the price per night and the positive aspects noted above. Our room was on the 7th floor at the back and was quite quiet. My only complaint is that there are no non-smoking rooms/floors. This was not a problem on the first 2 nights, but on the third a smoker in presumably the next room, caused our room to smell of smoke. If it wasn't for the smoke, I would certainly stay here again without hesitation. Even with it, I'd probably take my chances because you can't find such clean hotel at such an affordable place in NYC, but really wish they would allocate a few floors as non-smoking.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the Money”
Reviews.Author: ABZPT
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I stayed at the Grand Union Hotel for a week this October. The Hotel is actually exceeding expectations for the price level in downtown NYC. The point is this - when you come to NYC you have to set your expectations to a certain level. Generally in NYC, you pay 200USD just to get a room in downtown Manhattan that is the size of a sarcofagus and contains zero bugs, and then you add the $$$ per square foot in order to enlarge it. This is reality in NYC. Now here is a hotel, greatly located just north of Union Square with great cafe's and restaurants at stone's throw, the Empire States building around the corner and an almost a "private" Subway station 10 meters from the door, that has clean rooms (most of them were renovated recently so ask for the renovated ones, but even the renovated rooms are unattractive looking), where rooms feature a small fridge, TV, Hairdrier and phone - for under 200USD. In this respect it's a bargain. By the way - if you can - take the bigger rooms (since the basic ones are very small). We enjoyed our stay there and Recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: Fox24london
Reviews.Content: We had 5 nights at the Grand Union and we have to say it was alot better than what we expected it to be due to the low costs. We arrived late evening and the staff were very welcoming and friendly. We found our rooms to be a good size and very clean and comfortable. The bathroom had a good shower with constant hot water. The room was well furnished with everything you could need, chest of drawers, hanging rail even a dressing table. We found it just right. There was only one lift that sometimes you did have to wait for but for us the stair were much needed exercise after the big yummy breakfasts at Captains Cafe which was right next door to the hotel. The room was cleaned everyday with fresh towels, which their were plenty of. We found the staff to be very helpful, friendly and always acknowledged us when we were around the hotel. Captain's Cafe is a great addition to the hotel. They have great friendly staff and the food could not be better. Very reasonably priced for the amount you get and they are always welcoming and happy to cater for your needs. The owner Tony and his staff made our stay at the Grand Union Hotel even better. The location was perfect for our first ever visit to NYC. A subway was very close and many of the main sites were in walking distance (ESB, Macys, Times Square, 5th Avenue, Broadway). We recommend this hotel for comfort, great location. Captains Cafe and reasonable prices. We will definatly be going back next summer and staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Intrepid_Explorer82
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at the Grand Union for 4 nights. We were initially given a room on the 2nd floor, overlooking the street. This room was really, really small. There wasnt even room for a wardrobe or chest of drawers, just a rack on the wall. There was no room for our suitcases, which had to be put against the door (not good if there is a fire!). The mattress on the bed was really soft and sunk in the middle. After a poor nights sleep, I went to reception and asked for another room towards the centre of the hotel. We were given a room that overlooked the central wall, it didnt have a view, but we were only really in the room to sleep anyway. This room was much bigger with a desk, chest of drawers and a nice flat screen TV. The Captains Cafe next door was good value and the food was good. The location of the hotel is brilliant, Empire State is within walking distance and a Subway stop is at the end of the road. There were computers in the lobby of the hotel which you could use which were reasonably priced. If you stay at this hotel and are unhappy with your room, ask at reception to be moved.

Reviews.Title: “Creepy, dubious cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: MakRoger
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night paid $200. the sheets and pillow cases were crumpled and stained, we removed the pillow slips revealing even more stained pillows. so I went downstairs to request fresh pillow slips the counter staff just stared at me and said that the linen was clean, it was just old and would not budge, I offered to show him but he said no, he did not want to see, "there cannot be any thing wrong with the linen". I turned to return to my room, thinking its time to change hotels and the other guy presented me with four new crumpled pillow cases, so I took them back, and tried to get some sleep, It felt very creepy sleeping in a bed that just did not feel clean. Please read â€œNever Again!!!â€� from Mariolla it gives a very good description.

Reviews.Title: “Claustrophobe's nightmare as well as noisy”
Reviews.Author: Seein'_the_world
Reviews.Content: Our teeny, tiny room on the 10th floor was as wide as the double bed and two small nightstands. The lamp on one nightstand did not work and the other lamp worked intermittently. On one side of the bed is shelf and clothing rod. We had to remove the hangers to prevent bumping them just getting in and out of bed. We opened the drapes to see a brick wall. There is no towel rod by the shower because the room is not wide enough. The shower head was actually an aerator from a sink, reducing water flow to the point it was impossible to get my hair wet let alone wash out shampoo. It was easier to wash in the sink, which was cleaner than the tub. The sheets and towels are thin and worn out. The room was located between two fire doors and there was a steady stream of traffic (letting the doors slam) between 9pm and 3am even though there are only three other rooms beyond that fire door. Everything here is on the cheap--except for the price. No breakfast is provided. However, next door is a small restaurant that was adequate. We left our luggage at the hotel while we went out sightseeing. One bag had clearly been dropped and items inside were damaged. I did get to practice my Russian as the staff seemed to be mostly Russian as well as most of the other guests. If you like a little hidey hole for a room--this is the place for you. If you need to breathe, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect located”
Reviews.Author: kajras
Reviews.Content: A decent hotel on the 32 street near Empie State -Penn Station -Madison Square Garden and Macys - the location in litlle Korea was exelent - The nice Captains Cafe beside where you could by breakfeast for the 3-5 dollars beneath the hotel was a cosy place The staff in the Cafe and in the hotel was very helpfull and had always a smile on their lips. The rooms was spacy and although the furnitore was a little bit old - i can recomend this hotel as one of the best budgethotels i New Yorke

Reviews.Title: “New York - Grand Union”
Reviews.Author: Ianto99
Reviews.Content: As a base, the hotel is great. Rooms are very basic but clean - no tea or coffee facilities in the room which we would have expected. Only 1 lift which would be problematic if you have some disabilities. Staff were helpful and polite which does help. There are no restraurant facilities at the hotel, which was no problem as you are in New York - eating capital of the world. The hotel was only a 3 minute walk from the Empire State and practically on the tour bus route, and only 12 - 15 minute walk from 42nd Street, perfect if you want to visit the larger stores or just pig out at the Hard Rock cafe.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, small and efficent, you realy feel like you know the staff”
Reviews.Author: adders68
Reviews.Content: 9 of us stayed at the Grand Union hotel on east 32nd st btw 6th and 7th ave....our only complain really was the hotel weighing scales in reception don't work so beware all u shoppers. the staff were really accomodating and did their best to assist in all matters from booking taxi's and arranging an extra night stay. situated near the empire state and macy's, top tip if you get an even numbered room ask if u can change to an odd numbered and the even numbers are on the front and the street can be a bit noisy in the early hours, apart from that no problems at all. the hotel offer a free safe box in reception and will book taxis limo's or suv's if like us you had too many cases for a regular taxi to take you the airport

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location in Midtown”
Reviews.Author: KingCream
Reviews.Content: Came here on honeymoon and as such asked before hand if they had a room with a view of the empire state building which was duly acknowleged and supplied at no extra cost, 9023 I think. (see photo). The room was small (standard for NYC) but offered what was expected for the price, a clean room with double bed, tv, fridge and most importantly air conditioning. There was someone on reception 24 hours which made me feel far more secure and the location to the empire state building, and local transport was amazing and as such the value for money was great. People have recommended the restaurant next door for food however we did not eat there on our stay as we were always rushing about. If you are on the move then try Papaya Dog which is a block up and along which will do you a double egg in a roll for $1. Overall would return to the Grand Union without searching competitors because of the price and location.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant - Hotel Grand Union NYC”
Reviews.Author: JetSetter095
Reviews.Content: Having previuosly stayed in New York i was not expecting much as standard in New York for hotels seem to be far less than if you stayed anywhere else in the US. But i was pleasantly suprised. The hotel was great, great location, staff friendly and room cleaned daily. The room was basic but clean. We stayed on the 9th floor with no view but then not many rooms in New York has a view. Air conditioning in the room which was great as the temperature was 83 degrees! Would definitely recomend this hotel and would definitely stay here again on another visit. Cafe that seemed to adjoin the hotel was great not expensive at all and friendly staff. We used this restaurant / cafe for Breakfast on Saturday and Sunday morning. Monday morning there was a great place to eat opposite. Absolutuely huge with a great selection. Sushi made to order, bacon & eggs and the price was ridculoulsy cheap. So all in all great hotel with great surrounding facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Location at a good price”
Reviews.Author: Toni3452
Reviews.Content: We have spent 5 days at Grand Union Hotel after searching a lot., taking into account how expensive is New York City. We have exactly got what we were looking for. Pros: a) Location: Close to the Empire State and 5th. Avenue. Subway Station entrance down the block. This is a must in this crazy city, b) Price: Getting a clean room with your own bathroom, for around USD 220, is a great deal, c) Captain's cafe and Silo's: you have two good options for breakfast. I recommend the first one: more expensive but with the daily acid comments of Toni "Turkish" and d) kind and friendly concierge & front desk Cons: a) Small room & bathroom for 2 adults and 2 kids, b) Dark atmosphere and c) as many others reviews, the slow elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms but very clean”
Reviews.Author: Snurful
Reviews.Content: Small room with mini-fridge, cable tv and ac. Comfortable bed and bathroom was very clean. No closet, but had wall shelf with some hangers. As other reviews have indicated, the location is excellent, with a subway entrance down the block and easy walking distance to Macy's and tons of shopping. Also, plenty of coffee shops and restaurants within two blocks, including a full block of great Korean restaurants. All in all, a good place to crash after a long, humid August day walking the city.

Reviews.Title: “Lucky to find this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scatterling
Reviews.Content: I spent weeks and weeks researching a good hotel in New York, as it is so expensive compared to the other cities. I eventually decided on Hotel Grand Union, and was soooo pleased with my choice. The staff were very friendly and helpful. There is a luggage lock up where you can leave your luggage until you need it (a huge plus if your plane is in the evening), and they even let us leave our luggage there for the weekend, when we flew to Washington (we were returning to stay at the hotel though). Our first room was great. The view looked out onto the street (which got a bit noisy when the rubbish collection was being done ... but hey ... one can expect that in a big city). The room was clean and quite airy. The second room we were given for one night after our return from Washington though was not a patch on our first one. It smelled of smoke (I believe they don't have designated smoking rooms, which is a real negative), but seeing it was only for one night, we just accepted it. The location of this hotel is just great. All walking distance, or else the subway is just at the end of the block. Great deli two blocks away where I had delicious egg and bacon rolls every morning! Stays open late as well, so you can stop off after a late night out. All in all ... we were really lucky to find this great little hotel, and I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: angwri
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located. Just a few steps from Park Avenue & handy for the Empire State Building & Grand Central Station. All members of staff on reception were pleasant & helpful. The airline lost my luggage en route to New York & hotel staff did what they could to take messages, etc. The room was not huge but more than adequate. It had a comfy bed, fridge, clock/radio, hairdryer & TV. The bathroom had both bath & shower. Both rooms were beautifully clean. There was some street noise, but considering how central the hotel, it was not too bad. The room overlooked a sort of well down the centre of the hotel so there was no view or natural light. Also, I would have liked coffee making facilities to have been provided. I did not use the "Captains Table" as there was such a huge choice of delis & cafes in the area. All in all good value & a good location

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for . . .”
Reviews.Author: Sim0nJ
Reviews.Content: The Grand Union is a budget hotel very well situated, so you have to expect compromises. On the plus side the staff were friendly and efficient on check in and the the hotel and room were always very clean with fresh towells every day. On the downside the hallway and our room smelt badly of smoke to the point of making our clothes smell. The room was a good size for the money, however the window looked out onto 3 walls and as we were quite low down on the 4th floor the room had no natural sunlight and it was impossible to tell what the weather was like from our room. Unfortunately the staff were unable to move us to a different room so I can only comment on the experience we had in this room. I appreciate it is a budget hotel, however I have stayed in other similarly priced (and cheaper) hotels in New York and all beat this one!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem in New York”
Reviews.Author: jerjerDublin_Ireland
Reviews.Content: After searching for a reasonably priced central hotel in New York, we decided to take a chance on the Grand Union. To say that the hotel undersells itself is an understatement. If you're going to New York and want a standard hotel, well priced with private bathroom then this is the place to go. I suggested to the very friendly owner that they should change their pictures on the website to make it more appealing but she tols me that they were full nearly every night!! The room was clean, well serviced and the staff could not have been more helpful. It is literally 3 minutes walk to the Empire State Building and 30 seconds from the nearest subway. Ideal location, very good price and ideal for young travellers and old alike! Thank you Grand Union

Reviews.Title: “Fine for NY”
Reviews.Author: Georgialinna
Reviews.Content: Given NY is such an expensive city when it comes to accomodation, this hotel is a good choice. Yes, it's very small and the room and bathroom need a renovation, h/w, it's excellently located and it's not dirty. We were on Level 9 and could hear a lot of street noise, but it's NY and after a lond day of sightseeing, you'll sleep through it. I'd recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyable stay.”
Reviews.Author: amazinggeeeeeeee
Reviews.Content: you get a clean hotel room with a nice, bright bathroom and friendly staff in a good location for a very reasonable price. why i liked it: 1. location: right by korea town and walking distance to macy's/penn station and empire state building, and about a block away from the 33rd subway (6 train) - you are pretty much easily connected to any location in manhattan! 2. clean hotel room: the bathroom is bright and clean, and they provided fresh towels every day. the bed was clean and comfortable. 3. staff: friendly and helpful! 4. our flight out of NYC wasn't till the night of the day we checked out, and they have a large, brightly lit store room for you to keep your luggage until you are ready to leave. a small point, but an important one! the bad... 1. there is no view. all we got to see was the building next door, but really, we were only in the hotel when it was time to sleep, you have plenty of time to soak up new york sights during the day time! 2. there is only one, very slow moving, lift/elevator. really not adequate for a building with 10 floors. this they should sort out. 3. they kept trying to push the car airport service which was frankly quite expensive, at about $55 + $5 toll for JFK and $60 + $8 toll for newark. hmm. after much prying they told us about a chartered bus service for $20 per person, and then they took a "deposit" which i took to be their "commission." hmm. but really, i would definitely stay here again and would recommend it wholeheartedly for anyone looking for a reasonably priced, clean and comfortable hotel in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “good for the money and great location”
Reviews.Author: phatbear
Reviews.Content: Myself and Mrs Phatbeat have just returned from a 4 night stay at the hotel grand union. 1st the Pros: Great Location, a couple of block from macys and esb and with a subway on the same block Cheap as chips accomodation Good diner attached to the hotel, captains cafe which we got two great plates of pancakes and bacon and a coffee each for less than $20. Clean Room. The Cons The worlds noisiest fridge in the room, which sounded like a jet taking off, however this is also a pro because its nice to have a fridge. No view in quite a few of the rooms, our room over looked an enclosed courtyard type area which meant very little natural light, however the upside of this was the room was'nt noisy, apart from the fridge. No tea and coffee making facilities in the room. One very small lift to serve the whole hotel, so there can be a wait if you cant run up the stairs, however because its a smallish hotel the lift isnt in constant use. The frontdesk chap trying to hard sell the car service to the aiport, whilst over inflating the price that a cab will charge, oddly enough we went for a cab and it was $20 dollars less than their service to Newark. The niggles are small ones and for the money and location you cant really ask for too much, ooh and yes we would stay again, hopefully next time with a view and a slightly less noisy fridge. the bear

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: Stina_M
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights at the Grand Union and for the price, you can't really fault it. 33rd Street Subway station is a 2 minute walk and the location is a great base to explore the city. The rooms were clean tidy. However, the decor is dated (patterned carpet, flowery bedspread) but we had enough space and the bathroom was clean - if a little small. You must remember the price is great for such a location and if you planning to explore the city then you cant really go wrong with this place.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel @ it's Best”
Reviews.Author: iwillm
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 5 nights!!! We knew it was a budget hotel so weren't expecting anything 5 star. However the hotel is actually pretty awesome! Really clean and the staff are very friendly!! We booked a twin room and it was a decent size with a nice bathroom and brilliant shower. The room was very clean and have everything you needed from a hotel room. Oh no Kettle in the room though or bible, i'm not bothered about the bible, ha ha! The hotel is a block and a half away from the Empire State building and about a 2 minute walk to 5th avenue and grand central! It's located in Mid-Town so everything is actually in walking distance!! Oh you have to check out Captains Cafe'. It's the diner located right next door, very good and awesome on price!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Basic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tacodingo
Reviews.Content: After reading many many reviews of this hotel, we decided this would fit our needs...and that it did! It was within our budget (under $200) and in midtown which was a good base for everything we wanted to see in the city. The easiest way to sum it up is: PROS: Right down the street from the #6 line subway (which goes to Grand Central, which allows you to connect to various other lines) Cafe next door allows for easy start for breakfast Room gets very dark if you are in the back, we faced a brick wall so not a whole lot of sunlight came in (this is both a pro and a con), great for sleeping and no noise at all! Shower had good water pressure, had hairdryer also Mini fridge in room was great for storing water/soda A couple blocks down there was a CVS and Walgreens which was good for getting snacks/drinks for the room CONS: Poor lighting, much like an office, we almost always used the lamps No view at all, we faced the back brick wall... but no one goes to nyc to look at it through a window! Only one elevator, which made it slow Large pipe in bathroom, although it was covered, I still found it a bit odd So yeah, all in all, it was a good basic hotel. I'm not sure if I would stay here again, but for what we paid it was good the first time through. The area surrounding is alright, down the street is the "Korean Way" which is filled with Korean shops, restaurants and... Pinkberry! They have great frozen yogurt and cereal toppings! If you want to do NYC cheap, but not stay at a dump then this is a good place to start.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bargain at a very central location”
Reviews.Author: Ninotchka_Dada
Reviews.Content: Spent a long weekend here in a triple room with my boyfriend, his sister and their mutual friend. Finding affordable triples in NYC is no mean feat. We were glad we landed this place. The front desk staff was fabulously friendly, even helped us play practical jokes on one another. The decor was gloriously cheesy in an over the top "Big Lots" special sort of way, but well-maintained and the room was very clean and HUGE by NYC budget hotel standards. The bathroom was gigantic (could have slept 3 more people), very clean, if a little short on towels and towel hooks, so the place looked like a bit of a laundry when all four of us were done showering. However, the water pressure was great, and the room/towels clean and fresh. No view, other than the fire escape and air conditioner, but there was a large safe and a small fridge for those so concerned. Huge television, but the most amusing entertainment came from the couple staying next door. Although we had the constant humming of the air system to cover the sounds of traffic, the walls are rather thin, and the headboards line up on the connecting walls. Must have been their honeymoon next door. Amazing...

Reviews.Title: “Basic- but what a great find!”
Reviews.Author: ladywholovesmilktray
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 weeks in March 08 and so feel I can report fairly accurately on the facts! Brilliant location near the Metro line 6, right around the corner from the Empire State and Macy's and opposite a nice bar. The room was small (no smaller than the average Manhattan hotel) and the decor dated, but it was spotlessly cleaned every day with white fresh towels supplied. The shower was hot, pressure high, there was a 900 channel TV and a small fridge in the room great for storing beer and snacks from the local deli. The Turkish staff are refreshingly unobtrusive and helpful when needed, booking a taxi was no trouble. The Captain's Cafe next door does a good breakfast, my fave was Pershing Square. To conclude, if you are a person with very high standards and like lots of on site facilities, plush, spacious surroundings and attentive staff with a strong service ethic, then this is absolutely NOT the place for you. If you want a basic room at a great price and amazing location, then go ahead and book this and save your money for shopping! High Five!

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: EdinburghFlossie
Reviews.Content: 7 nights in a Quad room over Easter holidays with 2 boys, 14 and 12. Helpful but unobtrusive staff. Clean quiet comfortable room. Plenty of hot water. Clean towels every day. Excellent house keeping. We were sometime embarrassed at the state we left it in but always came back to a tidy room. TV a bit tired and grainy but there was nothing to watch anyway. Great value at $1900. all in. I would gladly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but noisy”
Reviews.Author: VictoriaPlumLondon
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is fab. Only a couple of blocks from the Empire State Building, really handy for the subway when heading downtown. The rooms are small (and not all have a bath), but perfectly clean. Our room was exceptionally noisy (it really could do with double / triple glazing). You need to be aware of static. Everytime you get off the bed, wipe your hands - don't touch any light switches! The staff aren't that helpful, but friendly enough. For the amount of time we spent in the room, this was certainly acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Would Definitely Stay There Again”
Reviews.Author: insightoutcomes
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for the price - centrally located, clean and comfortable, quiet enough - we were on the 7th floor - and convenient to everything. Also, it's right across the street from a fabulous new resaurant called Artisanal. All told, a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Grand Union”
Reviews.Author: AlicanteSpain
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Grand Union for 4 days in March. The hotel was very clean, we had a nice size room that was cleaned everyday with clean towels & the hotel is in an excellent location. We walked everywhere!! The Captain Cafe downstairs is the best for breakfast, its cheap, the staff are very friendly & it does the best pancakes.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience”
Reviews.Author: GonzaloMiami
Reviews.Content: We where scared about this hotel in Manhattan, because the price is much lower than all the others hotels that we where looking at, but when we got there we where greatly surprised. The room was clean, warm (really important in NY), and well equiped, the cleaning service was great too, and the people at the reception where really helpful. I read rewiews about the water saying that it doesnÂ´t work well, but thatÂ´s crap, it works perfectly. The only thing that I didnÂ´t liked is that on thursday morning like at 6:30 am really noisy workers started yelling and I couldnÂ´t sleep, but I went to the reception, and the offered me a new room, but we decided to stay in the same room and wait to see what happen in the next morning, but we never had that problem again. I have decided to come to this hotel everytime that I go to Manhattan, itÂ´s economic, itÂ´s clean, with a great service, and the most important thing: ItÂ´s in the middle of everything and two steps away from 5th Ave and the Empire State Building

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: Rocket_Q
Reviews.Content: NYC is great but also very expensive. The moment I started looking for a hotel in Manhattan I was shocked: so expensive and such bad reviews! Hotel Grand Union is still quite expensive to our standards, but it was everything I wanted: clean the badroom was good great location only a minute walk to a subway-station Great deli just across the street (Silo if I recall well)

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location!”
Reviews.Author: speedyb
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled to New York on Sat 09.02.08 for a three night stay at the Grand Union. The hotel was clean and good value for money and in a fantastic location - just around the corner from the Empire State Building, which if you're lucky, you're able to see from the bedroom window (we were on the fourth floor and we able to see it!) Even though you pay room only basis, the 'Captain cafe' next door serves great breakfasts. The hotel is situated in a fantastic location in midtown Manhatten with many of the attractions within walking distance. However, please bear in mind if taking travellers cheques, as the hotel doesn't have the facility to change them and not many of the shops will do either unless the purchase is more than half of the cheque value. Just something to keep in mind as even though there are many international banks in Manhatten, there are few bureau de change facilities! All in all, we were very pleased with the hotel and the fantastic location!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - resonable fee”
Reviews.Author: SunnyGirlie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Grand Union with my son in April 2007. Considering the location we thought the overall experience was absolutely great. Rooms are small, but very tidy, and bathroom worked fine. The view wasn't very good, but I hear some rooms actually have a view looking over - or rather at - the Empire State Building. The staff is very nice and service minded, and the area itself is great - just a couple of blocks from the Empire State Building, MSG and Macy's. I would recommend this hotel to anyone with a tight budget - but also to those who like to spend their vacation money on something other than accomodation!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Glos_UKJoefish
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 5 nights. The staff were friendly and helpful. The room was small, but nice and clean. The room had a fridge, t.v and hairdryer. The room was cleaned everyday. The hotel is in a great location and only one block from the empire state building. I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Hotel Experience Ever”
Reviews.Author: Vancouverite4444
Reviews.Content: My brother in law made a reservation for us through Expedia, but before proceeding he called the hotel and made sure that if we booked a double room with a private bathroom but requested two single beds we would get it. He was told that would not be an issue so he went ahead and booked one night through Expedia. When we checked in we got one room with a double bed; we told them we had requested two single beds, but they said they did not have any rooms available but they could upgrade us to a quadruple (one room with a bathroom with a connecting room with a double bed and no bathroom) but they demanded 50% more. They said the request was just that and they were not bound to do anything. Furthermore, the administrator said he did know how to treat Expedia bookings, which means they don't give a damn what clients are offered. Since we had already paid for the stay and it was close to Xmas we did have no option and ended up paying just under what we would have paid in a better hotel. The hotel staff was just brutal to us. They lied, treated us badly and when we voiced our discontent with such a rip off they threatened to call the police if we kept complaining. Every time I told the reception clerk the things he had said he turned my words around and accused me of being a liar and demanding a free room. I have travelled a fair bit and I have never seen something like that. It was just outrageous. The experience made our trip to New York so unpleasant that we don't want to go back to New York ever again. The worst hotel ever.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: pigletScotland
Reviews.Content: heard so many horror stories regarding this hotel. But when we arrived checkin staff were friendly and helpful and the rooms were fine. We had already stayed in two other hotels previously but this hotel bet all. The location was excellant we were a few minutes from the empire state building, macy's and 1 block away from 5th avenue. I felt safe in the area we stayed in. I would definetly recommend going to Speedys this is a deli just a few minutes walk if that. The food is excellant. We ate there every morning. i would also recommend using the shuttle bus to and from the airport this certainly halved the expense than using taxis. I will definetly book this hotel again. Hoping to go back this year. 2 travellers from Ayrshire in Scotland, United Kingdom

Reviews.Title: “Clay family UK”
Reviews.Author: ruggi
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel with our two daughters. The rooms were clean, bathroom was kept clean and there were always fresh towels everyday. I would certainly recommend this hotel to others. The location of the hotel was absolutely perfect for sightseeing, shopping etc., and the subway was just outside the hotel. All in all, for the price we paid I thought it was well worth it. The coffee shop situated in the hotel vicinity offered a wide variety of food and the service was superb.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect!”
Reviews.Author: girl_botanist
Reviews.Content: I spent a few weeks searching for hotels in NYC that were inexpensive, accessable, and with acceptable living standards. I did't think I would be lucky, especially since my research delayed my booking by two weeks and once I started making phone calls everything was booked up! I was so mad at myself for waiting. Anyway, I finally find the Hotel Grand Union and give them a call. They had exactly what I needed, which was a basic room with a private bathroom (note to 1st time New Yorkers: private bathrooms are not always included, so be sure to request this when booking), and simple sleeping arangements for my sister and myself. It is only rated a 2star I think, but we were willing to spend the extra money to upgrade from a 1star. After reading all the reviews I was too worried about rats/mice/smells/etc., in the 1star hotels. We arrive and it is in a PERFECT location, 32 and park, which happens to be one block from the subway stop we took from JFK, a few blocks away from the Empire State Bldg, and Macys. The one subway stop we had great access to took us all the way up to Central Park and all the way down to groud zero. The place doesn't smell, the employees were very friendly, and we got to check in three hours early. The room was small, but that didn't matter to us. It had one twin bed and one double bed. The room didn't smell, had clean sheets, was free of rodents and insects, and had a surprisingly clean, nice, bright, but small bathroom (see pics). It was perfect for us. We were only in the room to sleep and change cloths, so it was just what we needed. They let us keep our luggage there for 6 hours after checkout so we could spend more time in NYC. Maybe people know this, but I had never used this service. It was free and we locked our bags in a room with a video camera. People do have access to the room, but only if they also have bags in it. There were only two other bags when we went in. I think it was $235 with tax per night, in a great location, and was clean and nice. I will probably book all my stays in NYC there. This is why I gave it 5stars.

Reviews.Title: “Small, clean and perfect for a budget”
Reviews.Author: Linda1662
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel located on 32nd Street one block away from the Empire State Building. It is a straight walk from Penn Station (10mins) if you fly into Newark and get the NJ Transit. The hotel is very clean and the room I was in was fairly big (New York standards), The staff at reception are pleasant and we had no problems checking in or asking them for anything. There is a subway on Lexington Avenue (20 yards to the right) where trains 4, 5 and 6 run. This is the green line and they run down towards the Staten Island Ferry and up by Bloomingdales. The price paid for this hotel was extremely reasonable, especially for what you get. The cost is approximately Â£80 per night per room. This is really cheap for New York especially with an inside bathroom, which was one of the nicest I have seen. Marble and very clean. Shower worked great too and the towels were thick and big and changed daily. There is a small diner attached to the hotel which serves great breakfasts. It is run by a guy called Tony who looks quite dour but is in fact a nice guy, quite funny. This is my fourth time in New York and I would say this is the nicest hotel I have stayed in. The only down point is that it is a bit away from the "action". Most of the other hotels I stayed in were in the Times Square area. However, don't let that put you off. If it is a budget hotel you are looking for and one which is clean then this is a good place to start looking. A couple of points of interest. In New York definitely go on the bus tour of the city. You get to see it all and the information you get can be invaluable. It is also quite a history lesson. If you like jazz go to Dizzy's Coca Cola club located in the Lincoln Centre but reserve your table here before you go.(You can do that on the interrnet direct). The quality of jazz is good and the view is excellent. You can get food and cocktails - excellent. There is a cover charge of $30 but definitely well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Liked it alot”
Reviews.Author: Ger06
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here for 4 nights. Really great location and above average standard of accomadation,especially for the price! Would stay here again no problem and recommend it friends without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “better than expected”
Reviews.Author: helen099
Reviews.Content: was pleasantly surprised at the grand union hotel. after reading other reviews i was a bit apprehensive but the staff were helpful, the room was a good size and the bathroom was clean however small (just a shower no bath). we even had a view of the empire state building from our room. it was a great location.

Reviews.Title: “grand union, just grand !”
Reviews.Author: kennomurf
Reviews.Content: small, but clean and central. It is based on east 32nd street of park ave. Has only about 100 rooms or so. we stayed in a double room for 5 nights after tanksgiving and found it well located and well looked after. No bar or restaraunt, but well maintained... unlike some of its more expensive neighbours. Would go there again !

Reviews.Title: “Simple, nice and clean Hotel!!Great price!!!”
Reviews.Author: hlontra
Reviews.Content: ItÂ´s a simple hotel, but very nice. The entrance hall is nice and beautiful. The room and the bed is quite small but cozy. The bathroom is clean. Unfortunatly, there was a construction right in front of our window wich made our room kind of noisy in the morning, but that's New York... The localization is good, a few blocks from Empire State Building and Manhatan Mall. There is a metro station right on the corner. We enjoyed our stay and we will come back in the future.

Reviews.Title: “a couple of blocks from the empire state building”
Reviews.Author: MissThing606
Reviews.Content: **Proximity** The closest things to the Hotel are the Empire State Building on fifth avenue, the 34th street shopping area and Grand Central Station on 42nd street. The nearest subway station is 32nd street but Grand central station is ten blocks away. Penn Station is about two or three blocks west of the hotel. **Room size, bed, condition** The room was sizeable, especially as Iâ€™d read reviews about the tiny rooms in NYC. **First impressions...** ... were good: a Queen bed with a wooden head-board. A chair and table, a chest of drawers and an armoire that housed a 28â€� television. All of this was in Dark wood. The dÃ©cor was old fashioned. One good thing about a hotel of this price is the fact that it has a private bathroom. And not just any old bathroom but a marble one! Marble floors, marble rooms. All in white and immaculate with towels and soap. The even better feature is the fridge â€“ yes a fridge in a 2* hotel! small table-top jobbie to make your budget trip even more frugal. The room also came with air-condition but the regulation range is quite small- basically you get â€˜coolâ€™ or â€˜a little bit coolerâ€™. Or â€˜warmâ€™ or â€˜a bit warmerâ€™. The 28â€� television came with 30 channels. the first night I couldnâ€™t sleep because of all the traffic outside my room.. However, next morning the reception staff gladly let me change room; In fact he gave me three keys to rooms that were away from the street and let me take my pick. There was internet access in the small lounge next to the lobby, There is no restaurant but there is a coffee shop linked to the hotel â€“ I never went there so I canâ€™t comment on it. However, in midtown Manhattan you are never short of places to eat. There is a small supermarket on 34th street so you can stock up your fridge. All in all, I was impressed by the hotel and the facilities. For my first time in the city the location was spot on. I would recommend it to anyone else though not someone with small children because of the lack of room service and room space.

Reviews.Title: “Typical NYC, small dark hotel room”
Reviews.Author: jakeena
Reviews.Content: As with most NYC hotels it seems, small dark room, no tea&coffee facilities but a bizarrely large fridge! Great location though!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Well-Priced, Well-Located Establishment”
Reviews.Author: DickinsMCF
Reviews.Content: Travelling with a group of some thirty other students, this hotel was chosen on our behalf based on previous positive experiences staying here. Accommodation was in threes; two singles and a double (a family room). Having read reviews warning us of bed bugs and stains I went somewhat apprehensively, I need not have done so. Each room boasts air conditioning which seemed to be little more than a noisy fan in the window! A fridge is provided but no safe, I dared not venture into the former however a most appreciated feature was the ability to remove coat hangers â€“many hotels are now resorting to having fiddly secured coat hangers. The bathroom was pretty much standard with an un-secured hair dryer, once again another useful addition which tends to be being either phased out or placed on short secured leads. I am still unsure as to the internet situation however I believe it to be this: free wireless broadband throughout the hotel with paid broadband downstairs in their lobby. As for travel around the city, 33rd Street Subway and 34th Street Herald Square are one and four blocks away respectively, the latter being most useful. There are eight floors (US style!) with extremely narrow and rather steep staircases in between, so if youâ€™re carrying luggage even to the second floor (US style!) then use the lift. I wouldnâ€™t stay here for the view, ours was of the adjoining buildingâ€™s fire escape and building works were occurring next door, these started about 6AM â€“ despite the joy I felt that there are builders in this world that start early, it did seem a little early. Otherwise, it was extremely quiet with no sound from other rooms coming through. Staff could certainly have been more helpful, indeed when one of the key cards stopped working (a complaint that other Trip Advisor members mentioned) the person on reception was most rude when one of our school staff enquired about obtaining a replacement. I agree with the other reviewers, this hotel seems to be stuck somewhere in the past on the decor front but what I care most about is cleanliness, and this place was very clean. Essentially this was a clean and ideally located hotel (central Manhattan for under $200 per night is pretty good). An ideal evening within easy reach could for instance consist of eating at the excellent French restaurant opposite then going ice-skating at the Rockefeller Plaza then getting a rickshaw to the Empire State Building (and going up it) via Times Square; simple yet memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DaveG130
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Union for 3 nights on our American/Honeymoon tour, A nice clean, well positioned hotel. Friendly staff and quite well priced for the location. Rooms cleaned and changed every day. Tv and fridge in the room, nice clean bathroom, What else could you need. A very pleasent stay Thank You

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - excellent position - great price”
Reviews.Author: maneatshouse
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here from 18th - 23rd October 2007. In general, I liked the hotel and I would recommend it to others. It's quite basic but for $190 per night in Manhattan on 32nd Street, it was excellent value. We stayed for five nights and were initially given a room on the second floor. However, there was scaffolding outside the one tiny window so we never got any light in the room. So, we asked to move and got given room 805, which was much better and had great views of the Empire State Building. I agree with most of the other reviews - the rooms look a bit tired, the shower temperature was a bit erratic but everything worked. The major bonus of the hotel is its position. There is a subway 20 yards from the front door and another three blocks away that can take you wherever you need. You can walk to the Empire State, Times Square, Macys etc in minutes. I found the staff were fine - not particularly friendly but not rude either. Overall, if you plan to spend most of your time out and about and only want your hotel as a reliable base and somewhere to sleep, this will be perfect. If you will only accept the finest in life, you need to treble your budget and other hotels will be able to cater for you.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Grand Union experience”
Reviews.Author: Traveller_YYC
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights, from September 18-20, 2007. Upon arrival, the front desk staff immediately found our reservation; however, they insisted that the room type booked (two double beds) was not available. The only option was to go for a room with three beds (two twin and one double), at a higher rate. When I asked if I could look at the room first, I was told that I would have to pre-pay one night first. After hearing this, I figured this place was a total scam. (Any respectable hotel will at least let you look at the room.) My first impressions of the room were that of tiredness. The carpet and furniture were stained, the beds worn out and the sheets threadbare. To the hotel's credit, the room was quiet, the bathroom was clean and there were no bed bugs. The shower did have some temperature problems; however, it was not unusable. The toilet's water pressure was unacceptable, though. The single elevator worked fine and there were never any elevator/hallway congestion problems. The cafe adjacent to the lobby served excellent, inexpensive breakfasts and was always busy. There is a great little pizzeria within walking distance (maybe two blocks), down Madison Ave. called Bella Napoli. On the last night I asked the front desk if they could reserve a shuttle van to LaGuardia Airport for the next morning. I was told that I needed to pay a five-dollar deposit for them to reserve a shuttle. This place will try to make an extra dollar any way they can. I ended up calling and reserving one myself. True, the staff are very brusque, but I found the best way to get what I wanted was to be just as abrupt back. If you are expecting a Holiday Inn-level of service, cleanliness, repair, quality, etc. it's not here. It's habitable; however I wouldn't stay here again or recommend it. I would rate it 1.5 stars â€“ but was generous in giving it two stars. Here's a recap: Pros: - Cafe next door served great, inexpensive breakfasts - Location; you're close to everything - within walking distance of most landmarks/attractions - Quiet - Clean bathroom. Cons: - Old, worn out rooms, beds in need of replacing and sheets that should have been discarded several years ago. - Hotel will try to make extra money any way possible, including charging to book a shuttle to the airport, claiming the room type reserved is not available and only a more expensive one is - Toilet water pressure is abysmal - Brusque, inattentive, unpleasant staff (best dealt with by being equally abrupt)

Reviews.Title: “Its a Mixed Bag!”
Reviews.Author: wtracing
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Grand Union Hotel 2 nights Oct 11 & 12 for 165.00 a night booked on Travelocity. PROS: It is in a good location, just a few steps from the #6 Subway line that will get you all over Manhattan in a matter of minutes. Also only about 25.00 from LGA Airport by Taxi. It is right off Park Avenue South so you can walk to Grand Central Station pretty quickly as well. The Bakery next to the hotel was nice for getting a quick snack, very reasonable price. The price of this hotel for being 2 minutes from midtown (by subway) Manhattan is excellent. Housekeeping did a good job of cleaning the room, it was a tired room but seemed to be cleaned well. NEUTRAL FEELINGS: The room definitely reminds me of an old office. The bed was well used and the shower was very difficult to use. The knobs were loose and it was hard to get a constant water temperature. For the price, I thought the room was fine, but there is certainly some quirks to it that one must expect. The employees of the hotel certainly could use a little customer service training. There were several nice ones, but many times (especially late at night) was met with a blank stare from the moment we came in the door until the elevator arrived. Not a huge deal, but a simple hello would be nice. I don't really have any cons for this hotel, although depending on what one is looking for the "neutral" feelings could be negative ones. This is great for young travelers, or people who really need to stay sub 200.00 a night. If you're looking for more, you'll have to pay more but this hotel served my needs well. as with the rest of NYC the area is safe and well lit.

Reviews.Title: “Mind the bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: CheungFung
