Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of September, the hotel is in a good location and seemingly clean although we both got a lot of bed bug bites!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: brtoy
Reviews.Content: On our last two trips to New York, we stayed at this hotel. We just spent 3 nights in a quad room. We paid 281. including taxes per night for a quad room and that's very reasonable in NY. We had a quiet room at the back of the hotel. The room was clean. Room looked just like the picture on the website,no suprises. You can't beat the price or location and the staff is friendly. We arrived early and was able to store our luggage until check in. Front desk was friendly and gave advice on sightseeing. We needed extra towels, I called the front desk and within 5 minutes a maid was at our door with extra towels. Room was cleaned every day. Nice little restaurant next door called Captain's Quarters. Good, reasonably price food and friendly staff. They gave us suggestions on sightseeing. I'm always amazed at how friendly New Yorkers are to tourists. When we got lost and was looking at the map, someone always approached us and asked if we needed help. Hotel is 5 minute walk to the Empire State Building, Macy's and 10 min. to Times Square. We had a pleasant experience at this hotel and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: pookeykat
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely 2-night stay at the Hotel Grand Union. We arrived on Thursday Sept 20th in the morning. Although we did not expect our room to be ready, we thought we'd chance it. The girl at the front desk took time to check if our room was ready and when she confirmed that it wasn't ready yet, she suggested we return around noon and she offered to store our luggage in the locked luggage room. When we returned after lunch, she recognized us right away and sped us through registration. The room was very small, but clean and quiet. We had no view at all (back alley) but that was ok since we were only there to sleep. Bathroom was clean and water pressure and temperature were fine. There was a small fridge in the room which we used to keep our sodas and water cool. Bed was comfortable but hard. TV had all the usual stations. There are 3 computers in the lobby lounge for our use. If it's your first visit there, you get 5 minutes free (ask the clerk at the front desk). Great location, half a block away from the 33rd St Subway Station (# 6). 2 blocks away from the Empire State building and 5 minutes from Madison Square Gardens. Nice little diner next door - cheap breakfast. When we checked out, they let us store our luggage again in the luggage room all day (our bus was leaving at midnight). When we returned to collect our luggage, the staff was very cordial with us and let us rest in the lounge area until we were ready to leave. We would stay here again in a heart beat. Great value for NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TripSwitch
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Grand Union recently on a trip to NYC. Having spent the previous week in Orlando in a super hotel, we got a shock when we opened our room in this hotel. The advantages to staying at this hotel is the location and it is a clean hotel. The main disappointment here were the decor is old, the rooms are worn out and some of the staff on reception were barely lukewarm. I dont know how many times I passed the front desk was simply stared at or ignored instead of being greeted with a simple hello. We asked about leaving our bags in the hotel for a few hours between checking out and going to the airport and the man at the desk growled at us about there being a luggage room. My keycard to get into my room stopped working twice and the same guy on reception really didnt appreciate me asking for another one! If I had to stay here again I would. But I;d be expecting the below average customer service from some of the front desk staff. This hotel is a ten minute walk from Macys, Madison Square Gardens etc.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough”
Reviews.Author: Arlingtontravel
Reviews.Content: The Grand Union hotel is a good enough hotel in New York, when you're a tourist who spends most of their time out of the room. The price is very good for the location - 32nd and Madison. The spaces (elevator, hall, room, shower stall) are small but they serve their function well. The beds are fine and while there's no view, there was also no noise (a plus in NYC). The room actually looked like it may have been an office at one point, with acoustical tiles and a fluorescent light in the ceiling and office grade carpet on the floor. It's not a luxury place but I would stay there again if I wanted to be in Midtown Manhattan. Good value for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: ChavBuddy
Reviews.Content: We had a reasonably good experience at this hotel. The hotel is well positioned close to a subway station and within walking distance of many sights. Our room was always clean if a little on the dingy side (with a small bed). The cafe next door served lovely cooked breakfasts. If you're looking for a good location on a budget then the Grand Union is a reasonable option.

Reviews.Title: “Not to much”
Reviews.Author: niqr
Reviews.Content: The elevator is a litlle scary, the aisle is pretty narrow (only one person at a time), the room with 3 beds was pretty clean. Noisy air conditioner, not view at all, no heater, beds were noisy and uncomfortable. I guess you get what you paid for. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice basic clean and friendly hotel Kalazan Chana Antwerp Belgium”
Reviews.Author: LONDONRUN
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my children and had a wunderful time. Staff is friendly and helpful. It is a basic clean hotel and very central located ; Small shower sometimes without warm water! Room was a little dark but who is coming to New York to stay in his room . Children didn't complain even the television worked ok. Comfortable beds .Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “great stay at the grand union”
Reviews.Author: LosAngeleSqueen
Reviews.Content: MY boyfriend and i planned a multi trip to nyc, niagara falls and d.c. so we were on a budget! The location was great! walking distance to subway, train station, empire state bulding, shops and restaurants! Our stay at the Grand Uinon Hotel was great. Clean and convenient...everything we were looking for! We arrived 6 hours before check in time and they held our luggage wish gave us an opportunity to eat breakfast. The reception allowed us to check in a couple of hours before. Room has a refrigerator, ac, own bath tv......HIGHLY RECOMMEND IF YOU ARE ON A BUDGET AND ARE LOOKING FOR SOMETHING NICE!....FYI.....if you are in nyc try the red double decker buses(hop on-hop off), see a broadway show, rent a car and drive to niagara falls....beautiful scenery!....enjoy your stay in nyc, we did!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: stecat64
Reviews.Content: We arrived early morning from Las Vegas (very tired after loosing a nights sleep) and had requested an early check in. We got our room at 12.30 pm!!! We went straight to bed to catch up on a few hours sleep and were in bed 20 mins when one of the staff walked in to the room without knocking! The room was very outdated (being kind here) and the air conditioning unit was noisy. The room was very small, the carpet was dirty and there were no wardrobes or coffee making facilities. The bathroom left a lot to be desired. On the Monday morning at 7am we were woken by drills, hamers and other general buliding machinery going full swing in the BUILDING SITE next door. We asked to be moved and were told that the work next door stopped at 4pm. Who wants to sleep in NY at 4pm??? The other 2 rooms that we were shown were not quite as noisy but tye noise would still wake you up. We checked out and went to another hotel. DON'T STAY HERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: LionGwil
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travelled to NYC from Toronto and flew back to Liverpool with Fly Globespan which was as good as any we have used - we travel extensively. I booked this via Venere.com,online because at the time they offered better rates than other hotel booking services. The hotel is situated on 32nd St.East between Madison and Park. This affords easy access to and from JFK.The room facilities were more than adequate ( TV, fridge, 4 piece bathroom and sufficient space for 5 days clothing.) The cafe next door serves a hearty breakfast for Â£3 ( at $2 to Â£1) with unlimited coffee. Plenty of fast food and Korean Restaurants are within minutes of the hotel. Once my wife and I , we are in our early 60's , fathomed the timing of the traffic lights we could walk to the Empire State Building in 6 minutes, Macey's in 15 and Times Square in 45 ( this was done late evening so there were no shopping attractions!!). The walk back via Bryce Gardens well worth it on Monday evening when open air films are shown - get a chair from the Library next door,most people had take away food, do the same and enjoy the party atmosphere. We would recommend taking a minimum of 2 day tour with one of the hop on hop off tour buses, we used the red one.To get maximum benefit study the map prior to boarding to ensure that you get off at points that interest you e.g. for cheap shopping downtown get off at Canal Street ( part of Chinatown). Check with the Guide at what time they expect the last one, 5pm is the last bus to leave Times Square downtown after that the night bus runs to and from Times Square with only one stop down and up at Empire State Building .There are plenty of ticket vendors milling around here from early morning. We combined our ticket with a 3 hours boat trip round Manhatten with the Circle Line. Tip - when you board walk across the boat to the opposite side , this is nearest land and gives more sightseeing. If you shop at Macey's take your passport to Customer Services, on the balcony above ground floor, for your 11% Tourist Discount Card valid until March 2008. They have a decent and reasonable priced restaurant in the basement. We did not feel at all threatened due to high visibility of Community Service Officers in all tourist areas and NY Police - check out their 3 wheeler electric patrol cars. We did not have time to visit Uptown, Queens etc - will come back again and will stay at the Grand Union - remember that you get 20 minutes free interest access. We enjoyed ourselves and hope this will help to make your stay a happy and rewarding one.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK, but if you can, stay elsewhere.....”
Reviews.Author: Annette39
Reviews.Content: Booked this for a girls weekend in NYC using venere.com because it was a good price - under $200 a night. I would not recommend the Grand Union. It was very basic with small rooms (as is the case with many NY hotels) and my friend and I found the traffic noise dreadful (didn't sleep the first night and bought ear plugs which helped the 2nd night.) After a sleepless night we tried to switch rooms to one off the street, but the staff member we spoke to was clearly unwilling to help us, even though the hotel was NOT booked out. We soon realised it was not worth the hassle of an argument, so we gave up and made the most of the NYC delights instead. The slack attitude of the staff member is one of my main reasons for writing this negative review. I will say the Grand Union location was convenient, and the rooms were reasonably clean (except a few obvious carpet stains)........but the rooms were old and needed renovation so they looked very tired. Personally, i don't think any of us (4) would book there again. Ironically, I just got the Sheraton Towers on Hotwire for the same price for another NYC visit later this month. My advice is shop around, and steer clear of the Grand Union if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: SBFluvs2trvl
Reviews.Content: After reading a large number of reviews on hotels in NYC, I deceided to stay at the Hotel Grand Union. When I arrived, I was pleasantly surprised. The hotel staff was friendly and very helpful. The room and the bathroom was very clean. The room was a little small but the location was unbelievable, especially for the price. The hotel was located a few blocks away from the Empire State Building and not far from Subway stops. Great shopping at Herald Square was also within walking distance. I would recommend this hotel to anyone that wants to stay in the heart of NYC and not pay a lot to do it.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again !”
Reviews.Author: Miss_Dutchie
Reviews.Content: You hear so many terrible stories about dive hotels in New York, so before booking the Grand Union we did a lot of online research and read a lot of reviews (about various hotels) We chose the Grand Union based on price, location and the positive feedback. And we weren't disappointed. The rooms are basic, but all the essentials are there and it is clean (always a good recommendation). The fridge in the room was handy as well! The decor wasn't to our taste, but who cares what it looks like, right? The bed was good, but small. The bathroom was clean and nice, good shower, bath. The location is really good, subway down the street and 2 blocks away another for other lines. Easy access to the whole city! If you're looking for a lot of bars and restaurants near your hotel, you might want to look in another neighbourhood, because there aren't so many here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Comfortable Rooms and Great Price”
Reviews.Author: Burakio
Reviews.Content: Arriving via cab from Newark, I was excited when I saw that the Empire State was a few blocks up and Madison Square Garden was a 5-10 minute walk down the road. The staff were friendly upon arrival, and provided us with maps of the city and brief directions. The hotel really is in a great location to explore the city. Empire State is 5 mins walk away, Madison Square Garden is about 10 minutes walk, and from the Garden you can get to Times Square in about 5 minutes as well! There is a wonderful, cheap little cafe right next door to the hotel as well as many food places scattered around the vacinity. If you are looking for NYC on a budget and want to maximise your time and see the sites, then I highly recommend this great little hotel. p.s. for you Shoppers, 5th Avenue is easily accessible by foot and don't forget to visit Woodbury Common!

Reviews.Title: “Shower problems, a bit noisy, read before booking!”
Reviews.Author: dianex619
Reviews.Content: We did not expect much from this hotel because we read up on the reviews. We didnâ€™t care for a fancy shmancy one. Everything was decent, the beds were a bit hard but it did not bother me much, it was acceptable. We were pretty pleased with the hotel for itâ€™s price and also because we had low expectations of it before booking the hotel. We were there to experience the city and not to hang out in our hotel room other than to sleep there at night. What really got us to give this hotel a bad rating was the shower system. The water takes a while to heat up (not so bad), but the fact that it would go from warm to burning HOT, that was REALLY bad. It happened every ten seconds. Trust me, me and my boyfriend stayed there for 3 nights and fiddled with the hot and cold knobs so many times, yet there really isnâ€™t a trick to it. It just sucks. When you turn it to the cooler temperature, it goes from nice and warm, to freezing ice-cold. It was horrible! Everything else was fine, decent at least. Bottom line, donâ€™t expect much, and if you are planning to shower in your room, donâ€™t stay at this hotel. If you donâ€™t mind the shower system than stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Price? What do you expect?”
Reviews.Author: Andyjo143
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 7 nights in this hotel in a double room on the top floor, not street-side. What a great location! Okay, the staff weren't great and the room was not romantic or special but everything else was just fine. The bed was comfortable, the sheets and towels were clean, the price was as stated, the TV worked, we had a fridge and a hairdryer in the room and the temperature was right (even though we had no control). Considering how great the location is, I say this is an excellent find. It is a little expensive but what do you expect in Manhattan?

Reviews.Title: “If you're looking for luxury or even a hairdryer....don't bother.....”
Reviews.Author: ShazzaBelfast
Reviews.Content: I travelled as part of a large group and stayed in this hotel for a one week period. On first arriving we were made to wait on the rest of the group, although we all had separate rooms. This wasn't fun after travelling for 12 hrs. The rooms are so small that I wouldn't recommend to anyone who suffers from claustrophobia or dislikes 60's type decor as I think this was the decade that the hotel was last decorated. Basic amenities such as irons and even hairdryers are not provided. I had the pleasure of having my toilet overflow so that the entire bathroom floor was covered with toilet water and another member of our party received free company, in the form of a mouse in her bed, and had to be moved rooms. Staff, especially those on reception, were not particularly friendly or helpful and with no internet connection in the rooms, they seriously overcharge for use of PC's in reception. $2 for every 10 minutes with additional charges for use of Microsoft programmes such as Word or Excel. The only positive points I found were the location of the hotel, which is very central for sightseeing or public transport, and the small cafe on the ground floor where food was excellent and cheap and the owner and staff were fantastically friendly and helpful - needless to say the owner leased the cafe from the hotel and it wasn't run by the same people.

Reviews.Title: “Nice affordable hotel in the middle of New York”
Reviews.Author: DK8240
Reviews.Content: Itâ€™s a nice affordable hotel only two blocks away from Empire State Building (see photo). The hotel is old and could use a modernization (the carpets especially). However, the hotel is clean and the cleaning each morning is as good as any 5-star plus hotel. We stayed there for 9 nights and were thrilled about our own bathroom (our primary reason for choosing this hotel). Despite other peopleâ€™s reviews at this site, I do no think that the Clerks are hostile. They were really nice to us and answered all our questions nicely. They even borrowed us a hair dryer for the whole stay. And yes, the elevator is slow (when going down â€“ for some strange reason). However, the steps are nice and clean â€“ and it is not that fare, even from the 8th floor. In addition to this the water is warm and there is heat in the radiator. On the down-side the windows are not the most modern. If you have a room on the street side you can here the cars clearly. However, is it not the charm of a city like New York? We were tired in the nights so it was not a problem for us to sleep â€“ and the street noise is lower in the morning. The only thing we thought was ought was, that the clerks at the hotel wanted us to pay at arrival instead at check out. It seems like they are trained in asking this question, since we observed some other people getting the same question. They however, just said that they would rather way to check-out â€“ which was not problem at all. So, just remember to question the request for payment at arrival. All in all, a nice hotel which is affordable if you want your own bathroom :-)

Reviews.Title: “very handy hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: psigley
Reviews.Content: My wife and i have just returned from a 5 night stay at the grand union and had a very pleasent stay. I booked the room direct with hotel via email, i feel i got a good price and everything was in order when we arrived to check in. You pay when you check in not out, i dont know if this is standard practice in the US but we were fine with this. I did see other guests who were a bit wary if this. The room was a good size and was clean and tidy, the bathroom was spotless. Decor was a bit out of date we weren't there to study the inside of the room so it was fine. The bed was comfy. There was also a tv and fridge. Rooms dont have safe deposit boxes so if you paranoid leave the family jewels and wads of cash at home. Although we had no reason to suspect the hotel was insecure. There are no food facilites but the hotel joins to a great diner next door, which serves great breakfasts, ideal to fill you up for a days sight seeing. Hotel has internet access for guests who need it. Staff were helpful when we needed them. NYC itself is like nowhere else we have ever been, soo many things to see and do i could go on forever. We did the whole sightseeing thing for which the hotels location was excellent, less than 5 minutes to the empire state building, 15 to times square and 10 to penn station (subway to just about anywhere you would want to go) Overall i would recommend this hotel to tourists who are going to be out and need to good base to go back to each night. Location could not be any better. Great value for money. Would definitly stay here again. Finally my tip for new york.. if you want to do the statue of liberty, book it online and get up early enough to be on the first boat its well worth saving yourslef the queues.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Grand Union”
Reviews.Author: IrishLass_80
Reviews.Content: The hotel was close enough to walk everywhere for both shopping and sightseeing - just a few blocks from Grand Central and the Empire State Building. We only needed to sleep in the hotel so luxury was not an issue. The beds were comfortable and most importantly the bathroom was clean. I found the staff very helpful and loved the attached diner where one could get pancakes in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than we expected, very central location”
Reviews.Author: TarotAngel
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weeks holiday in New York and stayed at the Grand Union. We were very unsure if the standard would be clean, and close to the Manhattan attractions but we were very pleased with our choice. The rooms are adequately sized and have a mini fridge, ensuite, tv and a good sized bed. The view however is not great as you are looking at another high rise building but in New York you cant really expect much else (and not as noisy as being right in the centre of things, we def got a good nights sleep!) The rooms are cleaned every day with fresh towels etc and the hotel staff are very helpful and multilingual. This hotel is only 2 blocks from empire state and macys and from there its only another few blocks from Times square, however if you dont feel like walking a taxi is around 5 dollars to times square or the subway is just on the corner of the block (from the entrance of the hotel, go right to end of block) we actually only found this 2 days before we came home! The hotel does not have its own cafe/restaurant but adjoined to the hotel is a wonderful bistro called Captains Cafe. The owner Tony is very pleasant and we looked forward to breakfast for the craic!! The food is really good no complaints whatsoever. I brought my own hairdryer as it was not stated wether they were available, but they were available at the front desk. Bring your own travel iron. The hotel also has internet access and the manager told us they are upgrading the hotel very soon with flat screen tv's, hairdryers, irons etc...Hope this doesnt put the price up too much! Overall we had a very pleasant stay and would def go there again It was very reasonably priced for New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value!”
Reviews.Author: rbarker82
Reviews.Content: This was a perfect hotel for our four-day stay in New York City. It's very centrally located, just five minutes' walk from Herald Square (excellent chain store shopping and some nice places for lunch) with excellent subway links. The 6-train station on 33rd street is literally 100 yards away, providing a direct link to Little Italy, Chinatown and the downtown area. Links to many other lines available at 34th Street (Herald Sq.) and Penn Station (10-15 minutes' walk). We booked directly with the hotel and were able to negotiate a small discount. We asked for a room with a street view and were given a decent-sized room on the 10th (top) floor with an uninterrupted view of the Empire State Building! Nice and clean, reasonably friendly staff who were helpful whenever we needed something. Would definitely recommend as a place to stay for first-time visitors who want to be close to the hustle and bustle of midtown Manhattan, but don't want to break the bank.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for its Price and Location”
Reviews.Author: Rickandjude
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in October 2006 during our Around the World Trip. We enjoyed everything about the Hotel. The position was fantastic and the room we stayed in was very clean and comfortable. The staff were most helpful and the cafe next door very convenient. We met our Doctor at his hotel ,much more expensive, and it could not compare to the Grand Union for Price or Location - we thought our room was better as well.We would have no hesitation returning to the Grand Union.

Reviews.Title: “Disappoinment with a capital "D"”
Reviews.Author: pumpkin4400
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for two nights on the referral of a friend and some positive online opinions. BIG MISTAKE! We didn't get any sleep the first night because our room was next to a late hour nightclub...loud music and DJ until 3:00AM. The room was freezing as there is no room themostat for personal control and the windows old and without weatherstripping. Although the bathroom appeared clean enough the linens were downright questionable! We couldn't get face cloths enough for three because the housekeeper had left for the day. I asked to change rooms after the first night. The room was quieter however other amenities no better. Neither room had daylight or any view as both rooms were next to another building with roof tops full of dead birds,old clothes,and debris. The overhead lighting was bad florescent in dropped ceilings. The staff never once showed friendliness,appreciation for our stay, or concerned that we were unhappy. If I hadn't prepaid for my stay on Expedia I would have left after the first night. Parking is a block down and costs $20.00 for 24hrs. We had a much better experience at The Travel Inn if you are looking for a clean, budget-friendly hotel in a good location. The parking is also free and right next door.

Reviews.Title: “Been Twice, Loved it”
Reviews.Author: KissMyChaddis
Reviews.Content: I have been to NY twice in 2006 and stayed at this hotel both times. First time I went was in April 06 with two male friends and we booked a triple room. The room was fine and we had no problems for the 5 nights we stayed there. It is located in a perfect area close to amenities and eating places. The second time I went, there were 3 couples and we were perfectly accomadated in rooms next to each to each other. One of my bookings was done for 2 couples and then a third couple arrived the next day. They were booked at a nearby hotel but preferred to be altogether with us. I asked at the reception desk if there was room and they changed some bookings around so the third couple could be accomadated. On top of that they even gave the room next to us so we were all one room apart from each other. The staff were friendly and even let me use the printer for our check in boarding passes for the flight home. Would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Everything You'd Want in a NYC Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brian_Abroad
Reviews.Content: Contrary to several other postings, our experience at the Hotel Grand Union was pleasant. We booked through the hotel's Web site, received a reply the next day, sent our credit card info, and had our room confirmed promptly. It was exactly what we wanted in a New York boutique hotel: tidy, convenient, and comfortable. When we travel, we only use hotels as a place to sleep and wash up. If you want a hotel where liveried staff are tumbling over themselves to assist you, where your room is big enough to hold a formal ball, and where there are more amenities than you can stuff in your suitcase, obviously you don't want a boutique hotel. To address some of the criticisms raised elsewhere in this hotel's listing: - Room size: New York hotel rooms are small, even in some of the snazziest "name" properties. We had space enough for two people to easily move around without one having to wedge into a corner to allow the other to pass. We were happy. - Front desk attitude: The hotel is managed and apparently run by new American citizens whose culture is not the same as American culture (which varies from region to region anyway). We weren't expecting to add the desk staff to our Christmas card list, after all. We didn't expect gushing obsequiousness, just politeness and efficiency. We got it and were happy. - Missing towels: We were two people. We got two bath towels. When we noticed we only had one washcloth, we mentioned it to the desk staff on our way out. When we returned we found they had delivered two more. We were happy. - Room temperature: The room was hot when we checked in. We immediately located the radiator knob and turned off the heat. (OK, so we had to lift up the radiator cover to do so. Big whoop.) The room cooled down while we were out exploring. We were happy. - Ambient noise. The hotel is in New York. New York is noisy. Most New York hotels are noisy, even the fancy-schmancy ones. We brought earplugs (which every traveler should have in their toilet kits anyway). We were happy. - Room cleanliness. The room was clean, the bathroom was clean, the lobby was clean and the staff were clean. The carpet was not frayed, the furniture was well-maintained and was dusted. We were happy. We have stayed in hotels, B&Bs, and inns all over Europe and the U.S. The Hotel Grand Union compares favorably to those boutique properties we enjoyed elsewhere. The price (for New York) was great, the room clean and large enough, the amenities sufficient, the #6 subway stop just steps away, Macy's ten minutes away, Times Square a 20-minute stroll down Broadway, and the staff as polite as necessary. Unless you plan to spend most of your New York holiday in the hotel, this is the perfect place for a good night's sleep and a bath. It's now our New York hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hated the Grand Union”
Reviews.Author: LoLaIreland
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel grand union in October 2006. 4 nights. On arrival the first thing I noticed was the bathroom had obviously not been cleaned properly, the bath was dirty. The room was tiny and very dull. Although in a great location in the centre of Manhattan I would not reccomend this hotel. I did not expect a luxurious hotel as it was a reasonable price but it just wasnt my cup of tea. It was very old fashioned. The lobby was newly renovated, they should think of renovating the rest of the hotel. In saying all this it has a really cute small coffee shop next door that serves breakfast etc. Despite the hotel I loved every moment of NYC !!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Shoddy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: irishbird15
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights over New Year 2006/2007. Tiny beds, tiny bathroom, dirty carpet, no temperature control in the room, consistently left too few towels - I could go on and on. The staff were clearly bored and were not interested in helping in any way. We had to pay for our stay on arrival, rather than on departure. We had to beg the manager to split the cost of our room across a couple of credit cards rather than pay on just one as "it messes up our accounting". If you stay here make sure you bring your own iron and ironing board as they are "against hotel policy". I will never stay here again. Dreadful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: pinkyEngland
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Grand Union for the New Year. The hotel is in a fab and ideal location within in easy waliking dstance (3 min) to the Empire State Building and Macey's. Also about 10min walk to Times Sq with subway stations on the street. However, the hotel is old. The heating in the room is centrally controlled and is exceptionally hot. In fact extremely hot and uncomfortable to the point of having to put my make-up in the fridge and actually needing a shower in the mornings after such a sweaty nights sleep - well cat-nap with the extreme heat and noisy air con. The rooms were otherwise clean but small and cleaned daily with fresh towels. The staff were polite but not outwardly friendly, attentive or helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Small beds!”
Reviews.Author: americanv8
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed at the Grand Union between 7/12 and 10/12 on our first visit to New York. We checked in around 5pm without any issues & were given a room on the 8th floor. First impressions were .. jeez this room is small, we weren't "that" bothered though for a 4 night stay. The bed is a standard double, we're used to a King size at home in the UK so that was our biggest gripe, i've never had a standard double in any hotel in the usa ever & it was really uncomfortable. The carpet in the room looked pretty dirty, the air con unit made aweful noises during the night. The bathroom was adaquate & clean although the maids couldn't seem to grasp the fact that 2 people need 2 face cloths, 2 hand towels & 2 bath towels, not once during our stay did was have the full quota of towels. There was a hot water pipe in the bathroom that was seriously hot, honestly touch it and you'd be branded for life, it also made some irritating noises during the night. Almost like someone tapping out SOS on it constantly! The staff hardly had 2 words to say but they didn't seem miserable, just not very interested in much. Didn't try the Captains Cafe next door as it was always full, Dunkin Donuts is only about a block away so we made that our Breakfast eatery. Location is pretty good, 10 mins from Macys, 15 mins from Times Sq, Number 6 Subway right on the doorstep. For the price it was good value, not sure if i'd stay there again though, i'd definately stay in that area of New York again.

Reviews.Title: “A Bargain Beyond Belief!”
Reviews.Author: JarMon
Reviews.Content: We had a general idea of what to expect as we had read the reviews on Tripadvisor before we booked a 5 night stay at The Grand Union. At the end of the day, we only wanted somewhere to rest, shower and change... Who goes to New York to spend time in a hotel room??? I was a little worried as some of the reviews were negative, but I found I had no reason to be! Granted, the desk staff aren't the friendliest bunch in the world- in fact they seemed put out any time we asked any questions- but they were efficient, and book in was extremely quick. We went to our room on the 2nd floor, and found it to be clean, neat, tidy and welcoming after a long days travel. It wasn't the biggest room, but it was more than adequate for the two of us, all our luggage, and all our shopping! It had a fridge, television and air con. My partner is a VERY light sleeper, and, even though we were on the 2nd floor and at the front of the hotel, we found there to be barely no noise at all! We had a lovely ensuite, nicely tiled, with bath, shower, toilet and hand basin- unlike some other reviewers, we had NO problems with water pressure or temperature- we found it to be perfect every time we used the shower. The room was cleaned to a high standard every day, with fresh bedding and clean towels left. It was our first time in New York, and we couldn't believe the location of the hotel! Round the corner from the Empire State Building, Madison Square Garden and Fifth Avenue, and a very pleasant stroll away from Times Square and Central Park. New York is on a plate for you! The only warning I have, especially for Irish people, is DO NOT USE THE TELEPHONE IN THE HOTEL ROOM! We made 6 relatively quick calls home, and it cost us $130, payable before you leave- we made the same length of call from a public phone and it only cost a couple of bucks!! Finally, a quick mention to The Captain's Cafe adjoining the hotel.. It was FANTASTIC! We had breakfast there most mornings and it was fine grub- pancakes, bacon, syrup, omlettes and much more, at an incredibly low price! Two HUGE breakfasts for about $10- You can't go wrong! We will definitely stay again on our next visit to NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Imagined”
Reviews.Author: Newberry
Reviews.Content: Normally my wife and I stay at other hotels like the Salisbury on 57th street, but because it was full and the rates were so high we decided to try the Grand Union instead. We were expecting the worst but it was not bad at all in fact we rather enjoyed it. The best part about the hotel is it's close location to the Lexington subway line which takes you direct to the Upper East Side or downtown. There are also a number of trendy restaurants nearby and a coffee shop in the lobby to get coffee in the morning without tramping through the cold. We drove down and unloaded the bags and found there is no doorman to help unload. Check in was swift and they gave us our room early, 10:30 instead of 3 PM. There is only one elevator so we had to wait for a while to get to the room, #809, a smoking room. The room was neat, big (for NYC) with three beds, and basic. There was no view, the bathroom was fairly large and clean, the water pressure was fairly low but not as bad as some others.There was a minifridge on the floor. There was one TV and the picture was a bit fuzzy but perfectly adequate. Check out was quick and the parking garage is only a block away. We left our bags in the luggage room ourselves so we did not have to tip a doorman for that easy service. So, aside from the slow elevator and the difficulty with luggage, the hotel is actually not bad at all especially if you are like us and are out all day.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff, Fantastic Location!!”
Reviews.Author: jetjay
Reviews.Content: We had a 4 night stay and found the hotel more than adequate for our needs. The room was clean and tidy and the daily maid kept us supplied with fresh towels and toiletries. The location was perfect for shopping and sightseeing. Only complaints would be that the room was a little on the dark side (although this was transformed to cosy with the lamp on) and there was some traffic noise at night. A budget hotel but definitely not a budget experience. Didn't really rate the coffee in the neighbouring cafe but overall a fantastic stay. THANKYOU

Reviews.Title: “steer well clear!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mickyred
Reviews.Content: recepionist seemed to have problem with females, told us that reception was shut because he was on his lunch, when asked for a morning wake up call, he replied why not just phone one another to save him the bother, when toilets blocked on the fri night, told us that it would be mon morning before it could be fixed, just downright rude/attitude problem.............just like a turkish fawlty towers.........never again!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay at Grand Union”
Reviews.Author: Babsclee
Reviews.Content: Grand Union Hotel New York Date 11th October 2006 Trip Advisor Member Cleethorpes England We stayed at the Grand Union Hotel for 5 nights and were pleasantly surprised. After reading the previous reviews we were unsure of what to expect. We arrived a little late after a flight delay and were met by a very friendly receptionist, the lobby was bright and clean and the checking in was quick. We had a room on the third floor which faced the back of the hotel so was a little dark, but we only intended to sleep there. The room was very clean, the bathroom was also excellent, with clean towels daily. We had no problem with the water in the shower at all. The coffee shop next door was perfect for breakfast every morning and we had no complaints. The hotel was very handy for the subway both up and downtown. We would not hesitate to book with this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ahard
Reviews.Content: I searched and searched for a budget friendly hotel in New York and ran into this one. I read the reviews on trip advisor and noticed that all the reviews had one thing in common (cleanliness). Based on how the hotel looked on the outside, I was skeptical even after reading the reviews, but took a chance and I am glad I did. The hotel was neat, clean, and quaint. It is a no frills budget conscious hotel. Me and 3 other friends stayed in the quad room. It consisted of a full bed and 2 twin beds. It was a rather large room. Very, very clean and the bathroom was clean and updated. The carpet was new. The only downside to the room was the view. Outside the window, the only thing you was a brick wall of the building next to it, but that didnt matter because we did not go to NY to look out of the window. The housekeeping staff was professional and polite and cleaned the rooms very good. The front desk staff was very helpful and friendly. We saw the same 2 front desk staff all weekend long (10.20-10.22). They even stored our luggage until it was time for us to check out on the last day. The food at the dinner inside the hotel was okay. The elevator is very small About 4 people at a time can fit in it but there's not really an issue. So if your on a budget and want to stay at a clean, safe, nice hotel--stay here!!!

Reviews.Title: “OK for NYC”
Reviews.Author: Dolmi
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 people in a triple room, 185 dollars + tax per night. The beds were firm and good (although real duvets would have been nicer since it was rather cold), the bathroom clean and with good water pressure, although the shower itself was extremely small. New towels every day, tv and a fridge was nice. However, the room was a bit small for 3 people with large bags, and we had practically no daylight, except for a tiny window with a curtain that was stuck in front of it. The fact that there only was one, small and very slow elevator was also a bit annoying, since it could take 10-15 minutes to come out of the building All in all, a reasonably good value for the money considering the town we're in and the location is superb â€“ Empire State Building, Wolfgang's Steakhouse and Les Halles is just a few blocks away. If you want to stay in a really nice budget location I would recommend the Chelsea Lodge, though.

Reviews.Title: “East 32nd St Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: sbmach
Reviews.Content: To get a hotel in Manhattan for 150$ was a steal and that too within a few blocks from the Empire State. The Hotel staff were very friendly , they helped us choose tours on the hop on hop off red busses, booked taxis , broadway shows . The rooms were clean , comfy and big for Manhattan . The bathroom was clean and adequate with decent showers. No views though, we stayed in Room no 501 where we saw the garbage dumped on the next buildings first level. Better keep the shades down. The Captain cafe at the entrance is good for a bite. Only irritating thing in this hotel is the solitary lift which can carry 4 people. Would recommend this hotel for its location, staff and cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Good, if noise/hard bed not a problem!”
Reviews.Author: AltaPat
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Grand Union for 10 nights in September, at a cost of a little over $1,800.00 including all taxes. The young ladies who look after the reservations were very pleasant and gracious. We had no problems at check-in even though we were late arriving. Reception staff were pleasant, some a little more so than others. Near Reception, there is a long, narrow lobby which is bright, clean and has some computers, which are somewhat expensive to use but are there if you need them. There is a little cafe next door which we didn't get to use but many people did so it must be fine. The cafe's posted menu had very reasonable prices and the amount of food on people's plates in the morning should have set them up for the rest of the day (smile). I felt the location of the hotel was excellent - just a block and a half from 5th Avenue, between Madison and Park on East 32nd Street, and about 20 minutes or less from Times Square, if that's were you want to go. We bought the 7 day subway passes and easily travelled to Harlem, Upper West Side, Williamsburg, Coney Island and Brighton Beach so never hesitate to use the subway to get around. Using a combination of subway and bus, we even made it to Historic Richmond Town on Staten Island. We had read many of the reviews on Tripadvisor so brought along an iron, coffee maker and hairdryer as the hotel does not provide these. We were particularly glad we had brought the coffeemaker so that we did not have to leave our room before having a cup of coffee in the morning. I couldn't have lived without my hairdryer either. I am attaching pictures to this review as they can best show what the room looks like and you can make up your mind whether this room would suit you. The room and bathroom were large enough for our needs, and included a double bed, cabinet t.v. with a good selection of stations and a desk and chair. A helpful addition to the room would be to have a lamp on the desk, if anyone from the hotel is reading this. There were also bedside tables with lamps so that you could read at night and plan the next day, which is another necessity to me. The room was very clean including the linen and bedding. I prefer to have my sheets tucked in but I've noticed in a few hotels that housekeeping seems to be leaving them untucked, possibly for the sake of efficiency. There were a few stains on the floor but otherwise the carpet was not filthy and I was satisfied with the cleanliness of the room in general. The closet consisted of a clothes rack and was adequate. We had a little fridge in the room which was very handy and appreciated. And the shower was great! We were able to open the windows in our room to let in the fresh air, which we were happy about. Even though this hotel allows smoking (we do not smoke), the room did not smell of smoke at all so non-smokers, don't worry. Our bed had the hardest mattress that we have ever slept on and that, combined with the noise from the street (we were in Room 804) caused us to become somewhat sleep deprived towards the end of our holiday. However, that did not cause us to slow down because the sheer energy of New York is so fantastic that you just keep going and going, there is so much to see and do. To summarize, the hotel is clean, in a good, safe location with a fair price. If you don't want to spend a fortune, particularly for a long stay, it is a decent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back in a New York minute!”
Reviews.Author: baglady83
Reviews.Content: I went for a week of shopping to New York with my mum for 5 days and stayed at the Grand Union as we found a great deal online and the location was fab! We were not disappointed at all and could not understand the bad reviews in the slightest.. Staff were friendly enough and very helpful with any questions we had. Our room was number 308 and didn't have a view but you're in the most built-up city in the world, what can you expect!? Room was plenty big enough and clean and the bathroom was spacious and the shower was powerful and there was always hot water. TV had loads of channels and bed was comfy too. Maids were very efficient too. We had breakfast every day at Captains Cafe which is joined to the lobby of Grand Union - the pancakes were AMAZING and very filling for a full day of shopping! Great value too as is most of New York. Location was good as it is only 2 blocks from the Empire State building (visit early in the morning to avoid queues) and about a 10/15 minute walk from Macys which is the best of the department stores for the cash-conscious visitor. Make sure to visit Times Square at night, it's great and also the tour of the city on the red buses is great value. Most places to eat are fast-food so we ate pretty unhealthily but there are places like Sbarro which have pasta and Cafe Metro which did amazing sandwiches, paninis and fresh salads and fruit and both of these can be found on a lot of streets. We only used the subway system a couple of times as we found it pretty confusing but you can buy a card like the London underground one and that will last you for the duration of your stay. Walking is a good way to see and feel the pace of the city though. Didn't use taxis once as most were always sat in traffic. The only problem we encountered was having sore feet every night from too much walking and would definitely return and stay at the Grand Union, it was brilliant!

Reviews.Title: “16th - 22nd Sept - Loved our Stay”
Reviews.Author: BevStedford
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location. Spotlessly clean rooms. Our shower worked just fine (we were on 7th floor). Cleaners very pleasant & f riendly. Linen & towels changed daily and room dusted & vacuumed daily too. Only fault would be the Reception staff. We had a total of 4 words said to us during our entire stay. On arrival we were asked "Cash or Credit Card?", and that was it. When we checked out we didn't even get a nod when we said "Thank You". Would definitely stay here again. A brand new diner (called Silo) opened just across the road on our last day there and it is by far the best diner out of the many we tried across Manhattan. Give the Reception staff some customer care training and this place is 100% perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, my second time and would stay again”
Reviews.Author: coral_mercan
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed at this hotel in the first week of september for 7 nights. We also stayed in january and this was our second time. We like this hotel because the location is great (2 blocks to empire state, 20 meters to downtown subway, 1 minute to uptown subway) Our room was at the 10th floor so we could see empire state from our bathroom. It was impressive at Labor Day with lighting, white-red-blue. This was the advantage of 10th floor. There was only one lift at the hotel and it was quite slow so this was the disadvantage of 10th floor. Turkish receptionists were really friendly and helpful. There was a safe at the reception and one of the keys remain with us and the other at the reception. There was a small fridge in the room. The water from the shower flew minimum that you cannot regulate the hot and cold water so we tried a cold shower this time. It wasn't a big problem for us because of the weather but it was in january. The room was very clean and the staff were very likely. If I have a chance for a third time in New York (i hope that deeply), I won't hesitate to stay in this hotel. I recommend this hotel to everyone... Enjoy..

Reviews.Title: “A great stay!”
Reviews.Author: chelle007
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Hotel Grand Union from the 8th - 11th July. GOOD POINTS: Large, nice rooms. Good location- short walk to the Empire State Building. So cheap for NY! Internet services available in the lobby (at a price). Captains Cafe next door is a great place for brekky! Air-conditioning. Staff are very accomodating and frendly. BAD POINTS: Slow lift. As you can see, I don't really have anything negative to say about this Hotel. It was one of the cheapest Hotels we could find, but it exceeded our expectations! I would stay here again, and recommend it to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: Gino_4_stars
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel twice now and can't fault it for the money that I paid. The bedrooms aren't anything special, but they are clean, enough room for your luggage and the hotel offers an exellent location in mid-town from where to explore this great city. Everything worked and the reception was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: jddphd
Reviews.Content: I booked one night at this hotel based on the tripadvisor reviews. I was hopeful when I arrived - the lobby was pleasantly lit, the service was friendly and prompt, I saw some young foreign couples on holiday (which is typically a good sign for me when finding decent budget accommodations). My room left a lot to be desired. When I book at a budget hotel I reduce my expectations. I know I'm not going to get 100% cotton bed linens for example, or the fluffiest towels. But I expect things to be clean and decent smelling, and they weren't. The bed linens were yellowed and very poor, the carpet was visibly dirty and dingy, and the room itself smelled. Perhaps others have had better experiences, but mine was not good overall and I doubt I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Saved Money and Enjoyed NY at the Hotel Grand Union”
Reviews.Author: ThriftyTourist
Reviews.Content: Smooth booking and check-in but did have to pay for total stay in advance upon check-in. Great location, reasonably priced, felt safe sight-seeing day and night (as a single traveler) and conveniently close to subway stops. My room was clean, quiet and air conditioner worked great in hot, humid July weather. Cheap eats (several fast food places) a couple blocks away. Also a Walgreens close by at the Empire State Bldg. where I purchased all my drinking water at $1a bottle, thought city water tasted awful. Agree with other reviewers about small elevator packed with people in the morning.. Taxi was $32 from La Guardia to hotel, not too bad. Only $15 for Super Shuttle pick up from hotel to La Guardia. Enjoyed my three day stay, no complaints, would book again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great find in midtown”
Reviews.Author: justducks
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel with family for 3 days at the beginning of June. The room was very clean and the hotel personnel was very helpful. The room on the 9th floor did not have a view, but with the empire state building a mere 2 blocks away, who cares? The only bad thing we can say about the place is that the shower is very tiny, but the washroom was still very nice with newly tiled flooring and all. We felt safe walking around in the evening and there were lots of nice restaurants within a short walking radius. There is a restaurant attached to the hotel. It is a great breakfast place where menu items are very reasonably priced and the French toast is excellent and priced under $4! I enjoyed my stay and will be returning this summer

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a decent hotel - everything 2-stars and up in mid-town was above $300/night this week. I found the Hotel Grand Union to be very clean, obviously recently renovated, and very quiet. Wish there was an iron and ironing board (and I was happy I packed my own hairdryer). Other than that - well worth the $145 for the convenience and I plan to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Grand Union- Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After doing lots of research on this site, I picked this hotel because it gets better reviews than any other 2-star hotel I could find in NYC. When I called a few days before my trip to confirm my reservation, the person I spoke with was very friendly. The hotel staff wasnâ€™t as friendly in person, but they were never downright rude and always responded to my inquiries/needs in a reasonable fashion. The room was pretty small, but we didnâ€™t feel too cramped. I read somewhere that this hotel has marble bathrooms, but we must have been in an older room because our bathroom wasnâ€™t marble. The shower was incredibly tiny, not even really big enough for one person to stand comfortably. The water temperature fluctuated somewhat, but nothing too severe. The toiletâ€™s flushing capacity seemed pretty weak, but it was never a serious issue for us. The cleanliness of the room and bathroom was pretty good. The towels are pretty small and basic, but they worked and were replaced every day. Nothing was dusty and I didnâ€™t see a single bug. At night the hotel was as quiet as a mouse. The only thing making any noise was our fridge, which we unplugged, but even that wasnâ€™t too noisy. I think the beds were sufficiently comfortableâ€”we were so exhausted we probably couldâ€™ve slept on metal slabs. The location is goodâ€”many sights are easily accessible, and Times Square is within walking distance. It isnâ€™t in the fanciest neighborhood in NYC, but the area seemed safe. I never felt endangered or threatened, and I felt secure sleeping in the room at night. I liked being able to leave my bag in the luggage room for a few hours after checking out. If youâ€™re on a budget or are just staying for a couple of nights, this place should fit your needs. Donâ€™t expect luxury, and you probably wonâ€™t be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice, no worries, centrally located, clean rooms and baths”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Friendly and competent service at our arrival, lateron a little poor but still ok. We liked our room on 6 th floor, it was clean and well furnished. The bathroom was clean and functional as well. Bed quality was good. Only the ac didn't seem to work. We liked the location just around the corner from Empire State Building, near to different subway stations. Not a "beautiful surrounding" but certainly not scary, Hotel is located in or next to the Korean village. We would book again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean, Good Location, Not too bad at all”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Grand Union on Memorial Weekend. Checked in on Saturday and out on Monday. The rooms were very small but very clean. The bathrooms again were very clean. Located in a GREAT area within very easy walking distance to the ESB (2 blocks) and just a half block to the subway. Very safe location and we had no major problems. Had a few issues that weren't really a big deal: 1. The AC didn't work very well, no matter how low we programmed it the temp didn't seem to go below 75 degrees in the room. 2. The shower could not make up its mind if it wanted to be hot or cold. One minute you were fine then the next you were either being scalded or frozen. 3. Had to put a $50 deposit to use the phone which was mainly if you wanted to use the data port to get online from your room. We didnt need this service but be warned when you check in ;) 4. Website states complimentary timed internet service - we never got it. My boyfriend had to pay $2 for 10 minutes 5. No one seemed to speak English at all, including the front desk person who never smiled. However the housekeeping staff were very friendly and polite. 6. Bathroom window (no screen) was left open after housekeeping staff left. Didn't realize it until morning and that made me a little uneasy as we were on the 6th floor and in NYC. Probably for ventilation since there was none in the bathroom. Good points: 1. Great price for NYC - you couldn't get a better price in a better location 2. Rooms were thoroughly cleaned daily 3. Bathrooms were very nice and clean 4. No problems with noise 5. Beds were comfy I would definitely stay there again and would recommend it to anyone. You get what you pay for, the rooms were small but for the price you can't beat the cleanliness and the location. We are going back this summer and will plan on staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & good location”
Reviews.Author: Sunzinha
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 4 days and I really liked it. The room was a bit small but very clean and made up every day. Great location. Walk distance to everywhere and very close to subway stations. I stayed on the 9th floor and had no problems with noise. Very quiet. The only concern was with the shower and toilet. The shower water skept switching from hot to cold and the toilet tank would not fill as quick. I talked to the reception and they were able to fix toilet on the next day. They do not have iron, coffee maker nor hair dryer in the room. However, they do have a little fridge which was very helpful. Great breackfast place attached to the hotel. There is also a really good brazilian rodizio restaurant, PorcÃ£o, right down few blocks (26th St and Park Ave). You get unlimited meat and salad bar for around 50 bucks/person. Really good food. I woud not recomment this hotel if you are looking for a luxury. I'd definitely go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recommend this hotel. We were staying on the 10th floor (no problems with the lift). Not much of a view and a little noisy at times but it's only to be expected if you choose to stay in the centre of a busy city !!! Room was a comfortable size, very clean and made up every day. Fridge and TV in room also. Room temperature fine, no noise from heating system. Shower fine too. Nice Turkish cafe/bar attached to hotel (shame it closes at 10pm though !!). Great location - 5 minute walk to Empire State Building. My boyfriend and I walked to all of the attractions from the hotel - Times Square, Broadway, Soho, Grenwich Village, Central Park, Chinatown/Little Italy etc. All were between 1 and 2 hours walk away. Taxis and buses were reasonable but we preferred the walk as you get to see more. We will definitely return to this hotel for our next NYC visit.

Reviews.Title: “Big Problems”
Reviews.Author: JRS1947
Reviews.Content: I booked a group of us at the hotel for a business meeting in NY. Big mistake. This is as close as it gets to European budget accomodations in the US. Maybe that is why some of the reviews from budget travelers were OK. But, if you expect a hotel that is acceptable for a business traveler you are in for a shock. Let me be specific: 1.) No heat. The boiler had been turned off and the front desk told us that he did not know how to turn it on. It was cold in the evenings in April! 2.)Bad showers. One of our guys gave up and took a bath. My shower alternated between too hot and too cold. No way to control the temperature. 3.)Noise. My window had a view of a ventilation shaft. Somewhere a nightclub with a rock band was playing into the wee hours--the bass gituar vibrated my room. 4.)Local Calls. Do you want to make a local call? You must leave a $50 deposit at the front desk! 5.)Furnishings. When I got to my room I pulled down the window shade. It came off in my hands! The room was small and dark (Not so dark after I lost the shade, however!) 6.)Elevator. One for the entire hotel. Real slow--if you could get it! Finally, don't lose your remote control for the TV. You must turn it in when you check out! Needless to say, we will not return.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Grand Union”
Reviews.Author: gwrjack
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Great value. I stayed for 4 nights recently and highly recommend it. Clean, comfortable rooms. Helpful and friendly reception staff. Will definitely return. I have stayed in much more expensive places in New York that had horrible rooms. This is a gem.

Reviews.Title: “one of the best ny deals”
Reviews.Author: misslily
Reviews.Content: Smallish, clean rooms, most redone in past few years. Little fridge in room. Safe, protected access to building. No coffee maker in the rooms I've stayed in here, but decent cheap coffee shop off lobby. No frills hotel but great for price, and one block from subway. Lots of Turkish (and other)restaurants nearby. Highly recommended for any trip when you spend more time out of the room than in. I go to New York 3 days a month for work, used to live there, and this is one of my two favorite bargain hotels (Gershwin is the other). Have also brought nieces & nephews here (5-13 y.o.) and fed 4 of them breakfast in coffee shop for under $20.00 before tip! The kids loved being this close to the Empire State building, even if we were on the subway to go everywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “good, clean hotel , walking distance to many attractions”
Reviews.Author: lb777
Reviews.Content: spent 4 nights and can recommend this hotel! ideal for all attractions. Staff very helpful and friendly. Cafe right next door, excellent,although not open till 8pm every day as it says but plenty other places to eat. Shower a bit tempermental but manageable. Loved Times Square - it was everything and more but glad i was not staying in the hustle and bustle!! Rooms are big enough although take coathangers if you need to hang clothes. No iron or hairdryer but a fridge available for refreshments!!! Try it i'm sure you willl not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay there again”
Reviews.Author: harveysgirl1
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel cannot be beaten!! Very central, walking distance of Times Square, etc.. The room was small and basic, but spotlessly clean. The double bed was too small for two people so sleep comfortably. The staff was reserved, but not unfriendly. A great hotel to use as a base for exploring New York. I'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience at the Grand Union”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The room was small, but clean. It's in a great location, a few blocks from the Empire State Building and walking distance to Times Square, Penn Station. This is a "no frills" hotel. It's perfect if you only plan on sleeping and showering there. The rooms did not provide an iron/ironing board, alarm clock or hairdryer. There is a great diner connected to the hotel. Good food, very cheap, good service. Overall, I'd say it was a good experience. You do get what you pay for, which is why I wasn't surprised at the lack of ammenities. This is a great hotel for short trips, or if you are on a budget. I'd go back for a weekend getaway.

Reviews.Title: “40th Birthday treat”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Grand Union was situated in the best possible location for our trip to Manhattan. The rooms were as booked, basic but clean. Maids even folded the wifes pjs very neatly every day. Very helpful friendly staff and an excellent cafe ajoining the hotel, where you get first class service. Sit on the bar stools for a truely American breakfast...where you can watch your breakfast being cooked while chatting to the friendly Turkish manager. We were there in December and the rooms were cold...but the bath was the fastest / hottest running water i've ever seen. As said before, an excellent base for your trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room for the price, just what we expected”
Reviews.Author: captmorgnsgrl
Reviews.Content: We went into Manhatten to vist my sister in law. She booked the rooms for us as the Hotel Grand Union. The hotel is just around the corner from her townhome so it was a great location. It is a quaint hotel and the staff could not have been nicer. First let me state that it is not luxurious, but comfortable. A great base point if your not going to be in your room all the time. It was just my hubby and myself, we had a room with a full bed, nice bathroom an apt size frig, tv and we opted not to get the phone in our room. There were a few problems, but I am not to much of a complainer, but some people might not be able to deal with them. First, the water in the shower did not stay hot. I had to keep jumping out of the stream of water at times as it went from hot to cold. Second, there was no thermostat to regulate the heat so the room was like an oven. it had the old steam pipe heating. Thank goodness it was 30 degrees outside, so we opened the small window in the bedroom area and the window in the bathroom. We even went as far as turning on the airconditioner that was in the room. That seemed to help quite a bit. There is only one small elevator so it would suffice to say you need to be patient. There are plenty of great restaruants around the area. A little coffe shop is locted through a door in the lobby of the hotel. It is very small and serves up a great breakfast sandwich. They also have internet access in their lobby, 3 pc's set up, you can purchase minutes at the desk. A nice little sitting area is adjacent to the computers if you want to just sit an read or have a cup of coffee. I had gone down as they had some local artist's work up on display there. Besides I needed to get out of the room and get some air. We had rented a car as we had arrived in NYC and drove to the Poconos for a few days, then came into Manhatten. We had to park our vehicle for 3 days which ran us $78.00. That wasn't bad and it was a secure udnerground lot. All in all it was a good place to hang our hats! When we were there it had snowed and it was cold! We had great time and would stay there again. Oh by the way we were on the 9th floor. one other thing getting off the elevator on our floor was a challenge. Very small corridors, but you get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, location, staff”
Reviews.Author: nyxplant
Reviews.Content: For the last few years I've been staying at the Pickwick Arms Hotel when I go to NY to hang with my buddy. This time we chose the Grand Union. I was very pleased. We booked through Venere - which was great because they don't charge your credit card - and their cancellation policy is great. We amended our dates 2 days before arriving with no problems - and no charge! I've never used Venere, but I will do so again - in addition, they had access to rooms where other travel sites (expedia, hotel, etc.) said were full. Enough about that - but I thought it worthwhile to mention. To start, the hotel was very clean - which is not something that usually accompanies such a bargain rate. We paid $165/night for a twin room (full size bed + single bed). When you're in town with a friend it works out to about $95/night each after taxes. Not bad for the holiday season in NYC. The Pickwick Arms charges $89 for a single (shared bath) and $109 for a single (en suite bath). That was last year's prices. No doubt they've gone up some. Add tax to that and you've got quite a bargain in the Grand Union. Our room must have been refurbished recently because it seemed like everything was fairly new - even the carpet. There were even newer windows. The room had a table/chairs, mini-fridge and cable TV. The bathroom was quite small - which was bothersome - but certainly tolerable for the price/location. The shower was EXTREMELY small (reminded me of a phone booth) and your knees were against the wall when, er, "sitting" in the bathroom. Very clean though. Fresh towels each day too. Water pressure was pretty low, probably due to our upper floor accomodations. But the hot water seemed readily available. Beds were firm and seemed new as well. We didn't have too much trouble sleeping after several libations, and after all, isn't that the point of these "tourist class" hotels? You don't get them for the creature comforts - you get them for the slightly accomodating horizontal surfaces. For the price, this is definitely the place to stay. The subway is literally right outside the door (Lex Line) and Grand Central is 10 blocks up the road. What more could you want? If you're disappointed in this hotel, I would guess that it's probably your expectations more than it is the hotel. This is a tourist class hotel. Adjust your expectations to the appropriate class of accomodations and you wont be disappointed. The staff was extremely friendly and very accomodating. We didn't have any special requests, but I'm quite certain they would have entertained any we had. The front desk clerk, a Turkish fellow, was as friendly as we could have hoped for. As for those who had trouble with fixing their issues, maybe it was the way in which they asked/demanded service that caused the rift. I will stay here again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went there to celebrate my husband's birthday with my two children and they gave us two rooms but one of them had no heater. Actually, the room was extremely COLD and you can also feel a draft of air through the windows. The room was dark and HORRIBLE! As soon as we arrived my husband made a reservation to move to another hotel. We moved at 7:00 a.m. that is how bad it was that we just wanted to leave that place! I will not even put my adorable chocolate labrador in that hotel. Accomodations were just horrible!!! The beds were like sleeping in a brick floor. The people at the front desk were polite, but you need a nice hotel when you are on a vacation. I called my travel agent and complaint. I will never - never stay there. Think twice before you reserve a room there.

Reviews.Title: “"Gem" Hotel Grand Union”
Reviews.Author: sets4047
Reviews.Content: I'm from HI and spent five nights at the Hotel Grand Union. I'd read all the comments about this hotel on this web site...and some of them were true. The hotel has the slowest elevator I've ever used. But the staff especially the women who cleaned the rooms were very personable. The front desk people didn't welcome us with open arms but were very helpful with suggested places to eat and visit. The hotel was very near to the subway line and that in itself was a plus. Yes, the room was small but we were there only to sleep. I must comment on the size of the shower stall...I could hardly move around without bumping the side of the walls! (And I'm 5' 115lbs.) I don't know if I'd return there but for the price and the dates that we were there it was very reasonable. We were there from Nov. 23-28th. Being from HI visiting NYC during the Thanksgiving holidays was very invigorating and an adventure. Mahalo (thank you) to the wonderful staff at Kitchen 22 who made the meal and the ambiance of Thanksgiving a memorable one for travelors who were far away from sunny Hawaii.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for one time, probably won't stay there again”
Reviews.Author: DCtripster
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Hotel Grand Union from November 24 to November 27. While it was okay, we probably won't stay there again unless there is really nothing else available. Here is my version of the pros and cons of this hotel: Cons: -Cold room (the old radiator in the room doesn't seem to give off much heat) -Bed is too small for two people, and the covers are quite thin -They only gave us one washcloth each day -The sink is hard to use because there is a ledge that sticks out right above the basin, making it very difficult to even brush your teeth -No remote control for the TV -No clock in the room -the shower temperature is a bit hard to control, although i found it better than a lot of budget hotel showers -it is not THAT close to the subway, and it is quite far from the heart of Broadway -the one elevator available was quite slow Pros- -The room was very clean and roomier than we expected -The bathroom seemed to have been recently remodeled -There was a fridge in the room, although it would have been nice if there was a microwave too -The front desk people were friendly enough, if perhaps a bit spacey -there is a room to store your luggage for free after checking out -the lobby and front room of the hotel are quite nice -There is an abundance of Korean restaurants nearby -It is about a 10- or 15-minute walk with luggage to get to Penn Station

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: honeysusie
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed in the Grand Union recently for four nights.Our requests were honoured in that we asked for a high floor and adjacent rooms.The hotel is in a great location,very central to all the sights and the shops.There is a subway nearby. The staff were reasonably helpful.The room was adequate size for the amount of time we spent in it which was very little.It was a base to sleep, shower and change and dump vast amounts of shopping. It was very clean and comfortable and surprisingly quieter than I imagined for New York.The linen was changed every day.When we asked for extra pillows and lighbulbs changed it was done the same day. It was reasonably priced.We would all certainly return to the Grand Union and recommend it as a base for shopping and sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “good location and value”
Reviews.Author: SOL_III_Design
Reviews.Content: No matter what your financial resources NYC can sometimes manage to raise an eyebrow with a particularly outrageous price of some thing or another. Then again, if you are really savvy (or lucky) you can find real bargains and real value for many things here. In the case of hotel lodging, value is always relative to the market you're in. The Grand Union Hotel is a great value for the NYC market. My wife and I were there for 3 days on a buying trip in the garment district. Having stayed in several other hotels in the City at much higher prices and with low quality, I was searching through TripAdvisor looking for a better deal. We could have played it safe and booked at one of the well known chains or boutique hotels but what fun is that! -and unless you find a special rate their price/quality ratio is always low. Anyway, after reading the mostly favorable reviews for the Grand Union I decided to take a chance. The hotel is mostly as described. It is in a good location for touring the city(for us that is near the Garment District). The Statue of Liberty, Time Square, Macy's are all within walking distance. The room was clean and of decent size. There is a diner attached to the Lobby but they closed early (around 8pm I think) but there are plenty of other choices in the area. One problem that has been mentioned and we can confirm is the temperature regulation of the shower. Taking a shower is an adventure. The water runs from scalding hot to ice cold in a matter of seconds. Come to think of it I do recall a Spa treatment that calls for emersion in hot pools followed by cold ones so maybe this is an amenity. A minor complaint is the towels. They are very threadbear -from being washed a few times too many I suppose. Also, we were in a room on the street side. I thought that we were high enough (on the 6th floor) that the street noises would not be an issue. Wrong! If you are a light sleeper you will definately want to request a room away from the street or be prepared to be serenaded by garbage pickups at 3:30am If it is romantic ambiance you seek, or boutique hipsterness, then this hotel will not appeal but if you need a clean, comfortable room from with to launch your explorations of this amazing city then this hotel will fit the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Great value - right in the heart of Midtown Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Hotel Grand Union in October 2005 and found it to be perfect for our needs - a place to stay in between shopping, eating, drinking and sightseeing. We were a bit dubious when we saw that it was so reasonable in price for the location, but we were soon proved wrong - the hotel is clean, the staff friendly and the location perfect. 3 blocks from the Empire State, a few more to Macy's and a subway station on the corner of the block - what more do you need in NYC!!! Not too far from Penn station either - ideal for those of you flying in to Newark - just get the train to Penn station and it's only a few blocks walk (4 I think) to the hotel.
