The diner next door - Captain's - was fine with friendly staff and reasonable prices for breakfast. The rooms were basic enough - bed, TV (with cable and HBO), ensuite bathroom and air conditioning. The maid service was excellent - beds made every day, towels changed (you may neeed to ask for extra towels) and bathroom cleaned daily too. The lift was a bit slow, but you can use the stairs if you're in a hurry! If you're in town for shopping and don't want to spend all your money on accommodation, this is the place for you. It's not the Plaza, but it is well worth trying. I would definitely go back again and will recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: Delores_Ramona
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a trip to NYC and we stayed at the Grand Union Hotel. We spent 5 nights there before a cruise and one night after. After reading many reviews of the hotel, I knew there were mixed feelings about the rooms. Ours (on the fourth floor) was more than expected. It had room for all our suitcases, a desk and a roomy complete bathroom. We found everything to be very clean and appreciated the fridge in the room, the air conditioner and the extensive TV channels. We booked through hotels and paid $160. CAN per night, which was one of the most reasonable rates I could find. Most of the staff was friendly and helpful. One of the biggest advantages was the location, close to Empire State Building. We walked to Macy's, and Times Square from there. Also, from the subway stop at the corner we could get almost anywhere we were headed. We did use cabs a few times, and they were reasonable. We took a city tour with New York Party Shuttle - excellent guide and good overall introduction of the sights to see/visit in New York, along with lots of history. We liked the Captain's Cafe in the hotel. We ate there for breakfasts mainly and found the food and service excellent. HOT and fast for a very reasonable price. We also picked up food and ate breakfast at The Brooklyn Bagel, two blocks from the hotel (corner of 32nd St. and Fifth Ave.) - it was good. We would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate, but would try somewhere else next time....”
Reviews.Author: Ines
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel adequate, but not to the standards of say a Holiday Inn. The hotel staff were helpful and friendly. When we first arrived I checked out our room and I found that the bedspread was dirty and also one of the pillowcases looked uninviting. I asked the young guy on the reception desk, who immediately supplied a clean bedspead and a new pillow and pillowcase. Our bathroom had a very tiny shower cubicle, but it was OK. Our friends were lucky enough to have a larger bathroom with a full bath and shower over. Downsides.... the bedroom carpet was old and dirty / sticky (take some slippers!), our shower cubicle was extremely small, the wallpaper in the room was old and tired. Upsides..... the location was great, near to the Empire State building, the reception staff were friendly and helpful, the room rate was good (compared to other Manhattan hotels) around 125$ a night plus tax through Expedia. The maid came in every day to provide clean towels etc. If you want a clean bed and an edequate room at a budget price, this hotel fits the bills. I would however try to find an alternative for our next trip. But if all the other hotels are much more expensive, I would consider staying there again. The local New Yorkers were very friendly and chatty and they made our holiday one to remember. I felt sad when we left, which was a great surprise to me. We will definitely be returning soon, as Manhattan is a great place to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely return”
Reviews.Author: moonflower
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Union between 12-19th September 2005. The best aspect of this hotel, in addition to the low room rate, is the location. Many NYC highlights are within reasonable walking distance e.g. Empire State Building, Macy's, Times Square. Plus, the hotel is only a minutes walk to the nearest subway (E33rd St) where a #6 took us to the attractions further a field. We had a reasonable sized room at the back of the hotel, so no view but no traffic noise either. The room was cleaned to a high standard and fresh towels left daily. If you are planning to spend your visit to NYC in your hotel room then you may wish to pay a lot more for a room with a few more facilities, but if like us, you want a safe and clean base from which to explore the city, I would highly recommend the Hotel Grand Union. We will return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great 21st Birthday”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Union from August 27th to September 1st. It was a present for my 21st birthday. We had a wonderful time and we were not in any way dissapointed by the accomodation. The hotel was clean and the room was big enough for the two of us. We paid Â£500 each for the trip (including return flights) and the hotel was perfect for our budget. It was in a great location, just two blocks from the Empire state building, and just over the road from a great Deli, selling litre bottles of Corona for $3.50. There is also a great little pizza shop round the corner, highly recommend. I would definately stay at this hotel and will be recommending it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, will stay again !!!”
Reviews.Author: JohnDoe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Union at the end of March 2005 for 5 nights. Our first trip to New York, we picked the hotel after reading the reviews on TA. The hotel is in a excellent location and really good value for money. We had to make 2 reservations (one for 2 nights & one for 3 nights) through two different companies as we couldn't get 5 nights in total with the same company. I called the hotel about a week before we due to arrive to double check they had a reservation for us (after reading one review on TA about someone having problems) and to advise them that we had booked via two companies and that we would prefer the same room if possible for the duration of our stay. The polite guy on reception located the reservations straight away so I didn't need to worry about the previous review. He said he would make a request on our reservations but wouldn't be able to guarantee the same room. On arrival at the Grand Union reception told us we would need to check with them after our 2nd night if we could have the same room again for the further 3 nights. Unfortunately we couldn't keep the same room but this wasn't a problem for us. We left our luggage in the secure left luggage room until our room was ready later in the day. We were told we were moving to nicer (recently decorated) room for the remainder of our stay. Couldn't fault the staff, they were always polite & cheerful. ROOMS - Very clean and comfortable. All en-suite - no need to share a bathroom The 1st room didn't have a lot of spare floor space, enough room at the end of the bed for 1 suitcase on the rack but our other suitcase we had by the side of the bed and one of us had to step over it. But the plus point was the bathroom was bigger than the second room. The bathroom in the first room had a bath with a shower overhead. The 2nd room had loads of floor space (by this time we had 3 large suitcases after all that shopping) and there was plenty of room and no need to step over any of them. But we found the bathroom a lot smaller with a shower cubicle only no bath. The shower cubicle is however on the small side, I was ok as I'm very small. This room was also located at the front of the hotel, 9th floor and we never found the street to be noisey at night. I will attach photos in a couple of days Hotel has free safety deposit boxes which are in the office behind reception. The hotel is in a excellent location with one of the 33rd street subway entrances a few yards away. The Empire State building was only a few minutes walk away, en-route there is a good bagel shop to get breakfast or lunch. Hope you enjoy your stay as much as we did. We will return to the Grand Union.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied with the Grand Union”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Grand Union from Sept 12th to Sept 18th 2005. I am writing this review from my room at the Hotel. The front desk staff is not terribly friendly but not rude either. They tried to be helpful with my requests. I asked them when the hotel was built (I am in to New York History) and they looked at me like I had asked a weird question. No big deal, but they had no idea when the hotel was built or any of the history of it. If you look up at the side of the hotel from across the street you can see "Hotel St Louis" in washed out white paint. The hotel has 10 floors my room was on floor 9 on the street side. I am guessing that this brick hotel was built in 1920's or so. The Hotel room was slightly bigger than expected. I have stayed at other NYC hotels and know how small a room can be. This room had plenty of space for me and my wife. I had a desk that I could put my laptop on and used it while the wife watched cable TV with free HBO while she sat on the bed. This was during the time we were in the room. We were out around town most of the time. I tried to find a public wireless network with my laptop and did locate a few but the signal strength was to low to be much use. So I used my Cingular PCMCIA Edge card in my laptop and it worked great the whole week. Nice to have the Internet available. The laptop is my work laptop and my company provides the Cingular Edge card. The card connects my laptop to the Cingular cell tower. The account is set for unlimited use with no roaming charge ( I live in Seattle) the charge is about 70 per month. I was getting 144 k downloads and 92 k uploads from the hotel room. They do have two or three computers off the hotel lobby they use as Internet pay terminals. 2 dollars for 10 minutes or you can buy minutes in bulk for cheaper. I like my alternative better. Two ample dressers for our clothes. One dresser was built in to the furniture for the TV. A clothes rack to hang clothes from and a small fridge in the room. There was no safe in the room to put the laptop in while I was out. I put the laptop in the dresser under clothes and did not have a problem, although I did worry a bit. The room was cleaned daily by the maids, Polish women who were obviously immigrants. They were friendlier than the front desk staff. I asked what language they were speaking and they told me Polish, they also can speak Russian and English.. Even the maintenance man was a Polish speaker. While the room was large enough the bathroom was quite smallâ€¦ but clean. We did have problems adjusting the temperature of the shower water. The hot and cold knobs were reversed and it took several minutes to get the right temp to take a shower. The weather was warm during our stay and we used the window mounted air conditioning unit almost all night every night. When we did turn off the air con we could hear loud trucks from the street every night picking up garbage I think or it could have been noise from the Federal express terminal located at the corner. With the air con going the noise was not a problem. Again we were on the street side of the hotel. If your stay was during cold weather you would be using the window mounted unit for heat. Two blocks from the Empire State Building in a regular Mid Town neighborhood with Deliâ€™s, Wendyâ€™s, MacDonaldâ€™s, souvenir stores, ethnic food and office buildings. The one elevator takes some patience. It services the ten floors all by it's self and you may have to wait three or four minutes during peak times. Number 6 Lexington Ave train at 33rd Street right at the corner. Easy trip to Canal street, or upper East side Museum district. First stop towards uptown is Grand Central, from there you can go anywhere. I did walk back to the Hotel from Times Square it took just under 20 minutes. This was my wifeâ€™s first trip to New York and she asked me why didnâ€™t you make reservations at the Holiday Inn or something ? I told her that we paid 140 a night for this hotel. A Holiday Inn type hotel she was thinking about in NYC would cost us at least double. She is a West coast person who does not totally appreciate New York. If you are looking for a bargain hotel in NYC and 140 to 160 a night is a bargain then this hotel will work for you. If you want a Holiday Inn experience the Grand Union will disappoint. I was satisfied and quite comfortable at the Grand Union. My wife would of preferred a more expensive hotel. I believe we could of paid more but got less.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what I was looking for”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you are traveling on a budget but want to stay in midtown Manhattan, this is the perfect hotel. My girlfriend and I stayed at the Grand Union for five nights. It was a great location for sightseeing, right next to a subway stop and two blocks from the Empire State building. The room was clean and comfortable, and the bathroom was suprisingly modern with what looked like an almost brand new tub and sink. It was also very quiet at night. This is not the right hotel for those looking to stay in the lap of luxury. As others have reported here, there is no iron in the room and no hair dryer. The rooms are small and our window faced an empty alley. But if you are like us, you'll spend most of your time out exploring the city and will only return to the room for sleep and to clean up. For the price, this hotel can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked the Grand Union over the internet, and so were a little uneasy about what we might find. To our relief, the hotel was exactly what we needed in the price range we had to work with. The lobby is inviting, and our room was a decent size. It had a newer air conditioner which was GREAT in the 96 degree heat. The bathroom was a little dark, but it was clean. We really liked this hotel, and found the front desk staff to be very helpful. They gave us information on everything we asked for and they were always friendly. This hotel is not fancy and it's not glamorous, but we weren't planning to spend our vacation in our room. This was a safe, comfortable place to come back to at the end of a day of walking and sight-seeing. I'd stay here again, and I'd recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Accident prone bathroom and no basic amenities”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were in NY only for 2 nights and as a last minute booking frenzy booked a room with this hotel. As soon as we got there we saw customers having a bad time with the staff as they charged with for calls they never availed. When we entered our room , it was a rude shock as it was like a pigeon hole ! To top this there is no hairdryer or even any facility to iron your clothes.. The carpet was worse but wait till you read this.... The bathroom is so bad that my husband almost broke his leg by slipping on the greasy tiles.... also the toilet does not flush you have to manually pour water in the tank sometimes .. I would never get back to this hotel.. Its just not worth the money and you personal safety!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Deal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel using travelaxe, checked the reviews on tripadvisor, and pulled the trigger. We stayed four nights at the Grand Union at an amazingly low price of $520. This was our fourth trip to New York and our fourth hotel. I have paid $200 a night for a national chain hotel in the past, never again. The Grand Union is the best hotel for the money in New York. The hotel is very clean and the bathroom was spotless. The majority of hotels in this price range in New York are very small and only offer a shared bath. We stayed on the sixth floor and didn't have one problem with noise the entire trip. The airconditioner kept the room cool and comfortable. The mini fridge came in handy. You are less than 30 yards from the subway stop. We walked back to the hotel after 1am almost every night, the neighborhood is safe. You cannot beat the location, Herald square is a 5 minute walk from the Grand Union, a 24 hour drug store less than a 2 minute walk, and plenty of places to eat. Those that have given this hotel a bad review must have expected a door man and a mint on their pillow every night, not for less than $150 a night in New York. We wanted a place to sleep and take a shower, we didn't spend more than 8 hours a day in the hotel, we came to see the city, not look at the four walls of a hotel room or watch television. Don't waste your money on a national chain hotel, stay at the Grand Union, you will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location/price/service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a five-day stay at the Grand Union Hotel. Besides the great price, it's a lovely hotel. Yes, our room (one double bed) was small, BUT this is New York after all. Although, getting a glimpse into a room that would hold a family, it looked quite large. The room was clean and more than functional. Front desk personnel were very accomodating. The location is phenomenal. Central to everything - shopping, restaurants, cafes. This is the hotel for you if you'd rather spend your hard-earned money on shopping, eating, and roaming the streets of New York. This hotel is NOT for you if you want room service, ice machines, valet parking and men that will carry your luggage for you. We (two women who love to shop and visit restaurants) loved the hotel and will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat it for the money”
Reviews.Author: Parf
Reviews.Content: First of all let's talk location. It's next to 33rd St subway which is one stop to Grand Central and takes you downtown to Little Italy & Chinatown without changing lines. It is two blocks from the Empire State. There are good delis and the usually selection of restaurants (although you have to look harder for them). You are also right next to Madison. The area was clean and safe considering this is NYC! The staff seem to be part of the same extended family and don't have English as their first language but, again, this is NYC. I always found them courteous and well organised. There is a good breakfast place next door, internet available, soft seating, a restroom and luggage room downstairs. The rooms are bigger than I expected and are comparable to your average European hotel room. The air con wasn't that effective but at least it was there! In short I'd recommend this place. You won't find better for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was on a budget for my trip to NY with my girlfriend and from all the reviews that I read from tripadvisor I decided to chose this hotel as overall this hotel seemed a good chose. We spent 4 nights at the Grand Union Hotel and I couldn't of got a better place to stay for my first trip to New York. The location is great and its so close to the Empire State and Macy's and also walking distance to Times square. The Hotel was clean and the rooms were of a good size. There is a great cafe next to the Hotel where we went virtually every morning as in my opinion there was not a nicer place to have breakfast, as everyone was friendly and the food was good. I would visit this Hotel again as its value for money and then you have more money to spend. Its an ideal place to stay if your on a budget and not planning to spend too much time in the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I know one thing for sure I'll never stay another night in that hotel. I was given a room which must have been a broom closet before, there was NO DAYLIGHT at all, a warm water pipe, which was hardly isolated going right through the room made the whole room feel like a sauna, it also smelled bad and the room was all in all pretty seedy. Furthermore the staff was unfriendly and not helpful at all when asked for advice.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Rori74
Reviews.Content: I think the Grand Union Hotel is great for the price. It may not be the fanciest or biggest hotel but it is clean and in a good location. If your looking for a hotel and donâ€™t want to spend big bucks then this is the place for you. Save your money for Macyâ€™s.

Reviews.Title: “Best deal, very good location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Compared to the many other Hotels in N.Y. - and especially on Manhatten, This must be the hotel with the best location - and the price taken into considereation you get some of the best rooms (the best value for money). You won't get swimming pools, parkview or skyline.. but to get something like that in Manhatten you will have to pay 10 times more than this hotel. If you are in new york to stay in a comfortable hotel and want to spend all your money on hotels, go somewhere else... BUT if you just want a nice CLEAN room, Incredible service and great location - THIS IS THE PLACE TO BE. We stayed for a week, and were very pleased... we will stay there again next time... Oh, and when you do go there.. the dinere locatede next to lobby is excelent for breakfast before heading up to Empire State, Macys or any of the other "attractations" - right there next to the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great and clean”
Reviews.Author: Jokke
Reviews.Content: Nice price and just a minute to the most tourist place around. Clean room (but small) and very nice staff. Our room to the backyard was silent. Smart reservation by internet for us Swedish folks.. No breakfast...sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for Budget”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Grand Union Hotel isn't perfect, but we couldn't have been in at better place during the last 10 days. The price is for that location more than good and what the most important thing is: The rooms we had have been really clean. The stuff was friendly and helped us when there was a problem. I will come back and recommand it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Recent visit”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well located, between Park and Madison Avenues, two blocks down from Empire State Building, good for access to all parts of the city. 33rd Street Metro entrance within a 100 yards. Room adequate without being overlarge (not a major issue for anyone planning to spend time out and about sightseeing), bathroom good, plenty of hot water, clean towels everyday. Late April was cold on occasions and central heating was not effective - but our friends located in a room at the back of the hotel found it too hot and asked to be moved. Our room at the front of the hotel suffered from street noise in the early hours - never established if it was the refuse collectors or deliveries to the Fed-Ex depot a couple of doors down the street - but it was very loud. Cafe attached to the hotel served reasonable breakfasts, though we gravitated to the Brooklyn Bagel a little further away. Minus point was absence of tea/coffee making facilities in the room. Staff accommodating without being overfriendly - not an issue. New lounge opened while we were there - if they ever install a bar it would be perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: SimonBenson
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed our small, slightly outdated, no view, room in the Grand Union. What's the point of a hotel room? In my case somewhere to sleep or recover from what's going on outside... 5th Avenue and the Empire State building just a stone's throw away, subway about half a block (if you walk in the right direction!), we found a couple of great restaurants less than 5 minutes away and the diner 'in' the hotel wasn't too bad either. Great being able to get online from the lounge in the hotel too. We'd certainly go back if looking for another cheap hotel break in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpectedly seedy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In the past I'd stayed at hotels rated at 2 stars that were actually OK -- clean, no frills -- but I was surprised to find this hotel to be downright seedy. First forewarning: Upon check in, the clerk handed me a TV remote control (??), which I was told I needed to return at checkout (? Who on earth steals a remote control?). I don't mind a small room, but this was very crammed together, barely big enough for the bed. It was dusty smelling. The TV console was against the wall next to the door, so to view you'd be sitting on floor in front of bathroom door. Heat was on full blast and it was sweltering....I removed the creaky, very dusty panel on top of radiator & was able to turn it off. Then went into bathroom and was greeted by a lovely centipede in tub, and there was dust on windowsill. Faucets in sink dispensed low pressure water. Also, even though these were not things I needed, there were listed amenities that were not in the room: alarm clock (none), hair dryer (none), data/modem connection (none). Last but not least, when checking out I was not given a receipt, and when I asked for one was told that the 'internet people are responsible for that' -- I'd booked online. This was definitely a first. Sadly, after this experience I'm no longer willing to risk anything rated less than 3 stars....

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: hm60
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent visitor to NYC, and generally stay in budget hotels. I was fortunate to get a room here at the last minute, after having read the generally positive reviews on this site. I was generally satisfied with my accomodation, and saved over over $40/night compared to what I had originally booked for a smaller room at a similar-class hotel in the same neighbourhood. As previous guests have noted, the hotel has very recently been refurbished. The carpeting and furniture appeared fairly new. The carpeting in particular was probably installed within the last month. Unfortunately, it already had some cigarette burns. That's not the fault of the hotel of course, but the availability of non-smoking rooms would help. (Despite the sign in the lobby re a non-smoking environment, I was advised that no rooms have been designated non-smoking). My room did not have a smoke smell, except on two occasions when I did smell smoke from neighbouring rooms. The bed was comfortable and the housekeeping excellent...very friendly and cooperative. (Remember to leave a tip for good service!). The new TV functioned well, and had HBO (not that I used it very much). Having a fridge in the room was a definite plus, and something that usually is only available in similar class (2*) hotels in NYC for an extra fee. Hairdryers are available at the desk. I did not need to use the A/C when I was there. (The unit in the window appeared quite old). The nights were chilly and I could have used stronger heat. It probably was sufficient for most though. The location was convenient...close to a subway stop, and Fifth Avenue. All in all, I would strongly recommend this hotel if budget accomodation is what you're looking for and the absence of non-smoking rooms is not an issue for you. If the hotel maintains the property well, it should continue to be a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The room was dark and dingy. One of the lights didn't work, the A/C didn't work, so we were sweaty and sticky every night. There was a dead cockroach lying in the florescent light fixture overhead. The bed comforter was gross and scary. The price and location were good, the staff was nice, but we would have paid a little more for better quality. I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, clean & a fabulous bargain!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For this price, I was a little anxious about what I was getting myself into... I could not afford a plan B so I made the reservation and hoped for the best! After staying there for nearly a week, I'm now pleased to report that the Grand Union is very clean, quiet and a great value for the money. Though I didn't realize it at the time, it's also quite conveniently located -- anything mid-town is walkable and it's just a short way to Penn Station where you can catch just about any train. Don't be scared, give it a try!

Reviews.Title: “Great Find”
Reviews.Author: dctravels13
Reviews.Content: Have been to the "grand onion" as my son calls it, twice. Once with one kid, the second time with two kids. Both stays were great. The first time the room was quite small and oddly shaped .. little alcove with a fridge. We were one the second floor and our window overlooked the airshaft, kind of ugly, so we kept the curtain closed. Nice bathroom with pretty tile everywhere. Was perfect for our trip. The second time we got a huge room, with two twins and a double bed. Cost a bit more than the first room, maybe 30 bucks more. It was so worth it to have so much space .. really two connected rooms with a wide opening between, and the nice bath with the same pretty tile. Yes, the elevator is the slowest one on the planet I agree, but that's ok .. we hoofed it alot up & down the stairs. We liked the diner next door and went there for breakfast a lot, eggs, french toast etc. basic and just fine, really nice folks work there. We take the train to NY so it's perfect to walk from Penn Station right to the hotel. We ride the bus a lot when we're there (the kids like the subway but I want to see everything I can whenever I'm in NY .. guess who wins those discussions :) . all transportation is convenient. and coming up to it from the outside, I just think its a lovely building, a little gem, welcoming me!

Reviews.Title: “Great location & price. Otherwise, not that great.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked our six nights through Hotels. The check-in was quick and easy. The room was very small and hot when we first arrived. Luckily, there are (noisy) air-conditioners installed in every room, so the temperature was quickly fixed. The rooms are very clean and very tiny. Bed was very comfortable. Our biggest complaint comes from a incident that happened on the third day at 7 AM. We were still asleep when we woke up in the sound of water splashing on our bathroom floor. I found out the water was coming from upstairs through the ceiling. The water stank bad and sure enough I called the reception right away. They promised to fix the problem ASAP and they surely fixed the leakage quickly, but nobody ever came to clean up the mess in our bathroom (even though they said the problem was fixed). So, a big negative remark for the service in this situation. Also, we never saw any of the receptionists smiling during our stay, so it was not the most pleasant customer service experience altogether. The rooms are clean (unless you count the bad smelling water pouring from upstairs) and the location is great, less than 50 meters from a metro stop and 100 meters from Empire State building. There is a low-cost internet connection in the lobby. The rooms have fridges which is nice. Our room was quiet which meant it had a lousy view. I would'n go there a second time because of lack of smiles and poor reaction to the aforementioned problem situation. If you have the money, go to a "real" hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just superb”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Small (90 room) hotel and solid built. Lots of upgrading going on while we were there (quietly). Good room - yes on the small side and with a 4'6'' double bed - but hey - we were there for my wifes 50th birthday - made our holiday, being that close together :) Clean, loads of towels, hot water, great front of house service - as was housekeeping (we were there 3 nights). Location cannot be beaten for this price. Free safety deposit box. Helpful advice on where to go and how to get there. Little diner next to hotel - didnt fancy it one bit - just didnt look that clean and had a very restricted menu - but that isnt the hotels fault. 5 minute walk to Empire State building - just off 5th Avenue (SHOPPING). Bout a 10/15 minute walk to Macey's (SHOPPING) - get the '6' train (just round the corner) to Greenwich village, Canal St, Little Italy, China Town, Battery Park and the Statten Island ferry ( which is FREE) Give this hotel a go - well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for three days. Very clean room and lobby. It was very functional and the price was quite a steal for the location, easy access to subway, safety, and central location for site-seeing. There was always hot water and the staff helped us locate a car service. Excellent deli on the corner Brookly Bagel Cafe and just blocks from the Empire State building. It is a no-frills hotel, but outstanding for budget minded.

Reviews.Title: “overpriced”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Rooms extremely small. Appeared to be an updated version of a hostel. I requested a non-smoking room and of course I got all the smoke I didnt want and then some. It appeared as if they squeezed the bed and the armoire into the room. Just enough room to walk around the bed. A lot of transients around. Would not recommend unless the rooms were priced below $100.00

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: luv2holiday
Reviews.Content: We booked a room in September 2004 at the Grand Union Hotel for 7 nights. I originally booked online, but then found out that if I called the hotel directly, I could get the 7th nite free. I called the hotel and they verified this, but reminded me to make sure I cancelled my online reservation so that I did not have two reservations. After a 5 1/2 hour flight which arrived in the late evening we made our way from Penn Station to the Grand Union, only to find out they had no reservation for us. The young man at he desk just kept repeating to me that we had cancelled our reservations and that the hotel was full. I was almost in tears, as I had booked this hotel 3 months previous and had no idea where I would even start looking for another place to stay within the same budget. Finally I remembered I had a piece of paper in my luggage to prove the reservation had been made, so the desk clerk finally gave in and told me that he did have one room left for emergency situations, but only for one nite, as the hotel was booked solid for the following nite. I was steaming by that point and headed up the slowest elevator I have ever been on to the top floor of the hotel to a grungy little room in the back of the building. The next morning I was up bright and early to talk to the manager at the front desk. He was much more accomodating than the young man I had dealt with the previous nite and told me not to worry, they would let us honor our reservation. We did end up staying there for the rest of our trip, but the whole ordeal left a bad taste in my mouth. For a New York budget hotel, I would take the Super 8 Times Square over the Grand Union anyday!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base for NY visit”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights last weekend, and hotel has all basic requirements for an NY stay. An older hotel, room quite small but very clean - just right for a few nights in the city. Staff very helpful and polite, rates excellent for a 32nd St location. Would definitely recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Consider the Cost”
Reviews.Author: tyedye33
Reviews.Content: The Grand Union Hotel is terrific considering the reasonable price. The rooms are small, the bathrooms are quite nice and the location is central. The only problem... the room was very warm, but you can turn the heat off and open the windows. It is New York City if you do not need to spend a great deal of time in your room (if you do you should reconsider your choice of trip) and want to save a money it is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Grand Union”
Reviews.Author: ktjnemo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in January 2005. Room was small but very clean. No view- but who cares- go outside. Close enough to everything. Elevator. Excellent, reasonably priced diner right in the hotel. Our room was a triple for $120. plus taxes. Parking in a garage up the street (about $25.00 a day). Stored our luggage on our last day for no fee. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I thought the hotel was pretty good. The Desk clerks that i saw were pretty good looking. They were nice and pleasent. The room was clean, but there was no view at all. What was seen outside the window was nothing. the room was extremely small, but was good if you only wanted a place to sleep and freshen up. the hotel is off 5th ave, by the empire state building. It was close to the Big Macy's and also to Rockefeller center and central park, if you didnt mind the walking. This hotel was pleasent to stay

Reviews.Title: “That's no lady, that's my roach!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Union for 6 nights mid January 2005. On checking in I noticed a cockroach crawling over my bag. I complained to the desk manager and he advised that it was not one of theirs and that I must have brought it in with me. Now I didn't knowingly bring a roach along for the ride, but who knows, it's possible - I didn't see any other insects during my stay. The room was small but reasonably clean, grubby under the bed (I was checking for roaches) - but perhaps it's grubby under most hotel beds, I don't usually look. Overall this was a pretty good deal - it's a good location for say a stroll to the Empire State building and the very local subway gets you up and down the eastside and on to connecting lines with ease. There are three internet terminals in the lobby - there is a charge for these but they are fast, handy and not exorbitant for checking e-mails. East 32nd street has some good Korean restaurants - I recommend Don's Bo Gam at no. 17 which has a modern but cosy bar on entering and good food in the restaurant beyond. It's friendly and relaxing and very close to the Grand Union.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a location, my boyfriend and myself moved here on our 3rd day in New York.Staying there from the 3-7th Feb - Four nights in total. We didn't relise it was so central and convieniant for our trip, which was mainly all hot spots in the city. Its justs a few blocks from the empire State and pretty close to Times Square etc.... Prefect for a tourist holiday! The rooms were also very very clean and nice and cosy. I slept like a log every night no noice or nothing which i was surprised about!! All in all the Hotel was very nice and we enjoyed our stay.....

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel”
Reviews.Author: manchestershopaholic
Reviews.Content: Just got back from grand union, fab hotel, great value. We stayed in a double room, room was larger than I expected with room for a table and chairs as well as bed, wardrobe & tv. The room was really clean, warm and cosy. It was quiet and the bed was extremely comfortable. I would definitley recomend!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, a decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed there from 3rd Feb 2005 for 5 nights. Location was excellent, 33rd street subway station right by its door step. It's one stop from Grand Central. Hotel itself is a few minutes' walk from the Empire State Building. It has an excellent internet service, so I can always check e-mails. Heating on the other hand wasn't always reliable. But I guess if you go in spring time or in the summer it won't matter. Shower's always hot. Staff at the Cafe were friendly, good breakfast menu.

Reviews.Title: “great base for a short visit to NY”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Grand Union for 3 nights last week on a short break in New York. We were on a sightseeing/shopping trip and our only requirements were a central location in a safe area as we not planning to spend much time in the hotel. We stayed during the snowy spell and the room was always warm with plenty of hot water. The only noise i heard during our stay was a humming noise from the fridge which I sorted by plugging it out. OK The rooms are small and basic but room and bathroom were very clean. Overall if like us, you are looking for a base, i could not fault the Grand Union

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, clean and cheerful but no thrills! A few issues..”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: OK I'm from England and I have stayed in many US hotels, although none in NYC. I was surprised that a <$100 hotel would be so comfortable, the double room, whilst small, was perfectly fine for myself and partner and we both slept well every night (5 in total). Pros - Cheap, very cheap only beaten by some hotels offering no ensuite - Great location, close to all the amenities, just 2 blocks from the Empire State and less than a 10 minute walk to Penn station, I cannot stress how great the location was!! - Very helpful staff, they assisted with booking a cab to JFK, giving advice on postal costs to the UK AND, above the call of duty I felt, actually offered to post my postcard back because I was running late!!! - It was clean and the service was very efficient - Fridge in the room! Cons - We were on the 3rd floor and the shower was very variable in temperature, some days it would be fine the next it would go hot and cold all the time and it was hard to have one. I have to stress that there was always hot water and baths were always possible. It seemed to be a toilet flushing in another room causing it. - Walls were very thin and you could hear other rooms, especially a noisey neighbour who seemed to have a lot of guests. - As other reviews state there is no alarm clock or clock at all in fact but you can book a wake up call through reception. No clock but did have a fridge... go figure that! All in all I would be more than happy to recommend this hotel to anyone, the plus points more than out weigh the gripes and all the cons are just minor niggles, even the shower was bearable, more annoying than anything else.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, clean, friendly staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: Orleans_Deb
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the room and the service, especially given the very low price (about $100 US). They were kind enough to give us a room with a bit of a view of the Empire State Building when we asked for it. It is only about 2 blocks away. Also, they were very accommodating when we needed to leave our luggage in their luggage room a week AFTER our stay there (when our cruise ended and before our flight home). This gave us a chance to explore New York for a few more hours. The rating reflects the value for the location and the exemplary service. We would also recommend eating at The Barking Dog, a few blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for the Price”
Reviews.Author: FLL_954
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with two friends last November. We requested and recieved a Quad wihch had 2 twin beds and 1 queen bed. This way we all had our own place. The room was good size and clean which when you consider what we paid was excellent. The part of town is good. It's close to the #6 line so you can go anywhere with ease. It was a good experience and I'd stay there again. Noise was only an issue on Friday afternoon they were working on something behind the hotel and there was a lot of Banging going on. Easily fixed I was in NYC why would I be in my room anyway. Oh and there was a mini fridge in the room which came in handy.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal”
Reviews.Author: grb29
Reviews.Content: We spent forever trying to decide on a hotel for our week long stay in NYC and finally decided on the Grand Union, as the price was right, the location looked good and the other comments on this webpage were positive. On arrival we were pleasantly surprised. The hotel was spotlessly clean, the room was a great size and there was a maid service everyday with fresh towels daily. There was a really good mix of people in the hotel, no one looked 'dodgy' and they ranged from families to older people to young backpackers. The hotel is 2 blocks from the Empire State Building (3 mins walk) and an ideal walking location to anywhere. If going a little further, the metro station for the Green line (a well served line) is 30 seconds walk away. We never tried the 'in-hotel' diner, but it seemed popular. We got to know a bagel seller around the corner on Park avenue where we got a bagel, and a tropicana for $2. He was right next to a fruit seller which had really cheap, fab fruit!! We would really recommend this. (Sets u up for the day!) There's loads of places around to eat. We frequented Maui Taco a few times - Right next to the empire state building and opposite is a large Bagel deli that serves hot and cold food and does fab sandwiches (like most places in New York!) Sorry abt the rambling! As you can see we really enjoyed our stay and the Grand Union just topped it off! Would thoroughly recommend it. PS. If you're going to visit the Metropolitan Museum of Art, try and make it there on a Friday night, they have a string quartet and pianist playing in the upstairs gallery after 5pm, and the roof/sculpture garden becomes a very New York style Cocktail terrace where the Upper East Side types come for after work drinks and you can watch the sun set over Central Park! Is very New York!!

Reviews.Title: “Fine Budget Place”
Reviews.Author: rabatabar
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights here at end of September. Good location. Good bright front lobby, helpful staff and handy internet lounge (2 dollars for 10 min -- can be multiple sessions). All spotless. Room was spacious and clean and daily maid service was excellent. Furnishings are a little dated but comfortable. Good modern and spacious bathroom. Quiet fridge in room. Air con unit was modern and quiet too. No remote for TV, but not there to watch TV. I asked for room at back (was on 6th floor), so did not have much of a view, but that meant no traffic/street noise. Lobby only had 3 other rooms, so not disturbed by other guests plus shielded from elevator noise by internal door. Combination made sleeping easy -- which was not the case at the more expensive Radisson earlier in the year. Paid 75 sterling a night incl tax (via Expedia). Would stay again. Nearby liked the Ginger Man bar on East 36th and 5th and the Blue Smoke/Jazz Standard on East 27th (off Park I believe). Artisanal restaurant across the road from hotel was good and very popular -- so long as you like cheese.

Reviews.Title: “An enjoyable NYC experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Union for 4 nights in August 2004, and were pleasantly surprised at what we found. The Grand Union is in a great location - steps away from a subway station and bus stop, and around the corner from the Empire State Building and Macy's. The hotel is also connected to a cafe which opens at 7am, and has a good variety of inexpensive food. We arrived at the hotel 2 hours before check-in time, but the room was ready for us anyway. It was cleaned well every day. The bathrooms were clean, but there was some mould along the tile. We were on the top floor and faced the back, and it was very quiet at night. On our last day, we didn't need to leave until 4pm, which is past the checkout time, but we were able to store our luggage in their locked storage room for the few hours for no fee. In addition, the Hotel ordered a car to take us to the airport for the same fee as a taxi. All in all, we recommend this hotel. At $120 USD/night for a double room (with one double and one single bed), we thought the price was a little expensive, but worth it for the location and cleanliness. We plan on staying here again the next time we come to New York City. Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Sensory Deprivation Chamber (Good!)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Union for two nights in August 2004. Contrary to my advance apprehensions, it was not a converted grocery store. Our room (712) was a small one with a double bed, matte gray walls, gray carpet, and a very small window overlooking the airshaft. In short, an ambienece of zero. But the interior location and thick plaster walls meant that it was quiet. It was our own little sensory deprivation chamber in the midst of NYC , so we slept very soundly. The bathroom - all marble with a large tub - was nicer than the room. Kudos to the cleaning staff; the bathroom was sparkling clean. The neighborhood is fine. Our favorite restaurants in the area were the Barking Dog (on 34th near Park), and DaCiro (on Lexington near 34th), and the bakery on the southwest corner of 28th and Park, which had excellent chocolate croissants. The Grand Union is plain jane, but good value in a good location.
